|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121205062908/http://www.madametussaudswaxmuseum.com/branches/madame-tussauds-london.htm |dead-url=yes |archive-date=December 5, 2012 |title=Madame Tussauds London |publisher=Madame Tussauds |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://starpittsburgh.cbslocal.com/photo-galleries/2011/10/14/watching-christina-aguilera-grow-xtina-through-the-years/justin-christina-wax-figures-arrive-at-madame-tussauds-to-open-club-mtny/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402103020/http://starpittsburgh.cbslocal.com/photo-galleries/2011/10/14/watching-christina-aguilera-grow-xtina-through-the-years/justin-christina-wax-figures-arrive-at-madame-tussauds-to-open-club-mtny/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=April 2, 2015|title=Justin & Christina Wax Figures Arrive At Madame Tussauds To Open Club MTNY|publisher=[[WBZZ-HD2]]|date=October 14, 2011|accessdate=August 27, 2015}}</ref>
==Legacy== {{see also|List of awards and nominations received by Christina Aguilera}} Aguilera has sold 37.9 million records in the United States,<ref name="AskBillboardCareer">{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6236538/ask-billboard-taylor-swift-out-shakes-mariah-carey?page=0%2C3|title=Ask Billboard: Taylor Swift Out-'Shake's Mariah Carey|first=Gary|last=Trust|work=Billboard|date=September 1, 2014|accessdate=February 10, 2015}}</ref> and over 75 million albums and singles worldwide.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://vaaju.com/romaniaeng/christina-aguilera-topless-for-the-cover-of-her-new-album-photo/|title=Christina Aguilera, topless for the cover of her new album |work=[[Mediafax]]|date=June 21, 2018 |accessdate=August 3, 2018}}</ref> Gregory Hicks from ''[[The Michigan Daily]]'' opined that "Aguilera deserves to be known as one of the greatest artists to ever hit the pop industry."<ref>{{cite web|last=Hicks|first=Gregory|url=http://www.michigandaily.com/arts/step-salon-christina-aquilera?page=0,0|title=Step into the Salon: Christina Aguilera's controversial pop legend status|work=[[The Michigan Daily]]|date=January 25, 2012|accessdate=June 13, 2013}}</ref> In 2012, [[VH1]] named Aguilera the eighth greatest woman in the music industry.<ref>{{cite web|last=Graham|first=Mark|url=http://www.vh1.com/music/tuner/2012-02-13/100-greatest-women-in-music/94/|title=The 100 Greatest Women In Music|publisher=VH1|date=February 13, 2012|accessdate=May 13, 2013}}</ref> Aguilera has also been recognized as one of the greatest vocalists of all time,<ref name="Popsugar">{{cite news|title=Christina Aguilera Named Best Vocalist By Cove|work=popdirtdaily|date=May 25, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-body/news/christina-aguilera-continues-weight-loss-cleavage-new-promo-the-voice-picture-20131010|title=Christina Aguilera Continues to Show Off Weight Loss, Cleavage in New Promo For The Voice: Picture|first=Rachel|last=McRady|work=Us Weekly|date=October 10, 2013|accessdate=August 1, 2014}}</ref> and is commonly referred to as "The Voice of a Generation".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/09/21/alma-awards-2012-winners-_n_1905245.html|title=ALMA Awards 2012|work=The Huffington Post|date=September 21, 2012|accessdate=August 1, 2014}}</ref> Aguilera topped Cove magazine's list of "The 100 Outstanding Pop Vocalists".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://popdirt.com/christina-aguilera-named-best-vocalist-by-cove/33315/|title=Christina Aguilera Named Best Vocalist By Cove - popdirt.com|website=popdirt.com|accessdate=June 21, 2018}}</ref> She was ranked fifth in MTV and [[Blender (magazine)|Blender]] magazine's 2003 countdown of the 22 Greatest Voices in Music.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://forum.songfacts.com/index.php?/topic/9288-22-greatest-voices-in-music/|title=22 Greatest Voices in Music|website=Songfacts Forums|accessdate=June 21, 2018}}</ref> In November 2008, ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' placed Aguilera at number 58 on its list of 100 Greatest Singers of All Time, writing that "[Aguilera] has had the finesse and power of a blues queen ever since she was a child star".<ref name="RS">{{cite news|title=100 Greatest Singers of All Time: Christina Aguilera|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/100-greatest-singers-of-all-time-19691231/christina-aguilera-20101202|date=November 27, 2008|work=Rolling Stone|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140705143029/http://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/100-greatest-singers-of-all-time-19691231/christina-aguilera-20101202|archivedate=July 5, 2014}}</ref> At the [[2013 People's Choice Awards]], Aguilera was awarded the People's Voice Award, which recognized Aguilera's ability to reach millions of people across various genres.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1699242/christina-aguilera-peoples-choice-awards/|title=Christina Aguilera Goes From 'The Voice' To People's Choice|first=Jocelyn|last=Vena|publisher=MTV News|date=December 20, 2012|accessdate=August 1, 2014}}</ref> In 2013, Aguilera was one of ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''{{'}}s 100 Most Influential People in the World. In the article for the magazine, [[Celine Dion]] wrote, "Without a doubt, [Aguilera]'s one of the most talented artists the world has ever seen and heard, and I think she's going to continue to amaze us for many, many years to come."<ref name="Influential">{{cite news |url=http://time100.time.com/2013/04/18/time-100/slide/christina-aguilera/ |title=Christina Aguilera: The 2013 Time 100 |work=Time |first=Celine |last=Dion |date=April 18, 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130419081239/http://time100.time.com/2013/04/18/time-100/slide/christina-aguilera/ |archivedate=April 19, 2013}}</ref>
[[File:Xtina star walk of fame.jpg|right|160px|thumb|Aguilera's star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]], which she received in 2010]]
Aguilera is also well known for her television and music video impact; in 2012, Jon Caramanica of ''The New York Times'' commented that Aguilera "will be remembered for her glamour, her scandalous take on femme-pop and her [[Brobdingnag]]ian voice, and ... as the person who almost single-handedly reshaped music-competition reality programming".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/09/18/arts/music/how-christina-aguilera-changed-judging-of-reality-tv-music.html|title=How Christina Aguilera Changed Judging of Reality TV Music|date=September 17, 2012|accessdate=June 13, 2013|work=The New York Times|first=Jon|last=Caramanica}}</ref> She was considered as one of the greatest women of the music video era by VH1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vh1.com/photos/gallery/?fid=1477005&page=2&thumbnails=true |title=50 Greatest Women Of the Video Era |publisher=VH1 |accessdate=May 13, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130523054154/http://www.vh1.com/photos/gallery/?fid=1477005&page=2&thumbnails=true |archivedate=May 23, 2013 |df= }}</ref> Aguilera's use of sexual imagery has catalyzed public discourse on sexuality and feminism. Rhiannon Lucy Cosslett, co-founder of ''[[The Vagenda]]'', opined that the provocative dance routines in Aguilera's music videos are "empowering".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2013/oct/07/miley-cyrus-music-business-women-sinead-oconnor|title=Miley Cyrus: does the music business exploit women?|work=The Guardian|date=October 7, 2013|accessdate=August 2, 2014}}</ref> Writing for [[The Hampton Institute]], critic Terry Young, Jr. commented that Aguilera "redefined the 21st century female pop performer". He added that following the release of ''Stripped'', "artists like Spears and [[Beyoncé]] became more comfortable expressing sexuality and no longer felt the need to sell the notion of innocence".<ref>{{cite web|last=Young, Jr.|first=Terry|url=http://www.hamptoninstitution.org/revisiting-stripped.html |title=Revisiting ''Stripped'': How Christina Aguilera Challenged Notions of Feminism and Sexuality|publisher=[[The Hampton Institute]]|date=May 22, 2014|accessdate=May 26, 2013}}</ref> Aguilera's works have earned her numerous [[List of awards and nominations received by Christina Aguilera|awards and accolades]], including five [[Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.grammy.com/artist/christina-aguilera|title=Christina Aguilera Artist|publisher=[[Grammy Awards]]|accessdate=August 3, 2014}}</ref> In November 2010, Aguilera was honored with a star on the [[Hollywood Walk of Fame]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/950886/christina-aguilera-gets-star-on-hollywood-walk-of-fame |title=Christina Aguilera Gets Star on Hollywood Walk of Fame |date=November 15, 2010 |work=Billboard |accessdate=August 3, 2014}}</ref> In October 2012, Aguilera's costumes and video collection was included on the "Women Who Rock" exhibition by the [[National Museum of Women in the Arts]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/10/28/arts/artsspecial/women-who-rock-exhibit-traces-female-music-artists-in-america.html|work=The New York Times|first=Elizabeth|last=Olson|title='Women Who Rock' Exhibit Traces Female Music Artists in America|date=October 26, 2012|accessdate=August 3, 2014}}</ref> Aguilera has inspired various artists, Lady Gaga cited Aguilera and her cover of All-4-One's "I Turn to You" as an inspiration for Gaga's vocal range, elaborating; "When I was 15, I was singing "I Turn to You" at the top of my lungs. She was an inspiration to me to have a wider vocal range."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/491950/christina-aguilera-and-lady-gaga-perform-on-the-voice-effectively-putting-feud-rumors-to-rest|title=Christina Aguilera and Lady Gaga Perform on The Voice, Effectively Putting Feud Rumors to Rest|work=E! Online|publisher=E!|first=Zach|last=Johnson|date=December 18, 2013|accessdate=January 25, 2014}}</ref> Demi Lovato explained that she was inspired by Aguilera's themes, "I had a lot of respect for Whitney Houston, and Christina Aguilera, on some songs where she was really amazing and wasn't trying to be sexy or anything like that. I just found that I had more respect for artists that didn't talk about that stuff, and those were the ones that were more successful."<ref name="DemiQ&A" /> Aguilera's works has also inspired some athletes, including American figure skater [[Johnny Weir]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.windycitymediagroup.com/gay/lesbian/news/ARTICLE.php?AID=30675 |title=Johnny Weir lets us in his 'World' |publisher=Windy City Media Group |accessdate=May 13, 2013}}</ref> and American swimmer [[Dana Vollmer]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Abel|first=Alex|url=http://www.seventeen.com/health/fitness/dana-vollmer-motivation-tips|title=Dana Vollmer Success Tips (Interview)|work=[[Seventeen (American magazine)|Seventeen]]|date=February 18, 2013|accessdate=May 13, 2013}}</ref>
==Personal life== During [[Christina Aguilera in Concert]] tour, Aguilera was involved in a romantic relationship with dancer Jorge Santos, which ultimately ended in September 2001.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://content.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1000774,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022174651/http://content.time.com/time/magazine/article/0%2C9171%2C1000774%2C00.html |title=What a Woman Wants |first=Elaine |last=Rivera |work=Time |date=September 15, 2001 |archivedate=October 22, 2013 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Aguilera began dating marketing executive Jordan Bratman in 2003, and became engaged in February 2005 after two years together.<ref name="Marries">{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1131176,00.html|title=Christina Aguilera Marries|work=People|date=November 18, 2005|accessdate=October 21, 2013}}</ref> The couple married on November 19, 2005 at an estate in [[Napa County, California]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.msn.com/en-us/music/celebrity/christina-aguileras-highs-and-lows/ss-BBgQqMJ#image=9|title=Christina Aguilera's Highs and Lows|publisher=[[MSN]]|accessdate=February 23, 2015}}</ref> On January 12, 2008, Aguilera gave birth to a son with Bratman.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1579535/christina-aguilera-gives-birth-to-baby-boy/|title=Christina Aguilera Gives Birth to Baby Boy|publisher=MTV News|date=January 13, 2008|accessdate=January 13, 2018}}</ref>
Aguilera and Bratman separated in September 2010. Aguilera filed for divorce from Bratman in October, requesting joint legal and physical custody of their son.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Fleeman|first1=Mike|first2=Ulrica|last2=Wihlborg |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20434117,00.html| title=Christina Aguilera Files for Divorce|work=People|date=October 14, 2010|accessdate=July 8, 2014}}</ref> After reaching a private settlement and custody deal, their divorce was finalized on April 15, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vh1.com/celebrity/2011-04-15/christina-aguileras-divorce-finalized-today/ |title=Christina Aguilera's Divorce Finalized Today |publisher=VH1 |first=Liz |last=Black |date=April 15, 2011 |accessdate=February 23, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150224150211/http://www.vh1.com/celebrity/2011-04-15/christina-aguileras-divorce-finalized-today/ |archivedate=February 24, 2015 |df= }}</ref>
Aguilera concurrently began a romantic relationship with Matthew Rutler, who served as an assistant on the set of ''[[Burlesque (2010 American film)|Burlesque]]''.<ref name="Engaged">{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/christina-aguilera-engaged-boyfriend-matt-rutler-article-1.1615176|title=Christina Aguilera engaged to boyfriend Matt Rutler, reveals massive ring on Twitter|work=New York Daily News|first=Nina|last=Golgowski|date=February 14, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140215032645/http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/christina-aguilera-engaged-boyfriend-matt-rutler-article-1.1615176|archivedate=February 15, 2014}}</ref> On March 1, 2011, the couple was arrested for [[public intoxication]] in [[West Hollywood]].<ref>{{cite web|work=Los Angeles Times|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/gossip/2011/03/christina-aguilera-arrested-boyfriend-matthew-rutler-dui.html|first=Christie|last=D'Zurilla|title=Christina Aguilera arrested, released|date=March 1, 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110304225559/http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/gossip/2011/03/christina-aguilera-arrested-boyfriend-matthew-rutler-dui.html|archivedate=March 4, 2011}}</ref> They were later released on bail and no charges were filed.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Mann|first1=Camille|title=Christina Aguilera arrested for public drunkenness, say reports|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/christina-aguilera-arrested-for-public-drunkenness-say-reports/|accessdate=June 15, 2014|publisher=CBS News|date=March 1, 2011}}</ref>
Aguilera became engaged to Rutler in February 2014. She gave birth to their daughter in August 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/gossip/la-et-mg-christina-aguilera-baby-girl-name-matthew-rutler-20140818-story.html|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|date=August 18, 2014|accessdate=August 18, 2014|title=Christina Aguilera welcomes, names new baby girl with Matthew Rutler|first=Christie|last=D'Zurilla}}</ref>
==Other ventures==
===Philanthropy=== In 2000, Aguilera supported a program called Come on Over and Do Something, which aimed to "encourage kids to get involved in their communities and make a difference."<ref>{{cite web|accessdate=April 27, 2013 |url=http://www.sptimes.com/News/100200/Xpress/What_a_girl_wants__is.shtml |title=What a girl wants ... is for kids to help their community |work=[[The St. Petersburg Times]] |first=Ally |last=Sikora |date=October 2, 2000 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140819090145/http://www.sptimes.com/News/100200/Xpress/What_a_girl_wants__is.shtml |archivedate=August 19, 2014 |df= }}</ref> A year later, she signed a letter from the [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals]] (PETA) to the South Korean government requesting that the country stop its alleged killing of dogs for food.<ref>{{cite news|author=Travis, Neal|date=September 13, 2001|title=Terror Attack Blows D.A.'s Timing|newspaper=New York Post|page=67}}</ref> In 2010, Aguilera auctioned tickets for her planned tour for [[Christie's]] A Bid to Save the Earth, which benefited the non-profit environmental groups [[Conservation International]], [[Oceana (non-profit group)|Oceana]], [[Natural Resources Defense Council]], and The Central Park Conservancy.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[Manhattan Neighborhood Network]]|author=Ju, Siel|date=February 3, 2010|url=http://www.mnn.com/lifestyle/arts-culture/blogs/christies-celeb-studded-earth-day-auction|title=Christie's celeb-studded Earth Day auction|accessdate=February 4, 2010}}</ref> Aguilera contributed US$200,000 to the [[Women's Center & Shelter of Greater Pittsburgh]] in December 2003,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2002&dat=20031223&id=q2wyAAAAIBAJ&sjid=ULUFAAAAIBAJ&pg=1457,6172137|title=People Watch|page=19|work=[[The Beaver County Times]]|date=December 23, 2003|accessdate=April 18, 2016}}</ref> and has worked with [[Lifetime Television]]'s "End violence against women" campaign.<ref>{{cite web|title=Christina Aguilera, Nicole Kidman and Martina McBride Join Lifetime Television for 7th Annual Emmy Award-Winning, Multi-Platform 'End Violence Against Women' Campaign|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/christina-aguilera-nicole-kidman-and-martina-mcbride-join-lifetime-television-for-7th-annual-emmy-award-winning-multi-platform-end-violence-against-women-campaign-57825437.html|publisher=PR Newswire|accessdate=June 20, 2013}}</ref>
In 2005, Aguilera contributed "Beautiful" to the compilation album ''[[Love Rocks]]'', which proceeds benefited the [[Human Rights Campaign]].<ref>{{cite web|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140920235026/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/64152/love-rocks|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/64152/love-rocks|title=Love Rocks|work=Billboard|date=February 19, 2005|archivedate=September 20, 2014}}</ref> Aguilera participated in the AIDS Project Los Angeles' Artists Against AIDS "[[What's Going On (song)|What's Going On?]]" cover project, and became the face for [[MAC Cosmetics]] and spokesperson for MAC AIDS Fund in 2004. Singer [[Elton John]] featured Aguilera in his charity book ''4 Inches'', which benefitted the [[Elton John AIDS Foundation]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/paris-and-nicky-hilton-kimora-lee-simmons-christina-aguilera-rebecca-romijn-elle-macpherson-heidi-klum-among-44-celebrities-to-bare-all-for-new-book-to-benefit-the-elton-john-aids-foundation-54528372.html|title=Paris and Nicky Hilton, Kimora Lee Simmons, Christina Aguilera, Rebecca Romijn, Elle Macpherson, Heidi Klum Among 44 Celebrities To Bare All For New Book To Benefit The Elton John AIDS Foundation|publisher=PR Newswire|date=June 5, 2005}}</ref>
[[File:Secretary Clinton With David Novak and Christina Aguilera (cropped).jpg|thumb|right|Aguilera (left) and Novak (right) were honored with the George McGovern Leadership Award in October 2012 for their contributions to the United Nations World Hunger Relief effort, while Clinton (center) was given a special tribute]]
In the run-up to the [[United States presidential election, 2004|2004 United States presidential election]], Aguilera was featured on billboards for the "Only You Can Silence Yourself" online voter registration drive run by the [[political party|nonpartisan]], non-profit campaign "[[Declare Yourself]]". In these political advertisements, shot by David LaChapelle, Aguilera was shown with her mouth sewn shut to symbolize the effects of not voting.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/67360/stars-declare-support-for-voting-initiative|title=Stars 'Declare' Support For Voting Initiative|date=July 13, 2004|work=Billboard|accessdate=August 15, 2014}}</ref> In late 2007, Aguilera became the spokesperson for "[[Rock the Vote]]", through which she encouraged young people to vote in the [[United States presidential election, 2008|2008 presidential election]].<ref>{{cite web|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071115130951/http://www.channel4.com/news/articles/arts_entertainment/aguilera%2Bbacks%2Bvoting%2Bcampaign/1047562 |url=http://www.channel4.com/news/articles/arts_entertainment/aguilera+backs+voting+campaign/1047562 |title=Aguilera backs voting campaign |publisher=[[Channel4]] |date=November 14, 2007 |archivedate=November 15, 2007 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> In 2005, Aguilera donated her wedding gifts to American charities in support of [[Hurricane Katrina]] victims,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.today.com/id/10142556/ns/today-today_entertainment/t/christina-aguilera-wed-over-weekend/|title=Christina Aguilera wed over weekend|work=[[Today (US program)|Today]]|date=December 14, 2005|accessdate=August 17, 2014}}</ref> and performed at "Unite of the Stars" concert for Unite Against Hunger in [[Johannesburg]], South Africa and for the [[Nelson Mandela Children's Fund]] at the Coca-Cola Dome.<ref>{{cite news|title=For The Record: Quick News On Christina Aguilera, Jennifer Lopez And Marc Anthony, Madonna, Bloc Party & More|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1512314/for-the-record-quick-news-on-christina-aguilera-jennifer-lopez-and-marc-anthony-madonna-bloc-party-more/|accessdate=June 15, 2014|publisher=MTV News|date=October 26, 2005}}</ref>
In 2008, Aguilera headlined London's Africa Rising charity concert at the [[Royal Albert Hall]], which raised awareness for finding substantial issues facing the continent.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/hi/music/newsid_7671000/7671293.stm|title=Christina Aguilera returns to the UK|publisher=BBC News|date=October 15, 2008|accessdate=August 17, 2014|first=Sinead|last=Garvan}}</ref> That year, Aguilera appeared on the Turkish version of ''Deal or No Deal'', ''[[Var mısın? Yok musun?]]'', and donated proceeds to a charity program for [[orphan]]s.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Altinsas|first=E. Baris|title=A loving family for children in need of protection|url=http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-web/detaylar.do?load=detay&link=156957&bolum=101|work=[[Today's Zaman]]|date=October 26, 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110520083051/http://www.todayszaman.com/newsDetail_getNewsById.action?load=detay&link=156957&bolum=101|archivedate=May 20, 2011 }}</ref> In 2009, Aguilera became the global spokesperson for [[World Hunger Relief]];<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[Business Wire]]|url=http://www.businesswire.com/portal/site/google/?ndmViewId=news_view&newsId=20090715006146&newsLang=en|title=Aguilera Raises Awareness of Hunger Issue by Appearing in PSA, Advertising, Posters|date=July 15, 2009|accessdate=July 15, 2009}}</ref> she and Bratman traveled to [[Guatemala]] with the [[World Food Programme]] to bring awareness to issues including its high [[malnutrition]] rate, and met with local families and beneficiaries of WFP's nutrition programs.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wfp.org/christina-aguilera|title=Christina Aguilera – A Voice for the Hungry|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130104151429/http://www.wfp.org/christina-aguilera|archivedate=January 4, 2013|publisher=[[World Food Programme]]}}</ref> Aguilera has helped raise over $148 million for WFP and other hunger relief agencies in 45 countries.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=World Food Programme |url=http://www.wfp.org/christina-aguilera |title=Christina and the World Food Programme |accessdate=January 13, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131207041759/http://www.wfp.org/christina-aguilera |archivedate=December 7, 2013 |df= }}</ref>
In response to the [[2010 Haiti earthquake]], Aguilera donated a signed [[Chrysler 300]] which was auctioned for relief efforts.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=PR Newswire|date=January 17, 2010|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/the-chrysler-brand-joins-forces-with-the-67th-annual-golden-globe-awards-to-contribute-relief-efforts-to-haiti-81918812.html|title=The Chrysler Brand Joins Forces With 'The 67th Annual Golden Globe Awards' to Contribute Relief Efforts to Haiti|accessdate=January 18, 2010}}</ref> She additionally appeared on the ''[[Hope for Haiti Now: A Global Benefit for Earthquake Relief|Hope for Haiti]]'' telethon that January, where donations directly benefited [[Oxfam|Oxfam America]], [[Partners In Health]], [[International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement|Red Cross]] and [[UNICEF]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Karger|first=Dave|url=http://popwatch.ew.com/2010/01/22/hope-for-haiti-now-the-telethons-10-best-performances/|title='Hope For Haiti Now': The telethon's 10 best performances|work=Entertainment Weekly|date=January 22, 2010|accessdate=March 25, 2010}}</ref> She was featured on a public service announcement alongside former boxer [[Muhammad Ali]] to raise funds for the World Food Programme's efforts to bring food to survivors of the earthquake.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wfp.org/content/sneak-peek-christina-aguilera-and-muhammad-alis-haiti-psa|title=WFO|publisher=World Food Programme|accessdate=January 31, 2010}}</ref> Aguilera was nominated for a [[VH1]] Do Something Award for her work with the organization and her efforts in [[Humanitarian response to the 2010 Haiti earthquake|response to the earthquake]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vh1.com/shows/events/do_something_awards/2010/music-artist/|title=Do Something Music Artist|publisher=VH1|accessdate=December 4, 2012}}</ref> In 2010, Aguilera was appointed [[United States Ambassador to the United Nations|UN ambassador]] for the World Food Programme.<ref name="RedBook">{{cite news|title=Christina Aguilera Goes Solo|url=http://www.redbookmag.com/life/interviews/a6759/christina-aguilera-news-interview/|work=[[Redbook]]|accessdate=February 24, 2011}}</ref> Following [[Hurricane Sandy]] in 2012, Aguilera performed "Beautiful" to open the ''[[Hurricane Sandy: Coming Together]]'' benefit telethon; all proceeds went to the [[American Red Cross]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Stars perform to help victims of Sandy|url=http://entertainment.nbcnews.com/_news/2012/11/02/14888295-stars-perform-to-help-victims-of-sandy|accessdate=June 15, 2014|publisher=NBC News|date=November 2, 2012}}</ref> That year, Aguilera and [[David C. Novak|David Novak]] received the George McGovern Leadership Award.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://wfpusa.org/world-food-programme-ambassador-christina-aguilera-and-yum-brands-chairman-david-novak-honored-state |title=World Food Program USA recognizes champions in solving global hunger; Pays special tribute to Secretary of State Hillary Clinton) |publisher=World Food Program USA |accessdate=October 31, 2015 |date=October 3, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131027224807/http://wfpusa.org/world-food-programme-ambassador-christina-aguilera-and-yum-brands-chairman-david-novak-honored-state |archivedate=October 27, 2013 |df= }}</ref> The following year Aguilera was honored with the Muhammad Ali Humanitarian of the Year Award.<ref>{{cite news|last=Schrenier|first=Bruce|url=http://www.startribune.com/entertainment/224454921.html|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130922105134/http://www.startribune.com/entertainment/224454921.html|archivedate=September 22, 2013|work=[[Star Tribune]]|title=Former President Jimmy Carter headlines winners of Muhammad Ali Humanitarian Awards|date=September 19, 2013}}</ref>
===Products and endorsements=== In 2000, Aguilera was the face for make-up line Fetish, where she worked in choosing colors and packaging for the line.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1424798/christina-aguilera-shares-her-fetish/|title=Christina Aguilera Shares Her Fetish|publisher=MTV News|first=Curtis|last=Waller|date=July 14, 2000|accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> That same year, an interactive CD-ROM was produced called ''Christina Aguilera: Follow Your Dreams'' released by [[Simon & Schuster|Simon & Schuster Interactive]] which features games and quizzes, plus Aguilera herself talking about accomplishing her goals.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1121534/pop-beat-carlos-santana-everlast-christina-aguilera/|title=Pop Beat: Carlos Santana, Everlast, Christina Aguilera ...|publisher=[[MTV.com]]|author=MTV News Staff|date=June 27, 2000|accessdate=September 20, 2017}}</ref> Throughout her career, Aguilera has endorsed several brands, including [[Sears]], [[Levi Strauss & Co|Levi's]],<ref name="Sears & Levi's">{{cite web |url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/sears-and-levisr-launch-new-marketing-campaign-for-sponsorship-of-christina-aguilera-summer-tour-72584442.html |work=PSNewswire |title=Sears and Levi's(R) Launch New Marketing Campaign for Sponsorship of Christina Aguilera Summer Tour |author=Galvin, Aubree |date=July 31, 2000 |accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> [[Skechers]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,478535,00.html |title=Toeing the Line |work=Entertainment Weekly |author=Susman, Gary |date=August 27, 2003 |accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> [[Mercedes-Benz]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.baby-benz.com/portal/a-class-w169/137--christina-aguilera-says-an-exclusive-qhelloq-to-the-new-a-class- |title=Christina Aguilera says an exclusive 'Hello' to the new A-Class |publisher=[[Mercedes-Benz]] |accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> [[Versace]],<ref name="Versace">{{cite web|author=Susman, Gary |date=March 5, 2003 |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,429223~10~0~versacesignschristinaaguilera,00.html |title=Beautiful: Designer signs new muse and model |work=Entertainment Weekly |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141019000911/http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0%2C%2C429223~10~0~versacesignschristinaaguilera%2C00.html |archivedate=October 19, 2014 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> [[Virgin Mobile]],<ref name="Virgin">{{cite web |url=http://www.brandrepublic.com/article/211094/virgin-mobile-claims-aguilera-ad-its-sexiest-ever |work=Variety |title=Virgin Mobile claims Aguilera ad is its 'sexiest ever' |author=Lepper, Joe |date=May 18, 2004 |accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> [[Orange (UK)]], [[Oreo]],<ref>[http://www.adweek.com/brand-marketing/new-oreo-campaign-reminds-you-how-delightful-dunking-cookies-can-be/ New Oreo campaign reminds you how delightful dunking cookies can be] AdWeek</ref> [[Sony Ericsson]] <ref name="Orange & Sony">{{cite web |url=https://www.engadget.com/2006/03/03/orange-signs-sony-ericsson-christina-aguilera/ |work=Engadget |title=Orange signs Sony Ericsson, Christina Aguilera |author=Blass, Evan |date=March 23, 2006 |accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> and soft drink giants [[Coca-Cola]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,109862,00.html |title=Pop Star |work=Entertainment Weekly |author=Bonin, Liane |date=May 17, 2001 |accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> and [[Pepsi]] in 2001 and 2006, respectively.<ref>{{cite news |title=For The Record: Quick News On Christina Aguilera, Game, 50 Cent, Jessica Simpson, Nelly, C. DeLores Tucker & More |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1511468/for-the-record-quick-news-on-christina-aguilera-game-50-cent-jessica-simpson-nelly-c-delores-tucker-more/ |accessdate=June 15, 2014 |publisher=MTV News |date=October 13, 2005}}</ref> In 2004, Aguilera earned [[Pound sterling|£]]200,000 (about $300,000) for opening the summer sale at London's [[Harrods]] store<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hellomagazine.com/music/2004/06/29/christinaaguilera/ |title=Christina Aguilera turns on the style for Harrods opening |work=Hello! |date=June 29, 2004 |accessdate=January 3, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141028043032/http://www.hellomagazine.com/music/2004/06/29/christinaaguilera/ |archivedate=October 28, 2014 |df= }}</ref> and appeared in an advertisement for [[MAC Cosmetics]] Viva Glam V campaign.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/pamela-anderson-is-the-next-spokesperson-and-newest-face-for-the-mac-aids-funds-viva-glam-v-lipstick-advertising-campaign-54386867.html |title=Pamela Anderson is the Next Spokesperson and Newest Face for the M.A.C AIDS Fund's VIVA GLAM V Lipstick Advertising Campaign |format=press release |publisher=PR Newswire |accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> Following the birth of her son in 2008, she was reportedly paid $1.5 million by ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' for her baby pictures, which became the [[List of most expensive celebrity photographs|ninth most expensive celebrity baby photographs ever taken]].<ref>{{cite journal |url=https://www.forbes.com/2009/07/01/michael-jackson-magazine-business-media-jackson_slide_10.html |title=In Pictures: Most Expensive Celebrity Photos |accessdate=May 29, 2013 |last=Rose |first=Lacey |date=July 1, 2009 |journal=Forbes}}</ref> In 2008, jewelry designer [[Stephen Webster]] and friend of Aguilera released "Shattered", a collection of [[sterling silver]] pieces, through [[Neiman Marcus]] and [[Bergdorf Goodman]]. Aguilera, who inspired the collection, was featured as a [[Hitchcock]] heroine.<ref>{{cite web |author=Conti, Samantha |date=February 19, 2008 |work=[[Women's Wear Daily]] |url=http://www.wwd.com/accessories-news/jewelry/christina-aguilera-inspires-stephen-webster-silver-line-465346 |title=Christina Aguilera Inspires Stephen Webster Silver Line |accessdate=February 19, 2008}}</ref> They reprised their work together for Webster's 2009 spring line.<ref>{{cite web |author=Brown, Rachel |date=December 18, 2008 |work=Women's Wear Daily |url=http://www.wwd.com/media-news/fashion-memopad/aguilera-goes-retro-pamela-meets-vivienne-stella-goes-moblie-1897710?full=true |title=Aguilera Goes Retro ... Pamela Meets Vivienne |accessdate=January 16, 2009}}</ref> In 2011, Aguilera attended [[São Paulo Fashion Week]] to premiere her new line of clothing for Brazilian department store [[C&A]], which launched in April.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.caras.com.mx/moda/322362/christina-aguilera-presenta-coleccion-ca/ |title=Christina Aguilera presenta colección C&A |work=Caras |publisher=Televisa S.A. de C.V. |language=Spanish |location=Mexico |date=August 19, 2011 |accessdate=January 3, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150103062908/http://www.caras.com.mx/moda/322362/christina-aguilera-presenta-coleccion-ca/ |archive-date=January 3, 2015 |dead-url=yes }}</ref>
Aguilera is the No. 1 awarded celebrity brand, winner of 13 awards globally.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://perfumes.christinaaguilera.com/en/awards|title=Christina Aguilera No. 1 Awarded Celebrity Brand|date=October 1, 2017}}</ref> Her first fragrance, Xpose, was released in Europe in late 2004 and sold relatively well.<ref>{{cite news|title=Showbiz Gossip|work=[[The Evening Chronicle]]|page=35|publisher=Newcastle Chronicle & Journal Ltd|date=January 18, 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Hazlett, Courtney |publisher=[[MSN]]|date=May 8, 2008|url=http://www.today.com/id/24525545 |title=Aguilera's new scent|accessdate=May 9, 2008}}</ref> Through [[Procter & Gamble]], Aguilera released her signature fragrance, Simply Christina, in 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nme.com/news/christina-aguilera/28220|title=Christina Aguilera to launch fragrance|work=[[NME]]|date=May 9, 2007|accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> In Christmas 2007, the fragrance became the number one perfume in the United Kingdom,<ref>{{cite news|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080109000818/http://www.rcalabelgroup.co.uk/news/8020/|url=http://www.rcalabelgroup.co.uk/news/8020/|title=Christina Tops Fragrance Charts|publisher=RCA Label Group UK. [[Sony BMG]]|date=December 17, 2007|archivedate=January 9, 2008}}</ref> and later in 2009 it was the country's 4th best selling perfume.<ref name="vogue.co.uk">{{cite web|url=http://www.vogue.co.uk/beauty/2010/01/15/all-star-perfumes|title=All Star Perfumes (Vogue.com UK)|work=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]] (United Kingdom)|date=January 15, 2010|accessdate=September 18, 2010}}</ref> The perfume won as the people's choice for favorite celebrity fragrance at the annual UK [[The Fragrance Foundation|Fifi Awards]] 2008.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nymag.com/thecut/2008/04/marc_jacobs_tom_ford_christina_1.html|title=Marc Jacobs, Tom Ford, and Christina Aguilera Win Top Fragrance Awards|work=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|date=April 24, 2008|accessdate=August 9, 2008}}</ref> She released her third fragrance, [[Inspire (fragrance)|Inspire]], accompanied with a body care collection, in September 2008.<ref>{{cite journal|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081203174822/http://www.fashionmagazine.com/beauty/regulararticle/544/|url=http://www.fashionmagazine.com/beauty/regulararticle/544/|title=Sweet refrain|journal=[[Fashion (magazine)|Fashion]]|issue=September 2008|archivedate=December 3, 2008|first=Michelle|last=Bilodeau}}</ref> It was Aguilera's first fragrance released outside of Europe.<ref>{{cite news|author=Stephanie Epiro|title=P&G Hopes Aguilera Will 'Inspire' Its Fragrance Fortunes|url=http://www.wwd.com/beauty-industry-news/beauty-features/p-g-hopes-aguilera-will-inspire-its-fragrance-fortunes-1556271|work=Women's Wear Daily|date=July 24, 2008|accessdate=August 27, 2008}}</ref> Her worldwide ad campaign included a television ad shot by David LaChapelle and was released in the United States in [[Macy's]] department stores. The release coincided with Macy's 150th anniversary which featured Aguilera in commemorative photos.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=Business Wire|date=July 31, 2008|type=press release|url=http://www.businesswire.com/portal/site/google/?ndmViewId=news_view&newsId=20080731005593&newsLang=en|title= Mark Seliger Captures Macy's 'Stars' for Commemorative 150th Birthday Images|accessdate=July 31, 2008}}</ref> She released her fourth fragrance, By Night, in October 2009,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Christina-Aguilera-Night-Eau-Parfum/dp/B002SKFKZU|title=Christina Aguilera By Night Eau de Parfum|publisher=Amazon.co.uk|accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> which became the third best selling fragrance in the United Kingdom in 2009.<ref name="vogue.co.uk"/> The range was further augmented by Royal Desire in 2010,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/10/25/christina-aguilera-royal-desire-ad-photoshop_n_2019309.html|title=Christina Aguilera's Royal Desire Perfume Ad Reeks Of Photoshop |first=Ellie|last=Krupnich|date=October 25, 2012|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=December 14, 2014}}</ref> Secret Potion in 2011,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Christina-Aguilera-Secret-Potion-Parfum/dp/B005MQPIFE|title=Christina Aguilera Secret Potion Eau de Parfum|publisher=Amazon.co.uk|accessdate=January 3, 2015}}</ref> Red Sin in 2012,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-hook/474805/christina-aguilera-shows-skin-in-sinful-fragrance-ad|title=Christina Aguilera Shows Skin in Sinful Fragrance Ad|first= Gregory|last= DelliCarpini Jr.|work=Billboard|date=October 4, 2012|accessdate=February 10, 2014}}</ref> Unforgettable in 2013,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://style.mtv.com/2013/10/18/christina-aguilera-unforgettable/|title=Christina Aguilera Reveals Unforgettable Fragrance Ad|publisher=MTV Style|first=Parry|last= Ernsberger|date=October 18, 2013|accessdate=December 14, 2014}}</ref> Woman in 2014,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.celebrityscentsation.com/celebrity-perfumes/musicians/christina-aguilera/christina-aguilera-woman-perfume/|title=Christina Aguilera's New Fragrance, 'Woman'|date=September 8, 2014|work=Celebrity Scentsation}}</ref> Touch of Seduction in 2015,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.basenotes.net/perfumenews/3221-christina-aguilera-adds-a-touch-of-seduction-to-her-fragrance-line|title=Christina Aguilera adds a Touch of Seduction to her fragrance line|date=November 17, 2015|work=[[Basenotes]]}}</ref> Glam X in 2016<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nstperfume.com/2017/02/07/christina-aguilera-glam-x-new-perfume/|title=Christina Aguilera's New Perfume Glam X|date=February 7, 2017|work=NST Perfume}}</ref> and Definition in 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7988853/christina-aguilera-perfume-ad-definition|title=Watch the High-Gloss Ad for Christina Aguilera's New Perfume, Definition|date=October 10, 2017|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]}}</ref>

They are also mentioned in the article body.-->

{{pp-move-indef}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Use British English|date=August 2013}} {{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox person | name = David Beckham | honorific_suffix = [[Order of the British Empire|OBE]] | image = Beckswimbledon.jpg | image_size = | caption = Beckham at the [[2014 Wimbledon Championships]] | birth_name = David Robert Joseph Beckham{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2003/2004 |year=2003 |publisher=Queen Anne Press |location=Harpenden |isbn=978-1-85291-651-0 |page=42 }} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1975|5|2}} | birth_place = [[Leytonstone]], [[London]], England | residence = [[Rowneybury House]] (1999–2014)
[[Beverly Hills]], [[California]], United States
[[London]] (2014–present)
[[Los Angeles]], California, United States | nationality = British | occupation = {{flatlist| *[[Association football|Footballer]] *businessman *model *spokesperson}} | organisation = [[UNICEF]], [[Malaria No More]]{{cite web |url=http://www.malarianomore.org.uk/ |title=Malaria No More |work=malarianomore.org.uk |accessdate=13 May 2015 }} | agent = [[Simon Fuller]] ([[XIX Entertainment]]) | net_worth = US$450 million (2017){{cite web |title=David Beckham Net Worth |url=http://www.therichest.com/celebnetworth/athletes/footballer/david-beckham-net-worth/ |website=The Richest |accessdate=31 March 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150326172441/http://www.therichest.com/celebnetworth/athletes/footballer/david-beckham-net-worth/ |archivedate=26 March 2015 }}{{better source|date=July 2016}} | height = {{height|ft=6|in=0}} | spouse = {{marriage|[[Victoria Beckham]]|4 July 1999}} | children = 4 | parents = Ted and Sandra Beckham | website = [http://www.davidbeckham.com davidbeckham.com] | module = {{Infobox football biography | embed = yes | position = [[Midfielder]] | youthyears1 = 1985–1987 |youthclubs1 = Ridgeway Rovers | youthyears2 = 1987–1991 |youthclubs2 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | youthyears3 = 1989–1991 |youthclubs3 = [[Brimsdown Rovers F.C.|Brimsdown Rovers]] | youthyears4 = 1991–1993 |youthclubs4 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | years1 = 1992–2003 |clubs1 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] |caps1 = 265 |goals1 = 62 | years2 = 1994–1995 |clubs2 = → [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] (loan) |caps2 = 5 |goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2003–2007 |clubs3 = [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] |caps3 = 116 |goals3 = 13 | years4 = 2007–2012 |clubs4 = [[LA Galaxy]] |caps4 = 98 |goals4 = 18 | years5 = 2009 |clubs5 = → [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] (loan) |caps5 = 18 |goals5 = 2 | years6 = 2010 |clubs6 = → [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] (loan) |caps6 = 11 |goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2013 |clubs7 = [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] |caps7 = 10 |goals7 = 0 | totalcaps = 523 |totalgoals = 97 | nationalyears1 = 1992–1993 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] |nationalcaps1 = 3 |nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 1994–1996 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps2 = 9 |nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 1996–2009 |nationalteam3 = [[England national football team|England]] |nationalcaps3 = 115 |nationalgoals3 = 17 }} }} '''David Robert Joseph Beckham''', {{post-nominals|country=GBR|OBE}}{{Cite news |title=Beckham's pride at OBE |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/2988104.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 June 2003 |accessdate=9 September 2008}} ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|b|ɛ|k|əm}};{{citation|last=Wells|first=John C.|year=2008|title=Longman Pronunciation Dictionary|edition=3rd|publisher=Longman|isbn=9781405881180}} born 2 May 1975) is an English retired professional [[Association football|footballer]] and current President of [[Inter Miami CF]]. He played for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]], [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]], [[A.C. Milan|Milan]], [[LA Galaxy]], [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] and the [[England national football team|England national team]], for which he held the appearance record for an [[Outfield#Association football|outfield player]] until 2016. He is the first English player to win league titles in four countries: England, Spain, the United States and France. He retired in May 2013 after a 20-year career, during which he won 19 major trophies.{{cite web |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/david-beckham-wears-captains-armband-161242615--mls.html |title=David Beckham wears captain's armband, adds assist for PSG in likely career finale – Yahoo! Sports |publisher=Sports.yahoo.com |date=18 May 2013 |accessdate=3 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130609170008/http://sports.yahoo.com/news/david-beckham-wears-captains-armband-161242615--mls.html |archivedate=9 June 2013 }}[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/may/16/david-beckham-retires-stats-numbers "David Beckham: his club and international career in stats"]. ''The Guardian''. Retrieved 20 September 2015 Known for his range of passing, [[Cross (football)|crossing ability]] and [[Curl (football)|bending]] [[Direct free kick|free-kicks]] as a [[Midfielder#Winger|right winger]], Beckham was runner up in the [[Ballon d'Or]], twice runner-up for [[FIFA World Player of the Year]] and in 2004 was named by [[Pelé]] in the [[FIFA 100]] list of the world's greatest living players.{{cite web|last1=Daniel|first1=Taylor|title=David Beckham exits as gracefully as one of his arcing crosses|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2013/may/16/david-beckham-retires-career|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=18 December 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/3533891.stm |title=Pele's list of the greatest |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 March 2004 |accessdate=13 November 2013 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/player/72740.html|title=David Beckham, Great Britain|work=ESPN.co.uk|accessdate=12 September 2014}} He was inducted into the [[English Football Hall of Fame]] in 2008. A global ambassador for the sport, Beckham is regarded as a [[British culture|British cultural icon]].{{cite news|title=Shakespeare 'a cultural icon' abroad|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-27110234|agency=BBC|date=14 November 2016}}{{cite book|last1=Savell Reavis|first1=Tracey|title=The Life and Career of David Beckham: Football Legend, Cultural Icon|date=2014|publisher=Rowman & Littlefield|pages=158, 175}} Beckham's professional club career began with Manchester United, where he made his first-team debut in 1992 aged 17.{{Cite news|title=Los Angeles Galaxy: Player bio |url=http://la.galaxy.mlsnet.com/players/bio.jsp?player=beckham_d&playerId=bec369464&statType=current&team=t106 |publisher=Los Angeles Galaxy |date=9 September 2008 |accessdate=9 September 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081028224000/http://la.galaxy.mlsnet.com/players/bio.jsp?team=t106&player=beckham_d&playerId=bec369464&statType=current |archivedate=28 October 2008 |df= }} With United, he won the [[Premier League]] title six times, the [[FA Cup]] twice, and the [[UEFA Champions League]] in 1999. He then played four seasons with Real Madrid,{{Cite news |title=Beckham joins Real Madrid |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/front_page/2998868.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 September 2003 |accessdate=9 September 2008}} winning the [[La Liga]] championship in his final season with the club.{{Cite news |title=Beckham bows out with Liga title |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/6759697.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 June 2007 |accessdate=9 September 2008 }} In July 2007 Beckham signed a five-year contract with [[Major League Soccer]] club LA Galaxy.{{Cite news |first=Paolo |last=Bandini |title=Beckham confirms LA Galaxy move |url=http://football.guardian.co.uk/continentalfootball/story/0,,1988215,00.html |work=The Guardian |location=London |date=11 January 2007 |accessdate=10 May 2007 }} While a Galaxy player, he spent two loan spells in Italy with Milan in 2009 and 2010. He was the first British footballer to play 100 UEFA Champions League games. In international football, Beckham made his England debut on 1 September 1996 at the age of 21. He was [[Captain (association football)|captain]] for [[List of England national football team captains|six years]], earning 58 caps during his tenure.{{Cite news |title=Beckham's England dream realised |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/1016201.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 November 2000 |accessdate=9 September 2008}}{{Cite news |title=Beckham quits as England captain |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2006/teams/england/5138288.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 July 2006 |accessdate=9 September 2008}} He made 115 career appearances in total, appearing at three [[FIFA World Cup]] tournaments, in [[1998 FIFA World Cup|1998]], [[2002 FIFA World Cup|2002]] and [[2006 FIFA World Cup|2006]], and two [[UEFA European Championship]] tournaments, in [[UEFA Euro 2000|2000]] and [[UEFA Euro 2004|2004]]. Beckham has consistently ranked among the highest earners in football, and in 2013 was listed as the highest-paid player in the world, having earned over $50 million in the previous 12 months.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/christinasettimi/2013/04/17/the-worlds-best-paid-soccer-players/|title=The World's Best-Paid Soccer Players|date=17 April 2013|work=Forbes|accessdate=12 September 2014}} He has been married to [[Victoria Beckham]] since 1999 and they have four children.{{cite news|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/woman/life/david-beckham-kids-named-most-stylish-celebrity-children-in-the-world-30170165.html|title=David Beckham kids named most stylish celebrity children in the world – BelfastTelegraph.co.uk|date=9 April 2014|work=[[Belfast Telegraph]]|accessdate=6 July 2014}} He has been a [[UNICEF UK]] ambassador since 2005, and in 2015 he launched ''7: The David Beckham UNICEF Fund''. In 2014, MLS announced that Beckham and a group of investors would own an [[Inter Miami CF]], which will begin in 2020.{{cite news|url=http://www.miamiherald.com/2014/02/05/3914127/soccer-star-david-beckham-to-bring.html|title=Soccer star David Beckham to bring MLS team to Miami|work=Miami Herald|first=Patricia|last=Mazzei|date=5 February 2014}} ==Early life== Beckham was born at [[Whipps Cross University Hospital]] in [[Leytonstone]], London, England.{{Cite news |title=BECKHAM – Working-class boy to Man U |url=http://articles.latimes.com/2007/jul/09/sports/sp-beckham9 |work=Los Angeles Times |date=9 July 2007 |accessdate=9 September 2008 |first=Chuck |last=Culpepper }} He is the son of Sandra Georgina (née West; b. 1949), a hairdresser, and David Edward Alan "Ted" Beckham (b. [[Edmonton, London]], July–September 1948), a kitchen fitter, who married at the [[London Borough of Hackney]] in 1969.Julie Burchill (2012). On Beckham". Random House, He has an older sister, Lynne Georgina, and a younger sister, Joanne Louise. He regularly played football in Ridgeway Park, [[Chingford]], as a child, and attended Chase Lane Primary School and [[Chingford Foundation School|Chingford County High School]].Arts Council England, [http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20120202222937/http://press.artscouncil.org.uk/content/detail.aspx?releaseid=363&newsareaid=2 School puts the arts at the heart of learning], 21 October 2008 In a 2007 interview, Beckham said that, "At school whenever the teachers asked, 'What do you want to do when you're older?' I'd say, 'I want to be a footballer.' And they'd say, 'No, what do you really want to do, for a job?' But that was the only thing I ever wanted to do."{{cite web|url=http://www.wmagazine.com/celebrities/2007/08/beckhams_steven_klein?currentPage=2|title=American Idols|work=[[W magazine]]|date=1 August 2007|accessdate=24 February 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090214155704/http://www.wmagazine.com/celebrities/2007/08/beckhams_steven_klein?currentPage=2|archivedate=14 February 2009}} Beckham's maternal grandfather was [[Jewish]],{{cite web | last=Shukert | first=Rachel | title=David Beckham: I Consider Myself To Be Jewish | website=[[Tablet Magazine]] | date=17 April 2012 | url=http://www.tabletmag.com/scroll/205883/david-beckham-i-consider-myself-to-be-jewish | accessdate=7 March 2018}} and Beckham has referred to himself as "half Jewish"{{cite news |first=Dominic |last=Fifield |title=Beckham launches into the Galaxy |url=http://football.guardian.co.uk/News_Story/0,,2126173,00.html |work=The Guardian |location=London |date=14 July 2007 |accessdate=14 July 2007 }} and wrote in his autobiography "I've probably had more contact with Judaism than with any other religion".''Jewish funeral for Beckham's grandfather'', By Jessica Elgot, 10 December 2009 In his book ''Both Feet on the Ground'', he stated that growing up he attended church every week with his parents, because that was the only way he could play football for their team.{{cite book |first1=David |last1=Beckham |first2=Tom |last2=Watt |title=Beckham: Both Feet on the Ground |url=https://books.google.com/?id=92wDxf13hoEC&pg=PA11&lpg=PA11&dq=Both+Feet+on+the+Ground+church+beckham#v=onepage |isbn=978-0-06-057094-1 |date=21 October 2004 }} His parents were fanatical [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] supporters who frequently travelled to [[Old Trafford]] from London to attend the team's home matches. David inherited his parents' love of Manchester United, and his main sporting passion was football. He attended one of [[Bobby Charlton]]'s football schools in [[Manchester]] and won the chance to take part in a training session with [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], as part of a talent competition. He played for a local youth team called Ridgeway Rovers , which was coached by his father, Stuart Underwood, and Steve Kirby. Beckham was a Manchester United mascot for a match against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] in 1986. Young Beckham had trials with his local club [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]], [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] and attended [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]'s school of excellence. Tottenham Hotspur was the first club he played for. During a two-year period in which Beckham played for [[Brimsdown Rovers F.C.|Brimsdown Rovers]]' youth team, he was named Under-15 Player of the Year in 1990.{{cite web|title=Becks' Brimsdown boost, article from 24 September 2004|url=http://www.thefa.com/TheFACup/TheFAVase/NewsAndFeatures/Postings/2004/09/BecksBrimsdownBoost.htm|archive-url=https://archive.is/20041011163715/http://www.thefa.com/TheFACup/TheFAVase/NewsAndFeatures/Postings/2004/09/BecksBrimsdownBoost.htm|dead-url=yes|archivedate=11 October 2004|work=TheFA.com|accessdate=7 July 2007}} He also attended Bradenton Preparatory Academy, but signed schoolboy forms at Manchester United on his 14th birthday, and subsequently signed a [[Youth Training Scheme]] contract on 8 July 1991.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/dna/place-lancashire/plain/A1138600|title=David Beckham – Rise of a Footballer|publisher=|accessdate=12 September 2014}} ==Club career== ===Manchester United=== ====Youth and early career==== Having signed for Manchester United as a trainee on 8 July 1991,{{cite web |url=http://h2g2.com/edited_entry/A1138600 |title=David Beckham – Rise of a Footballer |website=The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy: Earth Edition |publisher=Not Panicking |accessdate=14 May 2016 }} Beckham was part of a group of young players, including [[Ryan Giggs]], [[Gary Neville]], [[Phil Neville]], [[Nicky Butt]] and [[Paul Scholes]], who were coached by [[Eric Harrison (footballer)|Eric Harrison]], and helped the club win the [[FA Youth Cup]] in [[FA Youth Cup Finals of the 1990s#1991/92: Manchester United v. Crystal Palace (3-1 and 3-2, 6-3 Aggregate)|May 1992]]. Beckham scored Manchester United's second goal in the 30th minute of their 3–1 first-leg win of the final against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 14 April 1992. In the second leg on 15 May, Beckham played a full 90-minutes of the fixture which ended 3–2 in favour of Manchester United and 6–3 on aggregate. Beckham's impact led to a first-team debut on 23 September 1992, as a substitute for [[Andrei Kanchelskis]] in a [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] match against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]. Shortly afterwards, Beckham signed as a professional on 23 January 1993. Manchester United again reached the [[FA Youth Cup Finals of the 1990s#1992/93: Leeds United v. Manchester United (2-0 and 2-1, 4-1 Aggregate)|final of the FA Youth Cup]], where they faced [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]]. The first leg was played on 10 May 1993, where Beckham started in Manchester United's 2–0 home loss but was replaced by substitute [[Robbie Savage]]. In the second leg on 13 May 1993, Beckham played the full 90 minutes of Manchester United's 2–1 defeat, which gave Leeds United a 4–1 aggregate score. Beckham also received honours with the club's reserve team when the squad won the league in 1994. In September 1994, Beckham made his first full appearance in the club's first team against [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] in a League Cup fixture. On 7 December 1994, Beckham made his [[UEFA Champions League]] debut, scoring a goal in a 4–0 victory at home to [[Galatasaray S.K. (football)|Galatasaray]] in the final game of the group stage. Despite the victory, however, they finished third out of four in their group, behind Barcelona.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=1994/standings/index.html|title=Champions League 1994/95 Standings|work=UEFA.com|accessdate=12 September 2014}} ====Loan to Preston North End==== Beckham then went to [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] on loan for part of the [[1994–95 in English football|1994–95 season]] to get some first team experience. He impressed, scoring two goals in five appearances, notably scoring directly from a [[corner kick]].{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/2988104.stm |title=Beckham's pride at OBE |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 June 2003 |accessdate=4 March 2011 }} ====Return to Manchester United==== Beckham returned to Manchester and made his [[Premier League]] debut for Manchester United on 2 April 1995, in a goalless draw against Leeds United. He played four times for United in the league that season, as they finished second behind [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]], missing out on a third successive Premier League title by a single point. He was not in the squad for the [[1995 FA Cup Final|FA Cup final]] with [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on 20 May, which United lost 1–0, leaving the club without a major trophy for the first time since 1989.Graham Hart (1995). "The Guinness football encyclopedia". p. 69. Guinness United manager [[Alex Ferguson|Sir Alex Ferguson]] had a great deal of confidence in the club's young players. Beckham was part of a group of young talents Ferguson brought into United in the 1990s (known as "[[Fergie's Fledglings]]"), which included [[Nicky Butt]] and [[Gary Neville|Gary]] and [[Phil Neville]]. When experienced players [[Paul Ince]], [[Mark Hughes]], and [[Andrei Kanchelskis]] left the club after the end of the 1994–95 season, his decision to let youth team players replace them instead of buying star players from other clubs (United had been linked with moves for players including [[Darren Anderton]], [[Marc Overmars]] and [[Roberto Baggio]], but no major signings were made that summer), drew a great deal of criticism. The criticism increased when United started the season with a 3–1 defeat at [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]],The most famous comment was [[Alan Hansen]]'s "You can't win anything with kids", quoted in ''The Boss'' 405. Beckham scored United's goal (his first for them in the league) from a distance of around 30 metres. with Beckham scoring United's only goal of the game. However, United recovered from this early season defeat and the young players performed well.{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Sir-Alex-25-Years/Trophies/Trophy-Articles/League-199596.aspx|title=Man Utd season review 1995/96|publisher=|accessdate=12 September 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140525232144/http://www.manutd.com/en/Sir-Alex-25-Years/Trophies/Trophy-Articles/League-199596.aspx|archive-date=25 May 2014|dead-url=yes}} Beckham swiftly established himself as United's right-sided midfielder (rather than a right-winger in the style of his predecessor Andrei Kanchelskis) and helped them to win the Premier League title and [[FA Cup]] [[Double (association football)|double]] that season, scoring the winner in the semi-final against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and also providing the [[corner kick|corner]] from which [[Eric Cantona]] scored in the FA Cup Final. Beckham's first title medal had, for a while, looked like it would not be coming that season, as United were still 10 points adrift of leaders [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] at the turn of the new year, but Beckham and his teammates had overhauled the [[Tyneside]]rs at the top of the league by mid March and they remained top until the end of the season. Despite playing regularly and to a consistently high standard for Manchester United, Beckham did not break into the England squad before [[UEFA Euro 1996|Euro 1996]].{{cite web |title=Euro 96 stars going strong |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/SeniorTeam/NewsAndFeatures/Postings/2005/01/Euro96_Feature.htm |archive-url=https://archive.is/20050326090133/http://www.thefa.com/England/SeniorTeam/NewsAndFeatures/Postings/2005/01/Euro96_Feature.htm |dead-url=yes |archivedate=26 March 2005 |work=The Football Association |date=21 January 2005 |accessdate=16 July 2007 }} {{Quote box|width=28%|align=right|quote="It changed my life. The ball seemed to be in the air for hours and it all went quiet. Then the ball went in and it just erupted. I was on cloud nine. I just wanted to shake everybody's hand and be out on the pitch for an hour."|source=—Beckham on the goal from the half-way line against Wimbledon in August 1996 that made him a household name.Gwen Russell (2011). "Arise Sir David Beckham: Footballer, Celebrity, Legend – The Biography of Britain's Best Loved Sporting Icon". John Blake Publishing,}} At the beginning of the [[1996–97 in English football|1996–97 season]], Beckham was given the number 10 shirt that had most recently been worn by Mark Hughes. On 17 August 1996 (the first day of the [[Premier League]] season), Beckham became something of a household name when he scored a spectacular goal in a match against [[Wimbledon F.C.|Wimbledon]]. With United leading 2–0, Beckham noticed that Wimbledon's goalkeeper [[Neil Sullivan]] was standing a long way out of his goal, and hit a shot from the halfway line – 60 yards out – that floated over the goalkeeper and into the net.[[Sky Sports]]' commentator [[Martin Tyler]]'s words ''"You'll see that over and over again"'' proved prophetic as the goal was voted Premier League Goal of the Decade in 2003. His [[goal celebration]] for his 60-yard strike saw him raise his arms as usual, but he walked away smiling rather than run as he often would.{{cite news |title=Remembering that David Beckham wonder goal 20 years on... |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11667/10540496/remembering-that-david-beckham-wonder-goal-20-years-on |accessdate=10 October 2018}} When Beckham scored the goal he was wearing [[Adidas Predator]] boots.{{Cite news|url=http://specials.rediff.com/sports/2004/apr/27pic2.htm|title=Beckham's Golden Boots|publisher=Rediff.com|date=27 April 2004}} In a UK poll conducted by [[Channel 4]] in 2002, the British public voted the goal No.18 in the list of the [[100 Greatest Sporting Moments]].{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/entertainment/tv/microsites/G/greatest_sporting/results.html|title=100 GREATEST SPORTING MOMENTS – RESULTS|publisher=|accessdate=12 September 2014}} In a 2016 [[Sky Sports]] poll it was ranked the best opening day goal in Premier League history. During the 1996–97 season, Beckham became an automatic first-choice player at Manchester United, helping them to retain the Premier League championship, and was voted [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] by his peers.{{cite web|url=http://www.napit.co.uk/viewus/infobank/football/awards/pfayoung.php|title=English PFA Young Player of the Year Award|publisher=napit.co.uk|accessdate=16 July 2007}} Manchester United started the [[1997–98 in English football|1997–98 season]] well but erratic performances in the second half of the season saw United finish second behind [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].{{cite web|url=http://www.geocities.com/Colosseum/Track/5880/fix1998.html|title=Fixture List for 1997/98 Season|publisher=geocities.com|accessdate=16 July 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090731113715/http://geocities.com/Colosseum/Track/5880/fix1998.html|archivedate=31 July 2009}} [[File:1999 FA Cup Final Beckham corner.jpg|thumb|left|Beckham preparing to take a corner kick for [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] during the [[1999 FA Cup Final]] at Wembley Stadium]] In the [[1998–99 in English football|1998–99 season]], he was part of the United team that won the [[treble (association football)|treble]] of the Premier League, FA Cup and [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]], a unique feat in English football. There had been speculation that the criticism that he had received after being sent off in the World Cup would lead to him leaving England, but Beckham decided to stay at Manchester United.{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Legends/David-Beckham.aspx?pageNo=2|title=Manchester United Legends: David Beckham|publisher=|accessdate=12 September 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141007021554/http://www.manutd.com/en/Players-And-Staff/Legends/David-Beckham.aspx?pageNo=2|archive-date=7 October 2014|dead-url=yes}} To ensure they would win the Premier League title, United needed to win their final league match of the season, at home to Tottenham. There were reports suggesting that the opposition would allow themselves to be beaten to prevent their local rivals Arsenal from retaining the title, but Tottenham took an early lead in the match. Beckham scored the equaliser with a curling strike from 25 yards out into the top left corner of the goal and United went on to win the match and the league. Beckham played in central midfield in United's win over [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] in the [[1999 UEFA Champions League Final]], since United's first string centre-midfielders Paul Scholes and [[Roy Keane]] were suspended for the match.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/special_report/1999/05/99/uniteds_treble_triumph/354262.stm|title=The Kings of Europe|publisher=|accessdate=12 September 2014}} United were losing the match 1–0 at the end of normal time, but won the trophy by scoring two goals in injury time. Both of the goals came from corners taken by Beckham. Those crucial assists, coupled with great performances over the rest of the season, led to him finishing runner up to [[Rivaldo]] for 1999's [[Ballon d'Or|European Footballer of the Year]] and [[FIFA World Player of the Year]] awards.{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/ballondor/archive/edition=1999901999/|title=Rivaldo on top of the world|work=FIFA.com|accessdate=12 September 2014}} Despite Beckham's achievements in the 1998–99 season, he was still unpopular among some opposition fans and journalists, and he was criticised after being sent off for a deliberate foul in Manchester United's [[FIFA Club World Cup|World Club Championship]] match against [[Club Necaxa|Necaxa]]. It was suggested in the press that his wife was a bad influence on him, and that it might be in United's interests to sell him,{{Cite news |title=Man Utd's flawed genius? |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/sport/football/593905.stm |publisher=BBC News |date=7 January 2000 |accessdate=6 October 2005 }} but his manager publicly backed him and he stayed at the club. During the 1999–2000 season, there was a talk of a transfer to [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] in Italy, but this never happened. Beckham helped United retain the Premier League title in [[1999–2000 in English football|1999–2000]] by an 18-point margin, after being pushed by Arsenal and Leeds United for much of the season. United won their final 11 league games of the season, with Beckham scoring five goals during this run, with his last goal coming from a swerving shot from the edge of the penalty area in their final home game against Tottenham Hotspur.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/sport/football/fa_carling_premiership/738587.stm|title=Man Utd celebrate in style|publisher=|accessdate=12 September 2014}} By the early 2000s, the relationship between Ferguson and Beckham had begun to deteriorate, possibly as a result of Beckham's fame and commitments away from football. In 2000, Beckham was given permission to miss training to look after his son Brooklyn, who had [[gastroenteritis]], but Ferguson was furious when [[Victoria Beckham]] was photographed at a London Fashion Week event on the same night, claiming that Beckham would have been able to train if Victoria had looked after Brooklyn that day. He responded by fining Beckham the maximum amount that was permitted (two weeks' wages – then £50,000) and dropping him for a crucial match against United's rivals Leeds United. He later criticised Beckham for this in his autobiography, claiming he had not been "fair to his teammates"''The Boss'' 469. Beckham had a good season for his club, though, and helped United to win the Premier League by a record margin.
"He was never a problem until he got married. He used to go into work with the academy coaches at night time, he was a fantastic young lad. Getting married into that entertainment scene was a difficult thing – from that moment, his life was never going to be the same. He is such a big celebrity, football is only a small part."' – Alex Ferguson speaking about Beckham's marriage in 2007.{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/ferguson-will-never-talk-to-the-bbc-again-401487.html|title=Ferguson will never talk to the BBC again|last=Harris|first=Nick|date=6 September 2007|work=The Independent |location=UK |accessdate=30 April 2009 }}
He was a key player in United's third successive league title in [[2000–01 in English football|2000–01]], only the fourth time that any club had achieved three league titles in a row. He scored nine goals that season, all in the Premier League. On 10 April 2002, Beckham was injured during a Champions League match against [[Deportivo de La Coruña]], breaking the second [[Metatarsus|metatarsal]] bone in his left foot. There was speculation in the British media that the injury might have been caused deliberately, as the player who had injured Beckham was Argentine [[Aldo Duscher]], and [[England national football team|England]] and [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] were due to meet in that year's World Cup.{{cite web |title=Did 'hatchet man' target Beckham? |publisher=ESPN Socernet |date=2 April 2002 |url=http://www.soccernet.com/championsleague/news/2002/0402/20020411featwright.html |accessdate=7 October 2005|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060716052613/http://www.soccernet.com/championsleague/news/2002/0402/20020411featwright.html |archivedate=16 July 2006}} The injury prevented Beckham from playing for United for the rest of the season and they missed out on the Premier League title to Arsenal (also being knocked out of the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] by [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] on away goals in the semi-finals), but he signed a three-year contract in May, following months of negotiations with the club, mostly concerning extra payments for his image rights. The income from his new contract, and his many endorsement deals, made him the highest-paid player in the world at the time.{{Cite news |title=Beckham signs new contract |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport3/worldcup2002/hi/team_pages/england/newsid_1976000/1976699.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 May 2002 |accessdate=7 October 2005 }} Despite the injury, 2001–02 was arguably Beckham's best season as a United player; he scored 11 goals in 28 league games, and a total of 16 goals in 42 games in all competitions, the best of his career. Following an injury early in the [[2002–03 in English football|2002–03 season]], Beckham was unable to regain his place on the Manchester United team, with [[Ole Gunnar Solskjær]] having replaced him on the right side of midfield. His relationship with his manager deteriorated further on 15 February 2003 when, in the changing room following an FA Cup defeat to Arsenal, a furious Alex Ferguson threw{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/m/man_utd/2778985.stm|title=Man Utd play down Arsenal rift|date=19 February 2003|publisher=BBC Sport }}{{cite web|title=Matrix: Milan are favourites|url=http://www.channel4.com/sport/football_italia//dec21o.html|work=Football Italia|publisher=channel4.com|accessdate=21 December 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071224070722/http://www.channel4.com/sport/football_italia//dec21o.html|archivedate=24 December 2007}}{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/9/england/2009/04/28/1234261/silvestre-reminisces-about-fergusons-infamous-boot-throwing-at-be |title=Silvestre Reminisces About Ferguson's Infamous Boot-Throwing at Beckham Incident |publisher=Goal.com |date=28 April 2009 |accessdate=10 June 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/sport/football/article.html?Revealed:_What_happened_when_Beckham_was_hit_by_a_boot_in_the_face&in_article_id=638192&in_page_id=43 |title=Revealed: What happened when Beckham was hit by a boot in the face |work=Metro |date=28 April 2009 |accessdate=10 June 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sport.co.uk/news/Football/18653/Silvestre_relives_Ferguson_throwing_boot_at_Beckham.aspx |title=Silvestre relives Ferguson throwing boot at Beckham |publisher=Sport.co.uk |date=28 April 2009 |accessdate=10 June 2012}} {{cite web|last=Bodinger |first=Katie |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/2008/07/29/why-ryan-giggs-is-more-scared-of-his-mum-than-fergie-91466-21423456/ |title=Why Ryan Giggs is more scared of his mum than Fergie |publisher=WalesOnline |accessdate=10 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121013212846/http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/2008/07/29/why-ryan-giggs-is-more-scared-of-his-mum-than-fergie-91466-21423456/ |archivedate=13 October 2012 |df= }} or kicked a [[Football boot|boot]] that struck Beckham over the eye, causing a cut that required stitches. The incident led to a great deal of transfer speculation involving Beckham, with [[bookmaker]]s offering odds on whether he or Ferguson would be first to leave the club.{{Cite news |title=Will Becks give Man Utd the boot? |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 February 2003 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/m/man_utd/2775269.stm |accessdate=6 October 2005 |first=Stuart |last=Roach }} Although the team had started the season badly, their results improved greatly from December onwards and they won the league, with Beckham managing a total of 11 goals in 52 games in all competitions. He was still a first-choice player for England, however, and was appointed an [[Officer of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire]] (OBE) for services to football on 13 June 2003.{{Cite news |title=Beckham's pride at OBE |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 June 2003 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/2988104.stm |accessdate=6 October 2005 }} Beckham had made 265 Premier league appearances for United and scored 61 goals. He also made 81 Champions league appearances, scoring 15 goals. Beckham won six Premier League titles, two FA Cups, one [[UEFA Champions League|European Cup]], one Intercontinental Cup and one FA Youth Cup in the space of 12 years. By this stage, he was their joint second longest serving player behind [[Ryan Giggs]] (having joined them at the same time as [[Nicky Butt]], [[Gary Neville]] and [[Paul Scholes]]). ===Real Madrid=== {{Quote box|width=28%|align=right|quote="He is a great player who is going to become part of the club's great history. He is a man of our times and a symbol of modern-day stardom and what is certain is [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] have signed Beckham because he's a great footballer and a very dedicated professional. His team spirit is unsurpassed and he is one of the best English players of all-time and if only because of that he is with us."|source=—Real Madrid President [[Florentino Pérez]] during Beckham's unveiling.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/3037824.stm|title=Real unveil Beckham|publisher=|accessdate=12 September 2014}}}} As the summer 2003 transfer window approached, Manchester United appeared keen to sell Beckham to [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]]{{cite news |title=Beckham to stay in Spain |work=The Guardian |date=11 June 2003 |url=http://football.guardian.co.uk/News_Story/0,,974864,00.html |accessdate=24 May 2006 |location=London |first=Daniel |last=Taylor }} and the two clubs even announced that they reached a deal for Beckham's transfer,{{cite news|title=Barcelona's bid for Man Utd star begs questions |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/inside_game/gabriele_marcotti/news/2003/06/12/marcotti_insider/ |publisher=CNNSI.com |date=12 June 2003 |accessdate=3 March 2011 |first=Gabriele |last=Marcotti |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040709085103/http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/inside_game/gabriele_marcotti/news/2003/06/12/marcotti_insider |archivedate=9 July 2004 }} but instead he joined reigning Spanish champions [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] for €37 million on a four-year contract.Equivalent to, at the time, £25 million or US$41 million. Beckham was the latest signing in the ''[[Galácticos]]'' era of global stars signed by club president [[Florentino Pérez]] every summer.{{cite web |title=2001 – present — Real Madrid surpasses the century mark |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/en/about-real-madrid/history/football/2001-2010-the-ninth-with-zidane-beckham-ronaldo-and-figo |publisher=Realmadrid.com |accessdate=5 November 2015 }} The news came as a bitter blow to the newly elected Barcelona president [[Joan Laporta]], who based much of his presidential campaign on signing Beckham.{{cite news |title=Beckham joins Real Madrid |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 June 2003 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/front_page/2998868.stm |accessdate=25 July 2010 }} Though announced in mid-June, the transfer was completed on 1 July 2003, making him the third Englishman to play for the club, after [[Laurie Cunningham]] and [[Steve McManaman]]. Following a successful medical on 2 July, Beckham was unveiled in front of 500 accredited journalists from 25 countries at Real's basketball facility, where he was handed the famous white shirt by club legend [[Alfredo Di Stéfano]].{{cite news |title=Real unveil Beckham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 July 2003 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/3037824.stm |accessdate=25 July 2010 }} Although Beckham had worn the number seven shirt for Manchester United and England, he was unable to wear it at Madrid as it was assigned to club captain [[Raúl (footballer)|Raúl]].
