Beckham was named in the provisional squad to represent the [[Great Britain Olympic football team]] at the 2012 Olympics.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/olympics/david-beckham-set-to-be-included-in-provisional-team-gb-olympic-squad-7830913.html|title=David Beckham set to be included in provisional Team GB Olympic squad|work=The Independent|accessdate=12 September 2014}} He was not included in the final selection by manager [[Stuart Pearce]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/olympics/18673893|title=Team GB: David Beckham left out for football reasons – Stuart Pearce|work=BBC Sport|accessdate=12 September 2014}} ==Approach to training and discipline== ===Training and praise from managers=== {{Quote box|width=28%|align=right|quote="David Beckham is Britain's finest striker of a football not because of God-given talent but because he practises with a relentless application that the vast majority of less gifted players wouldn't contemplate."|source=—Former Manchester United manager [[Alex Ferguson]].}} Beckham was a product of Sir [[Alex Ferguson]]'s hard-working approach at Manchester United, and was renowned for his long-range passing, crossing ability, and [[Curl (football)|bending]] free-kicks as a right winger. Ferguson noted that Beckham "practised with a discipline to achieve an accuracy that other players wouldn't care about."[https://www.fifa.com/newscentre/features/news/newsid=1551015/index.html "Kings of the free-kick"]. FIFA.com. Retrieved 20 December 2014{{cite web|last1=Barclay|first1=Patrick|title=Ferguson happy as Beckham takes a great leap forward|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-united/2995526/Ferguson-happy-as-Beckham-takes-a-great-leap-forward.html|publisher=The Telegraph|accessdate=18 December 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.manutdzone.com/legends/DavidBeckham.htm|title=Manchester United Legends – David Beckham|publisher=manutdzone.com|accessdate=28 May 2007}} Beckham reportedly spent hours practising his free kicks after training sessions had ended.{{cite web|last=Campbell |first=Paul |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2013/may/17/david-beckham-alex-ferguson-manchester-united |title=David Beckham: product of Sir Alex Ferguson's school of hard graft |work=The Guardian |date=17 May 2013 |accessdate=3 October 2013}} {{Quote box|width=25%|align=left|quote="What remains in your memory is his genuine commitment and dedication, his natural humility which he always had, that will stay forever."|source=—Former Arsenal manager [[Arsène Wenger]].}} Beckham maintained his training routine at [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] and even when his relationship with management was strained in early 2007, Real Madrid president [[Ramón Calderón]] and manager [[Fabio Capello]] praised Beckham for maintaining his professionalism and commitment to the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/sports/2007-01/14/content_782993.htm|title=Beckham will not play for Real again – Capello|work=China Daily|date=14 January 2007|accessdate=28 May 2007}}{{cite web|url=http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2007/01/13/sports/EU-SPT-SOC-Real-Madrid-Beckham.php |title=Coach says Beckham won't play again for Real Madrid |work=International Herald Time |date=13 January 2007 |accessdate=28 May 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070620123856/http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2007/01/13/sports/EU-SPT-SOC-Real-Madrid-Beckham.php |archivedate=20 June 2007 }} Beckham's Real Madrid teammate Roberto Carlos regarded Beckham to be the best free-kick exponent he had ever seen. Two of the best free kick exponents of their generation, [[Roberto Carlos]] commented on the dilemma the team faced when they won a free kick on the edge of the penalty area: "I would stand on one side and Beckham on the other but I wanted to see Beckham take the free-kick because it's beautiful how he hits the ball."[http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=esp/news/newsid=765938.html "Beckham is best says Roberto Carlos"]. UEFA.com. Retrieved 18 December 2014 In May 2013, asked about how he wanted to be remembered in his retirement, Beckham said, "I just want people to see me as a hardworking footballer, someone that's passionate about the game, someone that – every time I stepped on the pitch – I've given everything that I have, because that's how I feel. That's how I look back on it and hope people will see me." ===Discipline=== Beckham was the first England player ever to collect two red cards, and the first England captain to be sent off.{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/article576493.ece|title=Beckham red card but joy for Sven|publisher=|accessdate=12 September 2014}} Beckham's most notorious red card was during the [[1998 FIFA World Cup|1998 World Cup]] after [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]]'s [[Diego Simeone]] had fouled him: Beckham, lying face down on the pitch, kicked out at the Argentine midfielder, who fell dramatically. He amassed 41 yellow cards and four red cards in his time at Real Madrid; all four reds came in La Liga.ESPN player statistics: David Beckham (accessed 29 April 2013) http://espnfc.com/player/_/id/8880/david-beckham?cc=5739 He received one red card while at Paris Saint-Germain, picked up in injury time in a match against [[Evian Thonon Gaillard F.C.|Evian]] on 28 April 2013.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22334844 |title=David Beckham sent off after six minutes in PSG victory |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 April 2013 |accessdate=3 October 2013 }} Between 2000 and 2013, Beckham played 420 competitive games for England, Milan, LA Galaxy, Manchester United, Real Madrid and PSG, and received seven red cards, one every 60 matches on average. ==David Beckham Academy== [[File:David Beckham Academy London at night.jpg|thumb|Beckham Academy in London]] In 2005, Beckham founded the [[David Beckham Academy]] football school, operating from two sites, in London and Los Angeles. It was announced in late 2009 that both would close.{{Cite news |title=California Branch of David Beckham Academy Closes |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/66/united-states/2010/02/08/1781126/california-branch-of-david-beckham-academy-closes |publisher=Goal |accessdate=28 November 2010 |date=28 November 2010}} A mobile academy is being developed by Beckham, to travel around the UK and further afield.{{Cite news |title=Beckham academy 'likely to close' |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/london/8382849.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=27 November 2009 |date=27 November 2009}} ==Major League Soccer team in Miami== {{Main|Inter Miami CF}} On 5 February 2014, MLS announced that Beckham had exercised his option to buy a [[Expansion of Major League Soccer|MLS expansion team]] for $25 million, which he had received as part of the contract he signed with the LA Galaxy in 2007. The ownership group, led by Beckham, originally hoped the [[Miami]]-based team would begin play in 2016 or 2017. After delays getting a [[Miami MLS stadium|stadium]] deal completed, MLS announced in January 2018 that the team had been approved and would likely begin play in 2020.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42864461|title=David Beckham launches Miami Major League Soccer team|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 January 2018}} The team name and crest were revealed on 5 September. Club Internacional de Futbol Miami – more commonly known as, Inter Miami – is represented by a black crest with neon pink trimmings and herons whose legs clasp to form an "M" for Miami.{{Cite news|url=http://www.sun-sentinel.com/sports/soccer/fl-sp-miami-soccer-team-crest-20180905-story.html|title=Inter Miami: David Beckham's MLS team unveils name and crest|last=Lerner|first=Doug Phillips, Keven|work=Sun-Sentinel.com|access-date=5 September 2018|language=en-US}}{{cite news |title=Inter Miami: David Beckham's MLS team is called Club Internacional de Futbol Miami |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45419289 |accessdate=5 September 2018 |agency=BBC}} ==Personal life== [[File:David y Victoria Beckham.jpg|thumb|upright|Beckham and his wife [[Victoria Beckham|Victoria]] at the 2007 British Grand Prix at Silverstone]] In 1997, Beckham started dating [[Victoria Beckham|Victoria Adams]], after she attended a Manchester United match.{{Cite news |url=http://news.independent.co.uk/people/profiles/article55497.ece |title=David and Victoria Beckham: Can they mend it like Beckhams? |work=The Independent |date=11 April 2005 |accessdate=3 September 2018|location=London |first=Alison |last=Roberts |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071228201145/http://news.independent.co.uk/people/profiles/article55497.ece |archivedate=28 December 2007 }}{{cite news |url=http://www.lamondamagazine.com/en/m/defense/victoria-beckham/ |title=Victoria Beckham owes me everything |author=Juliette Wills|date=21 July 2013 |website=La Monda|accessdate=3 September 2018}}{{cite web |url=http://www.wmagazine.com/celebrities/2007/08/beckhams_steven_klein?currentPage=2 |title=American Idols |work=[[W (magazine)|W]] |date=1 January 2010 |accessdate=3 September 2018|deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090214155704/http://www.wmagazine.com/celebrities/2007/08/beckhams_steven_klein?currentPage=2 |archivedate=14 February 2009 }} She was famously known as "Posh Spice" of the pop music group [[Spice Girls]], one of the world's top pop groups at the time, and his team was also enjoying a great run of success. Therefore, their relationship instantly attracted a great deal of media attention. The couple were dubbed "[[Posh and Becks]]" by the media.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/6295214.stm |title=Will Brand Beckham break America? |last=Pryor|first= Fiona |date=12 July 2007 |work=[[BBC News]] |accessdate=3 September 2018}} He proposed to her on 24 January 1998 in a restaurant in [[Cheshunt]], England. On 4 July 1999, they married at [[Luttrellstown Castle]] in Ireland. Beckham's teammate [[Gary Neville]] was the best man, and the couple's infant son, Brooklyn, was the ring bearer.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/special_report/1999/07/99/the_posh_wedding/383151.stm |title=David and Victoria tie the knot |work=BBC News |date= 5 July 1999|accessdate=3 September 2018}} The media were kept away from the ceremony, as the Beckhams had an exclusive deal with ''[[OK!|OK! Magazine]]'', but newspapers were still able to obtain photographs showing them sitting on golden thrones.{{Cite news |title=Sun pips OK! to Posh wedding photos |publisher=BBC News |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/special_report/1999/07/99/the_posh_wedding/387126.stm |accessdate=25 May 2006 |date=6 July 1999}} 437 staff were employed for the wedding reception, which was estimated to have cost £500,000.{{Cite news |title=Wedded spice |publisher=BBC News |date=5 July 1999 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/special_report/1999/07/99/the_posh_wedding/385866.stm |accessdate=2 December 2005 }} David and Victoria Beckham have four children: sons Brooklyn Joseph (born 4 March 1999 at Portland Hospital, London),{{cite web| url = http://www.biography.com/people/david-beckham-9204321| title=David Beckham Biography: Soccer Player (1975–)| publisher= [[Biography.com]] ([[FYI (TV network)|FYI]] / [[A&E Networks]]) | accessdate= 1 September 2016}} Romeo James (born 1 September 2002 at Portland Hospital, London),{{cite news|title=Beckhams name their new son Romeo|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/1405989/Beckhams-name-their-new-son-Romeo.html|publisher=The Telegraph|date=11 December 2016}} Cruz David (born 20 February 2005 at Ruber International Hospital, Madrid),[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/4281405.stm "Beckhams celebrate birth of Cruz"]. BBC. Retrieved 11 December 2016 and daughter Harper Seven (born 10 July 2011 at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, Los Angeles).Byrne, Alla and Perry, Simon {{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20505597,00.html |title=Victoria and David Beckham Welcome a Daughter |work=[[People (American magazine)|People]] |date=10 July 2011|accessdate=10 July 2011}} [[Elton John]] is godfather to Brooklyn and Romeo Beckham; their godmother is [[Elizabeth Hurley]].{{cite web |url=http://marriage.about.com/od/sports/a/davidbeckham.htm |title=Victoria and David Beckham Marriage Profile |publisher=Marriage.about.com |accessdate=13 November 2008 }} Beckham's three sons have all played football in the [[Arsenal F.C. Academy|Arsenal Academy]].[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/players/david-beckham/11262771/David-Beckham-in-car-crash-after-picking-up-son-Brooklyn-from-Arsenal-training-ground.html "David Beckham and son Brooklyn 'shaken' after car crash following Arsenal training session"]. ''The Daily Telegraph'' (London). Retrieved 29 November 2014 Like their father, Brooklyn and Romeo have both done modelling work and been named among [[GQ]]'s best dressed British men.{{cite news|title=50 Best Dressed Men in Britain 2015 |url=http://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/style/articles/2015-01/05/best-dressed-men-2015/ |work=GQ |date=5 January 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150107145128/http://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/style/articles/2015-01/05/best-dressed-men-2015 |archivedate=7 January 2015 }} Brooklyn previously played football for [[Arsenal F.C. Academy|Arsenal U16]], but was released at the end of the 2014–15 season.[http://au.eurosport.com/football/premier-league/2012-2013/brooklyn-beckham-set-to-be-released-by-arsenal-already_sto4614963/story.shtml "Brooklyn Beckham set to be released by Arsenal already"]. Eurosport. Retrieved 14 November 2015 In his early Manchester United career, Beckham lived in a four-bedroom house in [[Worsley]] that he bought directly from the property developer as a 20-year-old in 1995.{{cite news |first=Nicola |last=Bartlett |title=Beckham's first home up for sale |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/greater-manchester-news/david-beckhams-first-home-worsley-6787948 |work=Manchester Evening News |publisher=MEN Media |date=7 March 2014 |accessdate=18 June 2015 }} In 1999, shortly after his wedding he and Victoria bought a country house set in 24 acres in Sawbridgeworth, Hertfordshire, which the media nicknamed "[[Beckingham Palace]]".{{Cite news|url=http://news.independent.co.uk/uk/this_britain/article236166.ece |title=Beckingham Palace, our lovely home |work=The Independent |date=31 July 2001 |accessdate=3 September 2018 |location=London |first=Julia |last=Stuart |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071228201150/http://news.independent.co.uk/uk/this_britain/article236166.ece |archivedate=28 December 2007 }}{{cite news| url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/inside-beckingham-palace-david-victorias-3247500 | title=Inside 'Beckingham Palace': David and Victoria's mansion bought by insurance tycoon for £11.3million | newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]] | location=UK | first=Patrick | last=Hill | date=15 March 2014 | accessdate=27 August 2018}} Beckham suffers from [[obsessive compulsive disorder]] (OCD), which he says makes him "have everything in a straight line or everything has to be in pairs." Victoria Beckham claims, "If you open our fridge, it's all co-ordinated down either side. We've got three fridges – food in one, salad in another and drinks in the third. In the drinks one, everything is symmetrical. If there's three cans, he'll throw one away because it has to be an even number."{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/this-britain/beckham-reveals-his-battle-with-obsessive-disorder-472573.html |title=Beckham reveals his battle with obsessive disorder |accessdate=28 August 2012 |location=London |work=The Independent |first=Maxine |last=Frith |date=3 April 2006}} In April 2004, the British tabloid ''[[News of the World]]'' carried claims by Beckham's former personal assistant [[Rebecca Loos]] that he and Loos had an extramarital affair.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/3614993.stm |title=Beckham story is tabloids' dream |publisher=BBC News |date=9 April 2004 |accessdate=4 May 2009}}{{Cite news |last=News |first=Pa |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,1-1066358,00.html |title=''Beckham flies back to Madrid from holiday'' |work=The Times |location=London |date=7 April 2004 |accessdate=4 May 2009 }} A week later, the Malaysian-born Australian model Sarah Marbeck claimed that she had slept with Beckham on two occasions. Beckham dismissed both claims as "ludicrous".{{Cite news |title=Beckham to stay in Spain |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 May 2004 |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/3733607.stm |accessdate=7 October 2005 }} In September 2010, Beckham announced that he was making a court application against prostitute Irma Nici and several others over claims in the magazine ''In Touch'' that he had sex with her.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/david-beckhams-lawyers-serve-25-million-writ-on-prostitute-irma-nici/story-e6frewyr-1225929589722 |title=David Beckham's lawyers serve $25 million writ on prostitute Irma Nici |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=27 September 2010 |accessdate=10 June 2012}} Although the magazine later accepted that the allegations against Beckham were untrue, his court application was dismissed under US freedom of speech laws.{{cite news|title=David Beckham loses In Touch, Irma Nici lawsuit: Judge says cheating story is of public interest|work=[[New York Daily News]]|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/david-beckham-loses-touch-irma-nici-lawsuit-judge-cheating-story-public-interest-article-1.133622|date=14 February 2011|accessdate=11 January 2016}}{{cite news|title=David Beckham loses appeal to sue magazine over prostitute Irma Nici's false claims|url=http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/celebrity-life/david-beckham-loses-appeal-to-sue-magazine-over-prostitute-irma-nicis-false-claims/story-e6frfmqi-1226599012614|date=17 March 2013|work=news.com.au|accessdate=11 January 2016}} ==Outside football== [[File:David Beckham 2009.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Beckham in [[Cape Town]], South Africa, December 2009]] Beckham's fame extends beyond the [[Association football pitch|pitch]]; in much of the world his name is "as instantly recognisable as that of multinational companies like [[Coca-Cola]] and [[IBM]]."{{cite web|url=http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/news/special-report/article.html?in_article_id=409642&in_page_id=108|title=Beckham the worldwide brand|work=This is Money|accessdate=12 September 2014}} Beckham's relationship and marriage to Victoria, who has been famous in her own right as part of the [[Spice Girls]], contributed to his celebrity beyond football. Beckham became known as a fashion icon, and together with Victoria, the couple became lucrative spokespeople sought after by clothing designers, health and fitness specialists, fashion magazines, perfume and cosmetics manufacturers, hair stylists, exercise promoters, and spa and recreation companies. One example is a line of aftershave and fragrances called David Beckham Instinct.{{cite web|url=http://www.beckham-fragrances.com/ |title=David Beckham Instinct |publisher=Beckham-fragrances.com |accessdate=4 May 2009}} In 2002, Beckham was hailed as the ultimate "[[metrosexual]]" by the man who invented the term{{cite web|url=http://dir.salon.com/story/ent/feature/2002/07/22/metrosexual/print.html |title=Meet the metrosexual |work=Salon |accessdate=13 November 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081113123551/http://dir.salon.com/story/ent/feature/2002/07/22/metrosexual/print.html |archivedate=13 November 2008 |df= }} and has been described as such by numerous other articles since.{{cite web|url=http://www.marksimpson.com/blog/2007/07/13/america-meet-david-beckham/ |title=America – meet David Beckham |publisher=Marksimpson.com |accessdate=13 November 2008}} The Beckhams were paid $13.7 million in 2007 to launch his fragrance line in the United States{{cite web|url=http://uk.eonline.com/news/419662/david-beckham-s-incredible-soccer-career-by-the-numbers|title=David Beckham's career by the numbers|date=16 May 2013|work=E! Online|accessdate=12 September 2014}} In the world of fashion, David has already appeared on the covers of many magazines. United States covers have included the men's magazine ''[[Details (magazine)|Details]]'', and with his wife for the August 2007 issue of ''[[W (magazine)|W]]''.{{cite web|title=The Beckhams: American Idols: W Feature Story on Style.com|url=http://www.style.com/w/feat_story/071107|publisher=Style.com|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080718213746/http://www.style.com/w/feat_story/071107|archivedate=18 July 2008}} According to Google, "David Beckham" was searched for more than any other sports topic on their site in 2003 and 2004.{{cite web |title=2003 Year-End Google Zeitgeist |publisher=Google |url=http://www.google.com/press/zeitgeist2003.html |accessdate=9 October 2005 }}{{cite web |title=2004 Year-End Google Zeitgeist |publisher=Google |url=http://www.google.com/press/zeitgeist2004.html |accessdate=9 October 2005 }} According to [[Ask Jeeves]], Beckham ranked third, after [[Britney Spears]] and [[Osama bin Laden]], among subjects most searched for by British users of that site in the first decade of the 2000s.{{cite news |title=Britney Spears tops Noughties web search list |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/celebritynews/6858806/Britney-Spears-tops-Noughties-web-search-list.html |work=The Telegraph |date=21 December 2009 |accessdate=17 May 2014}} [[File:Michelle Obama with David Beckham 2013.jpg|thumb|left|Beckham with United States First Lady [[Michelle Obama]] at the White House, March 2012]] Upon their arrival in Los Angeles on 12 July 2007, the night before Beckham's formal introduction, [[Los Angeles International Airport]] was filled with paparazzi and news reporters.{{cite web|url=http://www.scotsman.com/lifestyle/the-beckhams-go-to-hollywood-1-909020/|title=The Beckhams go to Hollywood|website=www.scotsman.com}} On the next night, Victoria appeared on ''[[The Tonight Show]]'' with [[Jay Leno]] to talk about their move to LA, and presented Leno with a number 23 Galaxy jersey with his own name on the back. Victoria also talked about her [[NBC]] TV show ''[[Victoria Beckham: Coming to America]]''.{{cite web|title=NBC.com – Victoria Beckham Coming To America|url=http://www.nbc.com/Victoria_Beckham/|publisher=NBC.com|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070714101927/http://www.nbc.com/Victoria_Beckham/|archivedate=14 July 2007}} On 22 July, a private welcoming party was held for the couple at the [[Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles]]. [[A-list]] celebrities attending included [[Steven Spielberg]], [[Jim Carrey]], [[George Clooney]], [[Tom Cruise]], [[Katie Holmes]], [[Will Smith]], [[Jada Pinkett Smith]], and [[Oprah Winfrey]].{{cite news|last=Eller |first=Claudia |url=http://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-beckham19jul19,1,1699340.story?track=rss |title=Hollywood breathlessly awaits Beckhams |work=Los Angeles Times |date=19 July 2007 |accessdate=4 May 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090403003158/http://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-beckham19jul19%2C1%2C1699340.story?track=rss |archivedate= 3 April 2009 |df= }} Beckham's many endorsement deals make him one of the most recognisable athletes throughout the world. Having worn [[Adidas]] football boots from the start of his career (notably [[Adidas Predator]]), in 2003 he signed a $160 million lifetime contract with Adidas, earning nearly half the money upfront, and will continue to earn percentages of profits on all of his branded Adidas products.{{cite web|url=http://www.independent.ie/woman/celeb-news/the-face-of-ten-celebrities-who-have-earned-big-bucks-from-endorsements-29958509.html|title=The face of ... Ten celebrities who have earned big bucks from endorsements|work=Independent.ie|accessdate=12 September 2014}} He had a 10-year collaboration with [[Pepsi Co.]] that expired in 2009.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-pepsi-beckham-idUSTRE4BU3OF20081231%7ctitle|title=Pepsi and Beckham end endorsement relationship|publisher=}}{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} He has also promoted [[The Walt Disney Company]] theme parks.{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/david-beckham-endorsing-disney/|title=David Beckham Endorsing Disney|date=26 January 2007|publisher=|accessdate=12 September 2014}} Beckham has several eponymous video games, including ''[[Go! Go! Beckham! Adventure on Soccer Island]]'', a [[platform game]] for the [[Game Boy Advance]], and ''[[David Beckham Soccer]]'', a football game for a number of [[Video game platforms#Platforms|platforms]],{{cite web |first=Tom |last=Bramwell |title=Go!Go! Beckham! Adventure on Soccer Island Review |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/r_gogobeckham_gba |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |date=12 September 2002 |accessdate=8 June 2009 }}{{cite web|title=David Beckham Soccer Review |last=Varanini |first=Giancarlo |date=14 August 2002 |publisher=[[GameSpot]] |url=http://www.gamespot.com/xbox/sports/davidbeckhamsoccer/review.html |accessdate=8 June 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090828060405/http://www.gamespot.com/xbox/sports/davidbeckhamsoccer/review.html |archivedate=28 August 2009 }} and he was brand ambassador for exercise video game ''[[EA Sports Active 2]]''.{{cite news |title=EA lands Beckham for brand ambassador role |url=http://www.marketingmagazine.co.uk/article/1023006/ea-lands-beckham-brand-ambassador-role |first=John |last=Reynolds |work=Marketing |date=18 August 2010 |accessdate=17 May 2014}} Beckham featured in [[EA Sports]]' [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'' video game series]]; he was on the cover for the International edition of ''[[FIFA: Road to World Cup 98|FIFA 98]]''.{{cite web|title=International FIFA 13 Covers|url=http://www.fifauteam.com/international-fifa-13-covers/|work=fifauteam.com|accessdate=18 March 2015|date=24 August 2012}} During his playing career (which ended in May 2013), Beckham generated an estimated £1 billion in [[Kit (association football)#Basic equipment|shirt]] and [[football boot|boot]] sales. In 2006, [[Lloyd's of London]] insured his legs for £100m, at the time he was playing for Real Madrid.{{cite news|last1=Grant|first1=Katie|last2=Papasian|first2=John|title=Premium cover|work=[[i (newspaper)|The i]]|issue=1435|date=2 July 2015|page=2|editor-last=Duff|editor-first=Oliver|editor-link=Oliver Duff (editor)}}{{cite web|URL=https://www.lloyds.com/lloyds/about-us/history/innovation-and-unusual-risks/going-out-on-a-limb|title=GOING OUT ON A LIMB – BODY PARTS AND OTHERS|accessdate=3 July 2015|website=Lloyd's.com}} In March 2015 Beckham had the third highest social media rank in the world among sportspeople, behind [[Cristiano Ronaldo]] and [[Lionel Messi]], with over 52 million Facebook fans.{{cite news|title=Cristiano Ronaldo overtakes Shakira as Facebook's most 'liked' person|url=https://uk.news.yahoo.com/cristiano-ronaldo-overtakes-shakira-as-facebook-s-most--liked-person-085815659-soccer.html?pt=1/|publisher=Yahoo.com|date=10 February 2017}} [[File:Vinfast-D.Beckham-Miss Vietnam.jpg|thumb|right|Beckham with Miss Vietnam at the Paris Motor Show 2018]] Beckham played a critical part in bringing the Olympics to London in 2012, travelling with the British delegation to [[Singapore]] in 2005 for the host city selection.{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/players/david-beckham/10063146/David-Beckham-retires-key-role-in-London-2012-Olympic-bid-is-praised-by-Lord-Coe.html|title=David Beckham retires: key role in London 2012 Olympic bid is praised by Lord Coe|last=Hart|first=Simon|date=16 May 2013|access-date=7 September 2018|language=en-GB|issn=0307-1235}} At the [[2008 Beijing Olympics]] closing ceremony, Beckham, [[Jimmy Page]] and [[Leona Lewis]] represented Britain during the handover segment for the 2012 Olympics. Beckham rode a [[AEC Routemaster|London double-decker bus]] into the stadium and Page and Lewis performed "[[Whole Lotta Love]]".{{cite news |url= https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/olympics/2303411/London-rap-troupe-fly-flag-at-Beijing-Olympics.html |title=London rap troupe fly flag at Beijing Olympics |first=Tom |last=Knight |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=17 June 2008 |location=London |issn=0307-1235 |oclc=49632006 |accessdate=5 December 2017}} He also featured at the [[2012 Summer Olympics opening ceremony|Opening Ceremony]] of the [[2012 Summer Olympics|2012 London Olympics]], carrying the [[Olympic flame]] to the [[London Stadium|stadium]] by speedboat.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/19016797|title=David Beckham 'proud' of Olympics 2012 role|date=28 July 2012|work=BBC Sport|access-date=7 September 2018|language=en-GB}} Beckham visited [[Afghanistan]] in May 2010 for a morale-boosting visit to British troops fighting the [[Taliban insurgency]].{{cite web|url=http://sports.gaeatimes.com/2010/05/22/beckham-flies-to-afghanistan-to-boost-british-troops-morale-104019/ |title=Beckham flies to Afghanistan to boost British troops' morale |publisher=Sports.gaeatimes.com |date=22 May 2010 |accessdate=10 June 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://sports.gaeatimes.com/2010/05/23/beckham-visits-british-troops-in-afghanistan-104343/ |title=Beckham visits British troops in Afghanistan |publisher=Sports.gaeatimes.com |date=23 May 2010 |accessdate=10 June 2012}} The appearance of Beckham as well as British Foreign Secretary [[William Hague]] and Defence Secretary [[Liam Fox]] was believed to have prompted a [[Taliban]] attack on [[Kandahar]] airfield.{{cite web|url=http://sports.rediff.com/report/2010/may/24/beckham-targetted-by-taliban-in-afghanistan.htm |title=Beckham targetted by Taliban in Afghanistan? |publisher=Rediff.com |date=24 May 2010 |accessdate=10 June 2012}}{{cite web|first=Anoop |last=Kumar |publisher=MyNews Interactive Media Co. |url=http://www.mynews.in/News/Taliban_targeted_Beckham_in_Afghanistan!_N57377.html |title=Taliban targeted Beckham in Afghanistan! |date=24 May 2010 |accessdate=10 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301205044/http://www.mynews.in/News/Taliban_targeted_Beckham_in_Afghanistan%21_N57377.html |archivedate= 1 March 2012 |df= }} Chinese authorities appointed Beckham as global ambassador for Chinese football in March 2013. After numerous officials had been banned for match-fixing, and the [[Chinese Super League]] had failed to retain the services of well-known international names, Beckham's role was to help improve the image of the game and raise its profile both in China and abroad.{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/news-and-comment/david-beckham-named-as-global-ambassador-for-chinese-football-8518912.html |title=David Beckham named as global ambassador for Chinese football |agency=Reuters |newspaper=The Independent |date=4 March 2013 |accessdate=17 May 2014}} From 14 July 2013, Beckham started appearing in adverts for [[BSkyB]] advertising their [[Sky Sports]] coverage via the [[Sky Go]] app.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a498247/david-beckham-stars-in-sky-sports-tv-advert-video.html |title=David Beckham stars in Sky Sports TV advert – video – Showbiz News |publisher=Digital Spy |date=14 July 2013 |accessdate=3 October 2013}} In January 2014, Beckham appeared on ''[[Late Night with Jimmy Fallon]]'' on NBC in the U.S, and in March he made a guest appearance in the BBC's [[Sport Relief 2014 Special|Sport Relief special]] of ''[[Only Fools and Horses]]''.{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/news/sport-relief-2014-david-beckham-makes-acting-debut-only-fools-and-horses-debut-beckham-in-peckham-9208768.html|title=Sport Relief 2014: Watch David Beckham in Peckham in Only Fools and Horses special|work=The Independent|accessdate=12 September 2014}} He was named one of ''[[GQ]]''{{'}}s 50 best dressed British men in 2015. During the [[2016 United Kingdom European Union membership referendum|2016 EU referendum]], Beckham voiced his opposition to [[Brexit]], stating “For our children and their children we should be facing the problems of the world together and not alone. For these reasons, I am voting to remain.”{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/as-our-alternative-monarch-surely-david-beckham-backing-remain-will-spark-a-constitutional-crisis-a7093791.html|title=Why David Beckham backing Remain could spark a constitutional crisis|work=The Independent|access-date=2018-11-27|language=en-GB}} Beckham was announced as the new Ambassadorial president of the [[British Fashion Council]] on 11 May 2018.{{Cite news|url=https://news.sky.com/story/david-beckham-appointed-ambassadorial-president-of-british-fashion-council-11367312|title=David Beckham appointed Ambassadorial President of British Fashion Council|work=Sky News|access-date=14 May 2018|language=en-GB}} Prior to the June 2018 vote by FIFA member nations for selecting the hosts of the [[2026 FIFA World Cup]], Beckham endorsed the [[United 2026 FIFA World Cup bid|North American bid]] (Canada, Mexico and the United States).{{cite news |title=David Beckham: 2026 World Cup in North America would be 'very special. |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/blog-fifa/story/3518083/david-beckham-2026-world-cup-in-north-america-would-be-very-special |agency=ESPN |date=13 June 2018}} ==Charitable work== Beckham has supported [[UNICEF]] since his days at [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and in January 2005, the English national team captain became a Goodwill Ambassador with a special focus on UNICEF's Sports for Development program.{{cite news|title=DAVID BECKHAM OBE, GOODWILL AMBASSADOR|url=http://m.unicef.org.uk/UNICEFs-Work/Our-supporters/Celebrities/David-Beckham/|publisher=UNICEF|date=16 September 2015}} In 2012, he met with UK Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] at [[10 Downing Street]] to call for more action to help children affected by [[malnutrition]] around the world.{{cite news|title=DAVID BECKHAM CALLS FOR ACTION ON CHILD STUNTING |url=http://m.unicef.org.uk/Latest/News/david-beckham-silent-crisis-olympics/ |publisher=UNICEF |date=16 September 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208062304/http://m.unicef.org.uk/Latest/News/david-beckham-silent-crisis-olympics/ |archivedate=8 December 2015 |df= }} In 2015, his tenth year as a UNICEF Ambassador, Beckham launched ''7: The David Beckham UNICEF Fund'' to help protect children in danger. In June 2015 he visited [[Siem Reap]] in [[Cambodia]], where he met with child victims of violence. Beckham has pledged his support for the [[Unite for Children, Unite Against AIDS]] campaign. He is a former patron of the [[Elton John AIDS Foundation]].{{cite web |url=http://ejaf.com/about/our-patrons/ |title=Elton John AIDS Foundation patrons |publisher=Ejaf.com |accessdate=3 December 2012 }} In 2013, he also donated all his £3.4 million salary taken from [[Paris Saint-Germain]] to two children's charities in France.{{cite web|title=David Beckham|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/david-beckham-finally-agrees-deal-to-donate-34m-psg-wages-to-french-childrens-charities-8659789.html|website=Independent.co.uk|publisher=Independent}} Beckham has been supporting the charity named [[Help For Heroes]] for many years whose aim is to help soldiers injured in Iraq and Afghan wars.{{cite web|title=Brand David Beckham|url=https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/case-study-brand-david-beckham-david-skilling/|website=LinkedIn.com|publisher=LinkedIn Corporation}} On 17 January 2007, Rebecca Johnstone, a 19-year-old cancer patient from [[Hamilton, Ontario]], Canada, received a surprise phone call from Beckham. After the conversation, he sent her a Real Madrid jersey with his signature on it. Rebecca died on 29 January 2007.{{Cite news |title=To Rebecca, with love |url=https://www.thestar.com/Sports/article/175193 |work=Toronto Star |date=26 January 2007 |accessdate=2 February 2007 |first=Scott |last=Radley }} On 1 July 2007, Beckham appeared as a speaker at the [[Concert for Diana]] held at [[Wembley Stadium]], London to celebrate the life of [[Diana, Princess of Wales|Princess Diana]] almost 10 years after her death.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/1556165/Princes-open-Wembley-Diana-concert-with-joke.html |title=Princes open Wembley Diana concert with joke |work=The Telegraph|accessdate=18 May 2015 }} Proceeds from the concert went to Diana's charities as well as to charities of which her sons Princes William and Harry are patrons.{{cite news|title=What is the Concert for Diana?|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/concertfordiana/features/about.shtml|publisher=BBC|date=13 August 2015}}[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/6257986.stm Diana concert a 'perfect tribute']. BBC News. Retrieved 12 April 2012 Beckham is a founding member of the [[Malaria No More UK]] Leadership Council and helped launch the charity in 2009 with [[Andy Murray]] at Wembley Stadium. Beckham also appeared in a 2007 public service announcement for [[Malaria No More]] U.S, advertising the need for inexpensive bed nets. The TV spot aired in the United States on [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox Networks]], including [[Fox Soccer Channel]], and can also be seen on YouTube."David Beckham: Fight Malaria by Donating a $10 Bed Net". (25 April 2007). Retrieved 4 May 2009 Since joining [[Major League Soccer]], Beckham has been a very public advocate in the United States for related charities such as "MLS W.O.R.K.S." On 17 August 2007, he conducted a youth clinic in [[Harlem]], along with other current and former MLS players. This was in advance of his first New York City area match the following day against the [[New York Red Bulls]]. That team's [[Jozy Altidore]] and [[Juan Pablo Ángel]] were also with Beckham, teaching skills to disadvantaged youth to benefit [[Harlem Youth Soccer Association|FC Harlem Lions]].{{cite web|url=http://www.paddocktalk.com/news/html/modules.php?op=modload&name=News&file=article&sid=63413&mode=thread&order=0&thold=0 |title=Video: Juan Pablo Angel, David Beckham to Assist MLS W.O.R.K.S. |publisher=paddocktalk.com |accessdate=21 August 2007 |date=18 August 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928013401/http://www.paddocktalk.com/news/html/modules.php?op=modload&name=News&file=article&sid=63413&mode=thread&order=0&thold=0 |archivedate=28 September 2007 |df= }} ==Appearances in films== {{Quote box|width=27%|align=right|quote="We may be a small country, but we're a great one, too. The country of Shakespeare, Churchill, the Beatles, Sean Connery, Harry Potter. David Beckham's right foot. David Beckham's left foot, come to that."|source=—[[Hugh Grant]]’s character in the 2003 film ''[[Love Actually]]''.{{cite news |title=David Beckham in 40 quotes |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/babb/11573971/David-Beckham-in-40-quotes.html |agency=The Telegraph|date=6 September 2018}}}} Beckham never personally appeared in the 2002 film ''[[Bend It Like Beckham]]'', except in archive footage. He and his wife wanted to make cameo appearances, but scheduling proved difficult, so the director used lookalike [[Andy Harmer]] instead.{{IMDb title |id=0286499 |title=Bend It Like Beckham}} Beckham makes a cameo appearance with Zinedine Zidane and Raúl, in the 2005 film ''[[Goal! (film)|Goal!]]''. Harmer also doubled for him in the party scene.{{cite web|title=Andy Harmer ~ BeckhamLookalike.com|url=http://www.beckhamlookalike.com/clients.htm|work=BeckhamLookalike.com|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070501102202/http://www.beckhamlookalike.com/clients.htm|archivedate=1 May 2007}} Beckham himself appears in the sequel ''[[Goal II: Living the Dream]]''{{IMDb title |id=0473360 |title=Goal! 2: Living the Dream ...}} in a larger role, when the film's lead character gets transferred to Real Madrid. This time, the story centres on the Real Madrid team, and besides Beckham, other real life Real Madrid players also appear on and off the pitch, alongside the fictional characters. Though the use of stock footage from the [[2006 FIFA World Cup]], Beckham appeared in ''[[Goal III: Taking on the World]]'', which was released [[Direct-to-video|straight to DVD]] on 15 June 2009.{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0065743/ |title=David Beckham |publisher=Internet Movie Database |accessdate=13 November 2008}} Beckham has expressed no interest in pursuit of acting roles, saying he is too "stiff".{{cite web|url=http://www.askmen.com/gossip/david-beckham/david-beckham-hollywood-snub.html|title=David Beckham's Hollywood snub|publisher=askmen.com|accessdate=15 August 2007|date=2 March 2007|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071001005010/http://www.askmen.com/gossip/david-beckham/david-beckham-hollywood-snub.html|archivedate=1 October 2007}} However, due to his friendship with [[Guy Ritchie]], he has made two cameo appearances in Ritchie's films: as a projectionist in ''[[The Man from U.N.C.L.E. (film)|The Man from U.N.C.L.E.]]'' (based on the 1964 [[Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer|MGM]] [[The Man from U.N.C.L.E.|television series of the same name]]),{{cite news|title=Guy Ritchie Backs David Beckham As An Actor|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/08/07/guy-ritchie-backs-david-beckham-as-actor_n_7957734.html|publisher=Huffington Post|date=24 May 2016}} and as Trigger in ''[[King Arthur: Legend of the Sword]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/david-beckham-king-arthur-charlie-hunnan_uk_5911bd1ae4b0d5d9049fe64b|title=David Beckham's Film Career Takes Another Step With First Clip Of Him In 'King Arthur: Legend Of The Sword'|publisher=Huffington Post|date=9 May 2017}} Beckham has played along to jokes about his voice. In a 2018 promo for ''[[Deadpool 2]]'', Beckham is seen watching the [[Deadpool (film)|first instalment of the film franchise]] in which [[Ryan Reynolds]]' character compares Beckham's voice to inhaling helium.{{cite news |title=Deadpool sorry for joking about Beckham's voice |url=https://news.sky.com/story/deadpool-sorry-for-joking-about-beckhams-voice-11367173 |agency=Sky News |date=13 June 2018}} Beckham is seen rolling his eyes at the voice jibe before receiving an apology text from Deadpool. Beckham answers his door to the antihero who presents him with milk and cookies, before Deadpool knocks again and has a bunch of helium-filled red balloons. ==Records== Beckham captained [[England national football team|England]] 59 times,{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/WorldCup2006/NewsAndFeatures/Postings/2006/06/BeckhamStandsDown.htm|archive-url=https://archive.is/20071029052205/http://www.thefa.com/WorldCup2006/NewsAndFeatures/Postings/2006/06/BeckhamStandsDown.htm|dead-url=yes|archivedate=29 October 2007|title=Beckham stands down|date=2 July 2006 |accessdate=14 July 2007}} the fourth highest after [[Bobby Moore]] and [[Billy Wright (footballer born 1924)|Billy Wright]] both with 90, and [[Bryan Robson]] with 65. With his free kick goal against [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] in the second round of the [[2006 FIFA World Cup|2006 World Cup]], Beckham gained membership into two of football's exclusive clubs: he became the only English player – and the 21st player in the world – to score in three World Cups; Real Madrid teammate [[Raúl (footballer)|Raúl]] also achieved this feat a few days earlier.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/world_cup_2006/4991536.stm |title=England 1–0 Ecuador |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 June 2006 |accessdate=10 June 2012}} It also made him only the fifth player in World Cup history to score twice from a direct free kick; the other four were [[Pelé]], [[Roberto Rivelino]], [[Teófilo Cubillas]], and [[Bernard Genghini]] (Beckham had previously scored this way against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] in the first round of the [[1998 FIFA World Cup|1998 World Cup]]). All three goals were against South American teams (Colombia, [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] and Ecuador) and from set pieces (the two aforementioned free kicks and a penalty against Argentina). ==Tattoos== {{as of|2017}}, Beckham had more than 50 tattoos.{{cite news |title=David Beckham 'sure' his son will regret his tattoos |url=https://www.msn.com/en-ie/news/other/david-beckham-sure-his-son-will-regret-his-tattoos/ar-BBGtTYN |accessdate=19 October 2018 |work=msn.com |date=10 December 2017}} There are names of his sons Romeo, Cruz and Brooklyn, and of his wife Victoria. His wife's name, tattooed on his left forearm, is in [[Sanskrit]] script because Beckham thought it would be "tacky" to have it in English. However, this was misspelt as the equivalent of "Vihctoria".{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/1044797.stm |title=Beckham's tattoo misspelt |publisher=BBC News |date=28 November 2000 |accessdate=27 October 2013}} In his autobiography ''David Beckham: My Side'', he said that the idea of having tattoos came to him in 1999 after his son Brooklyn was born, following a conversation on the subject of tattoos with [[Melanie Brown|Mel B]] and her then-husband, Jimmy Gulzar. Beckham said: "When you see me, you see the tattoos. You see an expression of how I feel about Victoria and the boys. They're part of me."Beckham, David (2010). "David Beckham: My Side". HarperCollins In 2018, Beckham added to his collection with a tattoo of a solar system covering the left side of his scalp.{{cite news |last=Haynes |first=Gavin |title=Hooked on ink: is it possible to be 'addicted' to tattoos?|url=https://www.theguardian.com/fashion/shortcuts/2018/may/01/addicted-to-tattoos-david-beckham-body-art |accessdate=19 October 2018 |work=The Guardian |date=1 May 2018}} ==Awards== {| class="wikitable" |- ! [[Audrey Roberts]] | alias = David Tilsley }} '''David Platt''' (also '''Tilsley''') is a fictional character from the British soap opera, ''[[Coronation Street]]''. He was born on-screen during the episode broadcast on 25 December 1990. He was played by Thomas Ormson from his first appearance until 15 March 2000 when Ormson left. [[Jack P. Shepherd]] took over the role and made his first on screen appearance on 26 April 2000. ==Storylines== David is the son of [[Martin Platt|Martin]] ([[Sean Wilson (actor)|Sean Wilson]]) and [[Gail McIntyre|Gail Platt]] ([[Helen Worth]]). David was born on [[Christmas Day]] 1990. Martin's friend [[List of Coronation Street characters (1992)#Carmel Finnan|Carmel Finnan]] ([[Catherine Cusack]]) tried to kidnap David when he was a toddler. She also posed as his mother to other characters. Carmel then tries to frame Gail for pushing her down the stairs and is revealed to be mentally ill. In 2000, a nine-year-old David becomes jealous of the attention being paid to his newborn niece [[Bethany Platt]] (Amy and Emily Walton). He decides to gain attention by getting arrested for shoplifting. In 2001, Gail and Martin divorce after Martin has an affair with [[Rebecca Hopkins (Coronation Street)|Rebecca Hopkins]] ([[Jill Halfpenny]]). David is unhappy and begins misbehaving in the hope that they will get back together. David becomes the target of a school bully and, despite Gail's advice to ignore the bully, he becomes violent and gets into fights. His behaviour worsens when Gail marries [[Richard Hillman]] ([[Brian Capron]]) in July 2002, but he comes to accept Richard. In March 2003, Richard is revealed to be a serial killer, and tries to kill himself, Gail, David, Bethany, and her mother - David's sister - [[Sarah Platt]] ([[Tina O'Brien]]) by driving them into the local canal. Gail, Sarah, David and Bethany are all rescued, while Richard drowns. In the years following, David develops a penchant for lying and scheming at home and at school. He is unhappy with Gail's relationship with Phil Nail ([[Clive Russell]]) and begins a hate campaign against Phil. David does not trust Phil, as a result of Richard's behaviour. Phil reaches breaking point with David and throws him up against a wall, threatening to beat him up. David tells Gail, but Phil lies to her, and Gail believes him and slaps David, unaware that he is telling the truth. Gail receives a card addressed from Richard. She suspects Phil of sending the cards. Realising David is behind the scam, Phil throws David across the table in front of Gail. An angry Gail ends their relationship. The Platt family still receive cards from Richard, and Gail realises David is the culprit. Gail blames herself for David's behaviour. In December 2006, David discovers Sarah's grandmother [[Ivy Tilsley]]'s ([[Lynne Perrie]]) diary and reads it, and is shocked that Gail had wanted to abort him, but he understands this after Gail told him that Ivy had been having a rough time since the death of her son and Gail's husband, [[Brian Tilsley]] ([[Christopher Quinten]]). He develops romantic feelings for [[Maria Connor|Maria Sutherland]] ([[Samia Ghadie|Samia Smith]]), but is annoyed she is enjoying an affair with [[Charlie Stubbs (Coronation Street)|Charlie Stubbs]] ([[Bill Ward (actor)|Bill Ward]]). Charlie threatens David into silence. David tries to blackmail Charlie, who tries drowning David in a bath to rid of him, but Maria walks in and saves him. In January 2007, [[Tracy Barlow]] ([[Kate Ford]]) murders Charlie, staging it to look like self-defence. David offers to testify for Tracy that he saw Charlie attack her, on the condition that she sleeps with him. Tracy agrees, but the prosecution proves David's testimony to be lies. In January 2008, David begins a relationship with [[Tina McIntyre]] ([[Michelle Keegan]]) and she becomes pregnant. In March 2008, Gail pays for an abortion and they decide not to tell David. He finds out and, in an argument, he pushes Gail down the stairs. He persuades Tina to give him an alibi, but she ends their romance. David smashes various vehicles and windows on the Street, attacks [[Ken Barlow (Coronation Street)|Ken Barlow]] ([[William Roache]]) and hits a policewoman. He is sentenced to four months in a [[Young Offender Institution|Young Offenders Institution]]. When he is released Tina reconciles with him, but faces more issues when a jealous David reads her emails. He dates [[Amber Kalirai]] ([[Nikki Patel]]) in an attempt to make Tina jealous, which has the desired effect and they get back together. In November 2008, David feuds with the Windass family when they refuse to pay for work Tina's father [[Joe McIntyre (Coronation Street)|Joe McIntyre]] ([[Reece Dinsdale]]) has carried out. David threatens [[Eddie Windass|Eddie]] ([[Steve Huison]]) and [[Anna Windass]] ([[Debbie Rush]]) with a crowbar. [[Len Windass|Len]] (Conor Ryan) and [[Gary Windass]] ([[Mikey North]]) steal Joe's work tools in retaliation. David then destroys their kitchen, so the Windass family remove the kitchen from the house. Gail and Anna are forced to call a truce to avoid more problems. David spends time away from Weatherfield when Tina wants nothing more to do with him. Upon his return he becomes jealous of Tina and Gary's friendship. David frames Gary for theft and also tricks him into buying stolen goods. He then enlists Gary to commit robbery, which goes wrong when Gail's father [[Ted Page (Coronation Street)|Ted Page]] ([[Michael Byrne (actor)|Michael Byrne]]), interrupts them, calls the police and has a heart attack. Gary decides to confess to the police, which leads to David being arrested. David becomes jealous when Tina begins a relationship with [[Jason Grimshaw]] ([[Ryan Thomas]]). David discovers that Joe is addicted to prescription medication and agrees to supply him with drugs as long as he tries to break Tina and Jason up. In February 2010, Joe commits suicide, but the police presume he has been murdered and arrest Gail. David has to scheme in order to prove Gail's innocence. In late 2010, Tina begins a relationship with [[Graeme Proctor]] ([[Craig Gazey]]). This upsets David and he feels betrayed. David suffers a black-out while driving and knocks Graeme over. No one believes David's versions of events and the police arrest him for attempted murder. Before the court case is about to begin David passes out again and everyone begins to realise he was telling the truth. He is found to be suffering from [[epilepsy]]. David returns from a holiday engaged to [[Kylie Platt|Kylie Turner]] ([[Paula Lane]]). Gail is angry and tries to convince David to change his mind. David and Kylie then get married in April 2011. David fights to take custody of Kylie's son [[List of Coronation Street characters (2010)#Max Turner|Max Turner]] (Harry McDermott), but ends up feuding with her sister [[Becky McDonald]] ([[Katherine Kelly (actress)|Katherine Kelly]]), with Kylie trying to avoid it. David insists that Steve and Becky aren't fit to look after Max, proving this when he saves Max from being run over. David has to deal with Gail and Kylie feuding. But when he learns that Gail has tried to bribe Kylie to leave, he threatens to leave home. Kylie gets a job at the salon with David. He is upset when Max is put up for adoption and she does not want to prevent this. He convinces her they must change their ways and convince social services to allow Max to live with them. In August 2013, David discovers that Kylie has slept with Nick but does not confront them. He vandalises Nick's flat and writes poison pen letters to his wife Leanne. Nick tells David he knows he is behind the trouble and suggests they discuss it with Kylie. To prevent Kylie from finding out David causes a car accident. Nick is left in a coma which results in permanent brain damage. David learns he is Lily's biological father, but when Kylie discovers his acts of revenge she throws him out. Following their reconciliation, Max is diagnosed with [[ADHD]] in August 2014 and Kylie becomes addicted to his medication. David restricts Kylie's access to the medication, but she compensates with an amphetamine addiction. He throws Kylie out and she leaves Weatherfield on Christmas Day 2014. In January 2015, Max's father [[Callum Logan]] (Sean Ward) arrives and wants access to Max. When David refuses Callum starts a custody battle, which begins a violent feud. Kylie returns in May 2015 and helps strengthen David's claim to Max. Their feud escalates, and he manipulates Sarah and Bethany (now played by [[Lucy Fallon]]). When they try to frame Callum for a crime in September 2015, he attacks Sarah and Kylie kills Callum to protect her. David decides to help cover the murder up and buries the body down a man hole in their home. When a car crash occurs in May 2016, rescue workers find Callum's body.{{Citation|last=Coronation Street|title=Callum's Body Is Discovered - Coronation Street|date=2016-05-26|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lX6h1FEZzuA|accessdate=2017-02-11}} David is initially the main suspect, but they frame the recently deceased [[Tony Stewart (Coronation Street)|Tony Stewart]] (Terence Maynard), Jason's father, another of Callum's enemies, who happens to be dead. In July 2016, Kylie decides she cannot live in the house Callum died in any longer. David agrees to relocate their family to Barbados. Their plans are ruined when [[Clayton Hibbs]] (Callum Harrison) stabs Kylie in the street and she dies in David's arms. David then attacks Clayton who is then charged with Kylie's murder. Gail is concerned about David and his calm attitude towards planning Kylie's funeral. In October 2016, David wants revenge for Kylie's murder, believing their will be no justice for Kylie. He publicly names Clayton, despite Clayton being aged under 18, as Kylie's killer and attempts to kill Macca Hibbs, Clayton's step-brother, whilst he's in hospital. David plans his final act of revenge on Clayton by crashing his new car into the police van Clayton is in whilst igniting a large amount of petrol to blow them both up. After he makes a suicide video, Gail, Nick and Sarah see it and lock David in the Bistro cellar until the trial is over. After tricking Gail into thinking that he has committed suicide, David escapes the Bistro, gets into his car that is covered in petrol and drives off. However, as he speeds along, David spots Lily on the road and swerves to avoid her, but ends up flipping the car, which lands on Lily and Gary (who had attempted to get Lily to safety). Some of the residents are able to get Gary and Lily out as David manages to get out of the car. However, a spark causes the car to catch fire and cause an explosion, setting Anna on fire and badly injuring her, whilst David looks on in horror. Sarah admits to Gary, who she is in a relationship with, what David did, but Sarah persuades him not to tell anyone for the sake of Max and Lily. David inherits £20,000 from a client who dies, as well as a dog. Gary finds out from Sarah about the money, so David gives Anna and Kevin £19,000. In 2017, he begins a relationship with an older woman called [[Shona Ramsey]] ([[Julia Goulding]]), not knowing that she is Clayton's estranged mother. In March 2018, David is drugged and raped by his new friend [[Josh Tucker]] (Ryan Clayton) following a night out. He is left ashamed and embarrassed. He then goes to visit Martin, who is moving to [[New Zealand]], in Liverpool with Max and Lily. Martin, sensing something is wrong with David, goes back to Weatherfield to speak to him. Following the rape David starts lashing out at everyone, worrying Shona, Gail, Martin, Sarah, Gary, Bethany and Audrey as well as many other residents. He takes Tyrone's place in the charity boxing event, his opponent is Gary when they fight, David has flashbacks and he brutally attacks Gary while everyone watches in horror. This leaves Gary fighting for his life, Sarah doesn't believe her own brother would do such a thing. But what no one knows but David himself is he's still suffering mentally and emotionally from when Josh drugged and raped him, this leads to him breaking up with Shona, saying he doesn't love her anymore. This leads to her moving out and moving in with [[Roy Cropper]] ([[David Neilson]]) at Roy's rolls. He later starts a relationship with [[Emma Brooker]] (Alexandra Mardell) who is a year older than Bethany. On the day of his trial for attacking Gary, he runs off while his solicitor [[Imran Habeeb]] (Charlie De Melo) is distracted. Shona finds him and he reveals his rape to her after finding out about [[Aidan Connor]]'s ([[Shayne Ward]]) suicide. They get back together and Shona promises to stay by his side. David later tells Gail and Audrey about the rape while Gail tells Sarah. While doing community service for beating up Gary, he and another man make homophobic jokes towards gay vicar [[Billy Mayhew]] ([[Daniel Brocklebank]]). When Billy later asks him to apologize, David refuses and Billy locks the door. David breaks down and admits to Billy that he was raped. Billy later follows David when he follows Josh and a potential victim. Billy tells him to go home and to do nothing. Billy later contridicts himself and warns the man of Josh. Josh gets beaten up by this man and ends up in hospital. He becomes blind and Billy regularly visits him out of guilt. Billy then let’s Josh live with him. David and Shona find out and are disgusted with Billy. He is also furious when he finds out that Bethany knew about Billy visiting Josh in hospital. After Josh re evaluates his behaviour, he visits David in the salon, however he still won't admit to raping him. David kidnaps him and tricks him into thinking they are outside a police station. When Josh breaks down and pleads that his life would be hell in prison, David gets closure and tells Josh that they are in an alleyway, before leaving him stranded. ==Reception== In August 2017, Shepherd was longlisted for "Best Actor" and "Funniest Male" at the ''[[Inside Soap Awards]]''.{{cite news|last1=Harp|first1=Justin|title=Coronation Street, EastEnders, Emmerdale and Hollyoaks all make the Inside Soap Awards longlist|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/emmerdale/news/a836154/inside-soap-awards-longlist-coronation-street-eastenders-emmerdale-hollyoaks/|accessdate=21 August 2017|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]|date=22 August 2017}} He did not progress to the viewer-voted shortlist.{{cite news|last1=Kilkelly|first1=Daniel|title=Inside Soap Awards 2017 shortlist revealed – which Corrie, EastEnders, Emmerdale and Hollyoaks stars are up for prizes?|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/coronation-street/news/a841879/inside-soap-awards-2017-shortlist/|accessdate=4 November 2017|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]|date=31 October 2017}} On 2 June 2018, Shepherd was awarded his first "[[British Soap Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]]" accolade at [[British Soap Awards#2018 winners|The British Soap Awards 2018]], following his performances during the rape storyline.{{cite news|url= http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/coronation-street/news/a858581/british-soap-awards-2018-winners-list/|title=The British Soap Awards 2018 winners: Find out who won a trophy at the 2018 awards ceremony|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]|date=2 June 2018|accessdate=4 June 2018}} In July 2018, Shepherd was longlisted for "Best Actor" and "Best Partnership", alongside [[Julia Goulding]] who plays [[Shona Ramsey]], at the [[Inside Soap Awards|''Inside Soap'' Awards]].{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/coronation-street/news/a862268/inside-soap-awards-2018-full-longlist-coronation-street-eastenders-emmerdale-hollyoaks/|title=Full list of nominations for the Inside Soap Awards 2018|last=Davies|first=Megan|date=24 July 2018|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]|accessdate=26 July 2018}} For his portrayal of David, Shepherd was nominated for Best Soap Actor (Male) at the 2018 ''[[Digital Spy]]'' Reader Awards.{{cite news |last1=Robinson |first1=Abby |title=The Digital Spy Reader Awards 2018: Vote now for your Soap favourites of the year! |url=http://www.digitalspy.com/soaps/feature/a871228/best-soap-2018/ |accessdate=1 December 2018 |work=[[Digital Spy]] |publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]] |date=29 November 2018}} David's [[male rape]] storyline was also nominated in the "Best Soap Storyline" category, while David and Shona's partnership was nominated in the "Best Soap Couple" category. Fearing real-life imitation of the scene in which David was tortured by [[Charlie Stubbs (Coronation Street)|Charlie Stubbs]], many formal complaints were filed by viewers with the Government’s Office of Communications. In the end, "''Coronation Street'' was cleared by TV watchdogs after 31 complaints about scenes of 'bullying and torture'". Investigators eventually ruled that the torture scenes "were editorially justified by plot development, characters involved and the manner of editing."{{cite news |title=Coronation Street in the clear |work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]] |publisher=([[News UK]]) |date=13 March 2007 |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/article16967.ece |accessdate=16 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081209111248/http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/article16967.ece |archivedate=9 December 2008 |df=dmy }} Tony Stewart of the ''[[Daily Mirror]]'' refers to the character as "David Pratt" when writing reviews of any storyline he features in, due to the character's way of seemingly always getting away with outlandish things. In magazine articles he is often referred to as "Demon David", "Teen Tormenter" or "Psycho Platt".{{cite news|url=http://blogs.mirror.co.uk/soapland/2009/05/coronation-street-ted-man-walk.html |title=Coronation Street: Ted man walking |work=[[Daily Mirror]]|publisher=([[Trinity Mirror]]) |first=Tony|last=Stewart |date=30 May 2009 |accessdate=13 June 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090603072102/http://blogs.mirror.co.uk/soapland/2009/05/coronation-street-ted-man-walk.html |archivedate=3 June 2009 }}{{cite news|url=http://blogs.mirror.co.uk/soapland/2008/11/coronation-street-kitchen-sink.html |title=Coronation Street: Kitchen sink dramas |work=[[Daily Mirror]]|publisher=([[Trinity Mirror]]) |first=Tony|last=Stewart |date=8 November 2008 |accessdate=13 June 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090202233341/http://blogs.mirror.co.uk/soapland/2008/11/coronation-street-kitchen-sink.html |archivedate=2 February 2009 }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.itv.com/coronationstreet/characters/david-platt David Platt] at [[itv.com]] {{Coronation Street characters|present}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Platt, David}} [[Category:Coronation Street characters]] [[Category:Fictional criminals on soap operas]] [[Category:Fictional hairdressers]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 1990]] [[Category:Fictional victims of bullies]] [[Category:Fictional attempted suicides]] [[Category:Fictional victims of kidnapping]] [[Category:Fictional sexual assault victims]]

{{Spanish name|Jiménez|Muro}} {{Infobox person | name = Dolores Jiménez y Muro | image = Dolores jiménez y muro.PNG | alt = | caption = | birth_name = <!-- only use if different from name --> | birth_date = 7 June 1848 | birth_place = [[Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes]], Mexico | death_date = {{Death date and age|1925|10|15|1850|06|07|df=y}} | death_place = [[Mexico City]], Mexico | nationality = Mexican | other_names = | occupation = educator, revolutionary | years_active = 1911-1919 | known_for = Complot de Tacubaya | notable_works = }} '''Dolores Jiménez y Muro''' (June 7, 1848 – October 15, 1925) was a [[Mexico|Mexican]] schoolteacher and revolutionary. A native of [[Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes]], Mexico, she rose to prominence during the [[Mexican Revolution]] as a [[Socialist]] activist and reformer and as a supporter and associate of General [[Emiliano Zapata]].
==Biography== Dolores Jiménez y Muro was born June 7, 1848, in Aguascalientes, Mexico, but while young her family moved [[San Luis Potosí]].<ref name="GOB (1990)">{{cite web |title=Dolores Jiménez y Muro|url=http://www.aguascalientes.gob.mx/Aguascalientes2010/1910/personajes.html|accessdate=8 April 2015|publisher=Gobierno del Estado de Aguascalientes|year=1990 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170423050628/http://www.aguascalientes.gob.mx/Aguascalientes2010/1910/personajes.html |archive-date=2017-04-23 |language=es |df=mdy-all}}</ref> She grew up in the upper middle class of San Luis Potosí, where her father was a senior government official. The family had many liberal friends and from her childhood Jiménez was exposed to foreign and liberal ideas. She had no formal schooling, studying at home, but was encouraged to pursue her talent for poetry.<ref name="López (2001)">{{cite web|last1=López|first1=Oresta|last2=Hernández|first2=Varinia| title=Olvidadas mujeres de la revolución|url=http://www.jornada.unam.mx/2001/11/05/arts_39/39_dolores_imuro.htm|accessdate=8 April 2015|work=Jornada|date=5 November 2001|publisher=National Autonomous University of Mexico|language=Spanish |df=mdy-all}}</ref> In 1874, she was invited by the state government to read her poems at an official celebration of the September independence festivals. These poems were later collected into a book and published as ''Un rayo de luz'' (A Ray of Light).<ref name="Rivera (2008)">{{cite journal|last1=Rivera|first1=Amalia|title=Dolores Jiménez y Muro|journal=Toda Mujer|year=2008|url=http://qacontent.edomex.gob.mx/idc/idcplg?IdcService=GET_FILE&dID=134955&dDocName=DOLORES_JIM%C3%89NEZ_Y_MURO&allowInterrupt=1|accessdate=8 April 2015|publisher=GOB de Edomex|language=Spanish|df=mdy-all}}{{dead link|date=October 2017|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> In 1883 Jiménez lost both of her parents<ref name="López (2001)" /> and she began teaching school.<ref name="Rivera (2008)" /> She became aware of how easily one could fall into poverty or become exploited.<ref name="López (2001)" />
===Pre-Revolutionary radicalism=== Dolores Jiménez published in La Esmeralda and La Sombra de Zaragoza and by 1902 had become the director of La Potosina Magazine.<ref name="GOB (1990)" /> She continued to teach in the rural school system until 1904, when she moved to Mexico City. She published articles against the regime of [[Porfirio Díaz]]<ref name="Rappaport (2001)">{{cite book|last1=Rappaport|first1=Helen|title=Encyclopedia of Women Wocial Reformers|date=2001|publisher=ABC-CLIO|location=Santa Barbara, Calif. [u.a.]|isbn=1-57607-101-4|pages=340–341| url=https://books.google.com.mx/books?id=rpuSzowmIkgC&lpg=PP1&pg=PA340#v|accessdate=8 April 2015 |df=mdy-all}}</ref> and was arrested. In prison, she met [[Elisa Acuña|Elisa Acuña Rossetti]], [[Juana Belén Gutiérrez de Mendoza]], and [[Inés Malváez]]. From prison, the woman began publishing a radical journal, ''Fiat Lux''.<ref name="Mirandé (1981)">{{cite book|last1=Mirandé|first1=Alfredo|last2=Enríquez| first2=Evangelina|title=La Chicana: The Mexican-American Woman|date=1981|publisher=University of Chicago Press|location=Chicago |isbn=0-226-53160-0|pages=205–206|edition=Phoenix|url=https://books.google.com.mx/books?id=Q9Bgyns4suYC&lpg=PA205&ots|accessdate=4 April 2015 |df=mdy-all}}</ref> In 1905, she joined the staff of the ''La Mujer Mexicana'' (Mexican Women) for whom she worked until 1908. She also published articles in ''Diario del Hogar'' (Newspaper of the Home).<ref name="Rappaport (2001)" />
In 1907, Acuña, Belén and Jiménez y Muro founded the "Daughters of Anahuac", a group of about three hundred libertarian women, who demanded improved working conditions for women and advocated labor strikes. In 1908, Jiménez founded, with Acuña, Belén, and [[Jose Edilberto Pinelo]], a worker's organization in Mexico City called "Mexican Socialism." They continued to publish the newspaper ''Fiat Lux'', as the voice of an organization called the Mutual Society for Women.<ref name="Fair (2011)">{{cite news|last1=Fair|first1=José A.|title=Elisa Acuña maestra anarcofeminista de Mejico|url=http://puertoreal.cnt.es/bilbiografias-anarquistas/4020-2013-10-12-05-44-44.html|accessdate=4 April 2015|publisher=Confederacion Nacional del Trabajo uerto Real|date=May 12, 2011|language=Spanish |df=mdy-all}}</ref> In 1910, Jiménez and others founded the Club Femenil Antirreeleccionista Hijas de Cuauhtémoc (Anti-Reelectionist Women's Club: Daughters of Cuauhtémoc).<ref name="Rivera (2008)" /> The club, including members [[Mercedes Arvides]] and [[Julia Nava de Ruisánchez]] staged a demonstration in Mexico City on 11 September 1910 protesting election fraud.<ref name="López (2001)" /> These activities and a failed attempt at rebellion by supporters of Arriaga resulted in the arrest of Jiménez, Acuña, Belén, and [[María Dolores Malváes]] and their imprisonment at [[San Juan de Ulúa]] fortress in the [[Gulf of Mexico]].<ref name="Fair (2011)" />
===Revolutionary radicalism=== In prison in 1911, Dolores Jiménez continued to be politically active in jail and founded ''Regeneración y Concordia''.<ref name="Rappaport (2001)" /> Through this she sought to further the changes that she desired to see in Mexico. She envisioned a country where there were significant improvements to the economy and land reforms. She also wanted changes to improve the living conditions of women and indigenous people.<ref name="Mirandé (1981)" /> ''Regeneración y Concordia'' had feminist aims which her partners, Acuña, Belén and Sara Estela Ramírez joined her work.<ref name="Palomo Acosta (2010)">{{cite news|last1=Palomo Acosta|first1=Teresa|title=Sara Estela Ramírez|url=https://tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/fra60|accessdate=4 April 2015|agency=Texas State Historical Association|publisher=Handbook of Texas Online|date=June 15, 2010 |df=mdy-all}}</ref>
In March, 1911, [[Francisco I. Madero]] called for demonstrations in Guerrero, Michoacan, Tlaxcala, Puebla and Campeche, and Jiménez organized the protests.<ref name="Rivera (2008)" /> She was a notable contributor to the [[Complot de Tacubaya]], which sought to depose President [[Porfirio Díaz]] in favor of [[Francisco I. Madero]]. She is credited with writing "The Political and Social Plan", published on March 18, 1911, which outlined the ideas and aims of the conspirators. The "Plan" advocated a continuation of the demands the [[Mexican Liberal Party]] had made in 1906, including fair wages, affordable housing, improved working conditions, and curbs on foreign investment. It also promoted the decentralization of the country's education system, on the premise that a school's needs are best met when it is locally funded and controlled. Unlike earlier revolutionary theorists, however, Jiménez insisted that wage should be increased for women as well as for men. She also insisted that foreign firms operating in Mexico should be required to have at least half of their workforce made up of Mexicans.<ref name="Rappaport (2001)" />
After the plan was read in Mexico City on 31 October 1911, interim president [[Francisco León de la Barra]] had Jiménez arrested. In spite of her age, (she was in her 60s and most of her compatriot revolutionaries were in their 20s), she was refused release until she staged a hunger strike.<ref name="GOB (1990)" /> She realized that Madero was not a supporter of the radical reforms she supported and switched her loyalty to [[Emiliano Zapata]].<ref name="Rappaport (2001)" /> In 1913, she joined the Zapatista forces and developed the prologue to the [[Plan de Ayala]]. She directed the newspaper ''La voz de Juárez'' from which denounced the coup led by [[Victoriano Huerta]] to overthrow Madero.<ref name="GOB (1990)" /> Zapata appointed her to a position of brigadier general but that was insufficient to prevent an eleven-month imprisonment ordered in 1914 by Huerta.<ref name="López (2001)" /><ref name="Rivera (2008)" /> She was released from prison and rejoined Zapata until his assassination in 1919.<ref name="Rappaport (2001)" />
===Post-revolution=== Between 1921 and 1924, Jiménez worked in the [[Secretariat of Public Education (Mexico)|Secretary of Education]]'s Cultural Missions program.<ref name="Rivera (2008)" />
She died on October 15, 1925, in [[Mexico City]], at the age of 77.<ref name="GOB (1990)" />
==Selected works== *''Un rayo de luz''<ref name="Amozorrutia2011">{{cite book|last=Amozorrutia |first=Alina |title=101 mujeres en la historia de México: Todo lo que un mexicano debería saber|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=qlDiSa2lOy8C&pg=PT41 |trans-title=101 Women in Mexican history: All That a Mexican should Know |accessdate=2018-10-14 |date=2011-07-01 |publisher=Penguin Random House Grupo Editorial México |language=es |isbn=9786073104708 |page=41 |df=mdy-all}}</ref> *''Al inmortal Hidalgo''<ref>{{cite web |url=https://historiaygenero.files.wordpress.com/2008/04/lasoledadyelfuegodedoloresjimenezymuro-orestalopezyvariniahernandez.pdf |format=PDF |title=La soledad y el fuego de Dolores Jiménez y Muro |trans-title=The Solitude and Fire of Dolores Jiménez y Muro |first1=Oresta |last1=López |first2=Varinia |last2=Hernández |language=es ||page=6 |publisher=El Colegio de San Luis |access-date=2018-10-14 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> *''En el Aniversario'' Published in The Shadow of Zaragoza. Official Gazette of the State, September 15, 1874 p. 3 Volume. No. VIII, p. 787 *''Crepúscuo'' Published in: Joaquín Antonio Peñalosa, San Luis Potosí Literature XIX century, San Luis Potosí, SLP, Eds. UASLP 1991, pp. 272–273
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== * [http://www.suppressedhistories.net/articles/dolores.html Dolores Jiménez y Muro (1848-1925)]
