Todd VanDerWerff of [[Vox Media]] called Spacey's performance "hamstanding", and said, "It’s as if House of Cards wants to make Frank go full authoritarian dictator, but lacks the wherewithal to actually push its reality toward some sort of alternate dystopia."{{cite web|first=Todd|last=VanDerWerff|title=House of Cards season 5 review: Netflix’s drama plays differently in 2017 — but the reason has little to do with Trump|website=[[Vox (magazine]]|publisher=[[Vox Media]]|location=New York City|date=May 1, 2017|accessdate=July 21, 2018}} ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]''{{'}}s Daniel Flenberg called Spacey's Underwood "increasingly broad and hammy" in season 5,{{cite magazine|first=Daniel|last=Flenberg|title='House of Cards' Season 5: TV Review|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/house-cards-review-1008300|magazine=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=[[Eldridge Industries]]|location=Los Angeles, California|date=May 29, 2017|accessdate=July 22, 2018}} while ''Time''{{'}}s Daniel D'addario wrote that the character was too one-dimensional to elicit a good performance from Spacey: "Underwood isn’t [[Richard Nixon|Nixonian]] or [[Bill Clinton|Clintonian]] (pick your villain); he’s a flat character for whom recognition is its own reward. This may make the show a surprisingly good fit for our times. But onscreen as in life, the desire for fame alone is insufficient motivation to compel viewers to stay tuned."{{cite magazine|first=Daniel|last=D'addario|url=http://time.com/4793881/house-of-cards-returns-review/|title=Review: House of Cards Returns With a Thud|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=May 25, 2017|accessdate=July 22, 2018}} Other critics praised him, however. "Spacey’s honeysuckle drawl and flinty-eyed leer are as amusing as ever. He’s almost always the broadest performer in any given room, but that’s part of the show’s design — a way of drawing us into the character’s almost omnisciently evil mindset," wrote [[Vulture.com]]'s Matt Zoller Seitz.{{cite web|first=Matt|last=Zoller Seitz|url=http://www.vulture.com/2017/05/house-of-cards-season-five-review.html|title=House of Cards’ Fifth Season Is Bonkers, in a Good Way|website=[[Vulture.com]]|publisher=[[New York Media]]|date=May 29, 2017|accessdate=July 22, 2018}} ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''{{'}}s Jeff Jensen wrote, "Spacey seems invigorated by the material, and perhaps, our moment. He’s certainly buffed and honed Frank to a shine while grounding it, scuffing it, by playing to mortality and age. He’s an All-Star Survivor, but a gray one."{{cite magazine|first=Jeff|last=Jensen|url=http://ew.com/tv/2017/06/02/house-of-cards-season-5-review/|title=House of Cards review: Kevin Spacey and Robin Wright infuse 'wicked fun' into season 5|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|publisher=[[Meredith Corporation]]|location=New York City|date=June 2, 2017|accessdate=July 22, 2018}} Critics noted that the character of Frank Underwood gained a new resonance when considered in the context of the [[Trump administration]].{{cite magazine|first=Johana|last=Desta|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2017/05/house-of-cards-season-5-trump|title=Trump vs. Underwood: 7 Times House of Cards Hit a Little Too Close to Reality|magazine=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|publisher=[[Condé Nast]]|location=New York City|date=May 30, 2017|accessdate=July 23, 2018}} "In a deliciously cynical flourish, the commander-in-chief’s response to whisperings about his misdeeds is to conjure a bogeyman in the shape of terrorist group Ico, which he presents as a clear and imminent danger to America," Ed Power wrote for ''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]''. "This yields the returning series’s first stone-cold Trump-ism as Underwood announces plans to shut America’s borders to unwelcome outsiders. Real world events are further echoed as protestors gather outside the White House chanting 'not my President'."{{cite newspaper|first=Ed|last=Power|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/on-demand/0/house-cards-back-pitch-black-best-season-5-review/|title=House of Cards is back to its pitch-black best – season 5 review|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]|publisher=[[Telegraph Media Group]]|location=London, England|date=June 1, 2017|accessdate=July 22, 2018}} ===Awards and nominations=== At the [[3rd Critics' Choice Television Awards]], Spacey was nominated for [[Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Actor in a Drama Series|Best Actor in a Drama Series]] for his portrayal of Underwood.{{cite web|title=Big Bang, Horror Story, Parks & Rec, Good Wife, The Americans Lead Critics Choice Nominations|publisher=TVLine|url=http://tvline.com/2013/05/22/critics-choice-television-nominations-3rd-annual/|date=May 22, 2013|accessdate=May 22, 2013}} On July 18, 2013, [[Netflix]] earned the first [[Primetime Emmy Award]] nominations for original online only [[web television]] for the [[65th Primetime Emmy Awards]]. Three of its [[web series]], ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]'', ''[[Hemlock Grove (TV series)|Hemlock Grove]]'', and ''House of Cards'', earned nominations.{{cite news|first=Brian|last=Stelter|url=http://artsbeat.blogs.nytimes.com/2013/07/18/watching-for-the-2013-primetime-emmy-nominations/|title=Netflix Does Well in 2013 Primetime Emmy Nominations|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=New York Times Company|location=New York City|date=July 18, 2013|accessdate=July 18, 2013}} For the first time, three [[Primetime Emmy Award|Primetime Emmy]] nominations for lead roles were from [[web television]] series: [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series|Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series]] to Spacey for his portrayal of Frank Underwood, [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series|Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series]] to [[Robin Wright]] for her portrayal of Claire Underwood, and [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series|Outstanding Lead Actor in a Comedy Series]] to [[Jason Bateman]] for his portrayal of [[Michael Bluth]] in ''Arrested Development''. Spacey submitted "[[Chapter 1 (House of Cards)|Chapter 1]]" for consideration to earn his nomination.{{cite magazine|first=Jenelle|last=Riley|url=http://www.backstage.com/news/emmy-episode-submissions-actor-drama/|title=Emmy Episode Submissions: Lead Actor in a Drama|magazine=[[Backstage (magazine)|Backstage]]|publisher=Backstage, LLC|location=New York City|date=August 26, 2013|accessdate=September 10, 2013}} Spacey also earned a [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Television Series Drama|Golden Globe nomination for Best Actor in a Television Series Drama]] and a [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series|Screen Actors Guild nomination for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series]] nominations.{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/moviesnow/la-et-mn-sag-nominees-winners-complete-list,0,7835488.story#axzz2nHDa9Ozr|title=SAG nominations 2014: The complete list of nominees|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|publisher=[[Tronc]]|location=Los Angeles, California|date=December 11, 2013|accessdate=December 12, 2013}}{{cite web|first=Christopher John|last=Farley|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2013/12/12/golden-globes-nominations-2014-twelve-years-a-slave-american-hustle-among-nominees/|title=Golden Globes Nominations 2014: ’12 Years a Slave,’ ‘American Hustle’ Lead Field|newspaper=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|publisher=[[Dow Jones & Company]]|location=New York City|date=December 3, 2013|accessdate=December 3, 2013}} In season 2, Spacey won the Golden Globe for Best Actor in a Television Series Drama at the [[72nd Golden Globe Awards]] and Screen Actors Guild Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series at the [[21st Screen Actors Guild Awards]], as well as nominations for Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series at the [[66th Primetime Emmy Awards]] and a [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series|Screen Actors Guild nomination for Outstanding by an Ensemble in a Drama Series]].{{cite web|first=Bill|last=Carter|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/11/arts/television/2014-emmy-nominations-game-of-thrones-true-detective-among-the-honored.html|title=2014 Emmy Nominations: 'Breaking Bad,' 'True Detective' Among the Honored|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=New York Times Company|location=New York City|date=July 10, 2014|accessdate=July 10, 2014}}{{cite web |first=Matt Webb |last=Mitovich |url=http://tvline.com/2014/12/10/sag-nominations-2015-list-screen-actors-guild/ |title=SAG Awards: ''Modern Family'', ''Thrones'', ''Homeland'', ''Boardwalk'', ''Cards'' Lead Noms; ''Mad Men'' Shut Out; ''HTGAWM'', Maslany and Aduba Get Nods |website=TVLine|date=December 10, 2014 |accessdate=December 10, 2014}}{{cite web |first=Matt Webb |last=Mitovich|url=http://tvline.com/2014/12/11/golden-globe-nominations-2015-globes-awards-nominees/ |title=Golden Globes: ''Fargo'', ''True Detective'' Lead Nominations; ''Jane the Virgin'', ''Transparent'' Score Multiple Nods |website=TVLine |date=December 11, 2014 |accessdate=December 11, 2014}}{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/movies/2015/01/11/golden-globes-winners-list/21586087/|title=List: Who won Golden Globe awards |newspaper=[[USA Today]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|location=Mclean, Virginia|date=January 11, 2015|accessdate=January 12, 2015}}{{cite web |first=Sarene|last=Leeds|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2015/01/26/sag-awards-the-complete-2015-winners-list/|title=SAG Awards: The Complete 2015 Winners List|newspaper=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|publisher=[[Dow Jones & Company]]|location=New York City|date=January 26, 2015|accessdate=January 27, 2015}} In season 3, Spacey was nominated for Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series at the [[67th Primetime Emmy Awards]], his third nomination for the role.{{cite web |url=http://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2015/outstanding-lead-actor-in-a-drama-series|title=67th Emmy Awards Nominees and Winners|work=[[Emmy Awards|Emmys]]|author=|date=|accessdate=July 20, 2015}} He also was nominated for both Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series and Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series at the [[22nd Screen Actors Guild Awards]].{{cite web |first=Michael |last=Ausiello| url=http://tvline.com/2015/12/09/sag-nominations-2016-list-screen-actors-guild/ |title=SAG Awards: Game of Thrones, Homeland, House of Cards Lead Noms; Empire, Inside Amy Schumer Shut Out; Mr. Robot's Rami Malek Sneaks In |website=[[TVLine]] |date=December 9, 2015 |accessdate=December 10, 2015}} For his performance in season 4, Spacey earned a nomination for Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series at the [[68th Primetime Emmy Awards]].{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/emmys-2016-full-list-nominations-910903/item/best-drama-series-emmy-nominations-910871|title=Emmys 2016: The Full List of Nominations|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=[[Eldridge Industries]]|location=Los Angeles, California|date=July 14, 2016|accessdate=July 20, 2016}} For his performance in season 5, Spacey received his fifth consecutive Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series nomination for the [[69th Primetime Emmy Awards]].{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/emmys-2017-full-list-nominations-1018796|title=Emmys 2017: The Full List of Nominations|magazine=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|publisher=[[Eldridge Industries]]|location=Loss Angeles, California|author=|date=July 13, 2017|accessdate=August 1, 2017}} ==Notes== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{House of Cards}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Underwood, Frank}} agnostics]] [[Category:Fictional bisexual males]] [[Category:Fictional victims of child abuse]] [[Category:Fictional polyamorous characters]] [[Category:Fictional characters from South Carolina]] House of Representatives]] [[Category:Fictional murderers]] [[Category:Fictional Presidents of the United States]] [[Category:Fictional Vice Presidents of the United States]] [[Category:Fictional white-collar criminals]]

revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.2) ([[User:Balon Greyjoy|Balon Greyjoy]])
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2013}} {{BLP sources|date=April 2009}} {{Infobox politician | honorific-prefix = | name = Fred Li Wah-ming | native_name = {{nobold|李華明}} | native_name_lang = zh-hk | image = Li-Wah-ming.jpg | imagesize =180px | caption = | office = Member of the [[Legislative Council of Hong Kong|Legislative Council]] | term_start = 9 October 1991 | term_end = 31 July 1995 | predecessor = ''New seat'' | successor = ''Constituency abolished'' | constituency = [[Kowloon_East_(constituency)#1991_Constituencies|Kowloon East]] | term_start1 = 11 October 1995 | term_end1 = 30 June 1997 | predecessor1 = ''New constituency'' | successor1 = ''Replaced by [[Provisional Legislative Council]]'' | constituency1 = [[Kowloon South-east (constituency)|Kowloon South-east]] | term_start2 = 1 July 1998 | term_end2 = 30 September 2012 | predecessor2 = ''New parliament'' | successor2 = [[Wu Chi-wai]] | constituency2 = [[Kowloon East (constituency)|Kowloon East]] | ancestry = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1955|04|25}} | birth_place = [[Hong Kong]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[Right of abode issue, Hong Kong#Citizenship and residence in Hong Kong|Hong Kong Chinese]] | spouse = Lorine Yip | party = [[Democratic Party (Hong Kong)|Democratic Party]] | otherparty = [[Meeting Point]] {{small|(until 1994)}} | relations = | children = | religion = [[Roman Catholicism]] | residence = [[Hong Kong]] | alma_mater = | occupation = [[Social worker]]
[[Legislative Councillor]] | profession = | website = }} '''Fred Li Wah-ming''' {{small|[[Silver Bauhinia Star|SBS]] [[Justice of the Peace|JP]]}} ([[Traditional Chinese character|Chinese]]: 李華明; born 25 April 1955, [[Hong Kong]]) is a member of the [[Legislative Council of Hong Kong]] representing the constituency of [[Kowloon East]]. He was a member of the [[Kwun Tong]] [[District Council of Hong Kong|District Council]] for [[Tsui Ping (constituency)|Tsui Ping]]. He was a [[social worker]] before being a legislator. He is a member of the Hong Kong [[Democratic Party (Hong Kong)|Democratic Party]]. ==Views, policy positions and Legco voting== In June 2010, he voted with the party in favour of the government's [[Consultation Document on the Methods for Selecting the Chief Executive and for Forming the LegCo in 2012|2012 constitutional reform package]], which included the late amendment by the Democratic Party – accepted by the [[Government of the People's Republic of China|Beijing government]] – to hold a popular vote for five new [[District Councils of Hong Kong|District Council]] [[Functional constituency (Hong Kong)|functional constituencies]].{{cite news | last = Cheung | first = Gary |author2=Albert Wong |author3=Fanny WY Fung | title = Cheers and jeers for political reform vote | newspaper = [[South China Morning Post|SCMP]] | date = 25 June 2010 | url = http://www.scmp.com/ | accessdate = 25 June 2010}} ==Citations== {{Reflist}} ==References== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20120808075308/http://www.legco.gov.hk/general/english/members/yr08-12/lwm.htm Members' Biographies] ==External links== *[http://www.123exp-biographies.com/t/00031276564/] Fred Li's biodata {{s-start}} {{s-par|hk}} {{s-new|seat}} {{s-ttl|title=Member of Legislative Council|district=[[Kowloon East (constituency)|Kowloon East]]|years=1991–1995 |alongside=[[Szeto Wah]]}} {{s-aft|after=Himself|as=Representative for Kowloon South-east}} {{s-bef|before=Himself|as=Representative for Kowloon East}} {{s-ttl|title=Member of Legislative Council|district=[[Kowloon East (constituency)#Kowloon South-east|Kowloon South-east]] |years=1995–1997}} {{s-non|reason=Replaced by
[[Provisional Legislative Council]]}} {{s-new|seat}} {{s-ttl|title=Member of Legislative Council|district=[[Kowloon East (constituency)|Kowloon East]] |years=1998–2012 |with=[[Szeto Wah]] (1998–2004) |with2=[[Chan Yuen Han]] (1998–2008) |with3=[[Chan Kam-lam]] (2000–2012) |with4=[[Albert Cheng]] (2004–2008) |with5=[[Alan Leong]] (2004–2012) |with6=[[Wong Kwok-kin]] (2008–2012)}} {{s-aft|after=[[Wu Chi-wai]]}} {{s-end}} {{HKLegco 2008}} {{HKLegco 2004}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Li, Fred}} [[Category:1955 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:District councillors of Kwun Tong District]] [[Category:Hong Kong politicians]] [[Category:Hong Kong Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Members of the Legislative Council of Hong Kong]] [[Category:Hong Kong social workers]] [[Category:Charter 08 signatories]] [[Category:Democratic Party (Hong Kong) politicians]] [[Category:Meeting Point politicians]] [[Category:Members of the Urban Council of Hong Kong]] [[Category:HK LegCo Members 1991–95]] [[Category:HK LegCo Members 1995–97]] [[Category:HK LegCo Members 1998–2000]] [[Category:HK LegCo Members 2000–04]] [[Category:HK LegCo Members 2004–08]] [[Category:HK LegCo Members 2008–12]] [[Category:Recipients of the Silver Bauhinia Star]] {{HK-politician-stub}}

{{more citations needed|date=November 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Gian-Carlo Coppola | image = | imagesize = | caption = | birthname = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1963|9|17|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. | death_date = {{Death date and age|1986|5|26|1963|9|17}} | death_place = [[Annapolis, Maryland]], U.S. | cause_of_death = Speedboating accident | spouse = | partner = Jacqui de la Fontaine (engaged) | children = [[Gia Coppola]] | parents = [[Francis Ford Coppola]]
[[Eleanor Coppola|Eleanor Neil]] | relatives = [[Roman Coppola]] {{small|(brother)}}
[[Sofia Coppola]] {{small|(sister)}} | family = [[Coppola family tree|Coppola]] | occupation = Film producer }} '''Gian-Carlo Coppola''' (September 17, 1963 – May 26, 1986) was an American film producer. ==Early life== Coppola was born in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], the son of set decorator/artist [[Eleanor Coppola]] ([[married and maiden names|née]] Neil) and famed film director [[Francis Ford Coppola]]. As the eldest Coppola sibling, he was the older brother to [[Roman Coppola|Roman]] and [[Sofia Coppola|Sofia]]. Gian-Carlo was close friends and once a couple with [[Tracy Reiner]], daughter of director [[Penny Marshall]]. ==Career== Gian-Carlo began his professional filmmaking career at the age of 16, working closely with his father. Like his brother and sister, Gian-Carlo—known to his family and friends as Gio—often featured in his father's movies as background characters (''[[The Godfather]]'', ''[[The Conversation]]'', ''[[Apocalypse Now#Redux|Apocalypse Now Redux]]'' and ''[[Rumble Fish]]''), later acting as associate producer for ''Rumble Fish'' and ''[[The Outsiders (film)|The Outsiders]]'', and second unit director on ''[[The Cotton Club (film)|The Cotton Club]].'' In ''The Godfather'', he appeared with his brother Roman as the two sons of [[Robert Duvall]]'s [[Tom Hagen]] character, and they can be seen during the street fight and [[Vito Corleone]]'s funeral right behind Duvall and [[Al Pacino]]. During the pre-production phase of ''Gardens of Stone'', Gian-Carlo was given the responsibility of filming the rehearsals and supervising the electronic cinema staff. There was also potential for Gian-Carlo to intern with director Steven Spielberg to work on the television series ''Amazing Stories'' before his passing. Director Penny Marshall had also hired him to work on the second unit for her feature film ''Jumpin' Jack Flash.'' ==Death== Coppola was killed in a speedboating accident on Memorial Day, 1986, aged 22, in [[Annapolis, Maryland]]. [[Griffin O'Neal]], who was piloting the boat, had attempted to pass between two slow-moving boats, unaware that both boats were connected by a towline. While O'Neal barely had time to duck, Coppola was struck and killed.Tatum O'Neal, ''A Paper Life'', 0-060-75102-9 p. 158 At the time of the incident, O'Neal was being directed by Francis Ford Coppola in ''[[Gardens of Stone]]'' and was subsequently replaced. O'Neal was later charged with manslaughter over the accident. He ultimately pleaded guilty to the lesser charge of "negligent operation of a boat", was fined $200 and sentenced to 18 months' probation in 1987. He eventually received an 18-day jail sentence for not performing 400 hours of community service as ordered. At the time of his death, Coppola's fiancée, Jacqui de la Fontaine, was two months pregnant with their only daughter, [[Gia Coppola|Gian-Carla "Gia" Coppola]] (born on January 1, 1987). Gia is a writer-director, having made the 2013 film ''[[Palo Alto (2013 film)|Palo Alto]]''. Francis Ford Coppola subsequently dedicated 1988's ''[[Tucker: The Man and His Dream]]'' to his son. A scene in Francis Ford Coppola's 2011 film ''[[Twixt (film)|Twixt]]'' shows the death of a character as being similar to his son's death. At the Inglenook winery, owned by Eleanor and Francis in Napa, California, there is a 12-acre vineyard named the 'Gio vineyard,' after Gian-Carlo by the workers, which was planted in 1988. Eleanor Coppola's touring art installation, 'Circle of Memory,' commemorates the life of Gian-Carlo and has been exhibited in San Diego, Oakland, Sante Fe, Montpellier, Salzburg, Stockholm, and Oslo. ==Selected filmography== *''[[The Godfather]]'' (1972) – Baptism Observer (uncredited) *''[[The Conversation]]'' (1974) – Boy in Church (uncredited) *''[[Apocalypse Now|Apocalypse Now Redux]]'' (1979) – Gilles de Marais (Redux version only) *''[[Rumble Fish]]'' (1983) – Cousin James (final film role) ==See also== {{Empty section|date=May 2015}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Coppola family}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|id=0178887|name=Gian-Carlo Coppola}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Coppola, Gian-Carlo}} [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:1986 deaths]] [[Category:Accidental deaths in Maryland]] [[Category:American male film actors]] [[Category:American people of Italian descent]] [[Category:Coppola family]] [[Category:Male actors from Los Angeles]] [[Category:20th-century American male actors]] [[Category:Boating accident deaths]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=July 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Hemendra Mohan Bose
হেমেন্দ্রমোহন বসু | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = 1864 | birth_place = [[Mymensingh]], [[Bengal Presidency|Bengal]], [[British India]] | death_date = 28 August 1916 (aged 52) | death_place = [[Kolkata]], [[Bengal Presidency|Bengal]], [[British India]] | occupation = Entrepreneur | spouse = | children = Jiten Bose, [[Nitin Bose]], Ganesh Bose, Kartik Bose, [[Malati Ghosal]] | nationality = [[British India]] | parents = Haramohan Basu }} '''Hemendra Mohan Bose''' ({{lang-bn|হেমেন্দ্রমোহন বসু}}) (1864 – 28 August 1916) was an Indian [[entrepreneur]], manufacturer of Kuntalin hair oil and Delkhosh brand of perfume.{{cite encyclopedia |editor1-last=Sengupta |editor1-first=Subhodh Chandra |editor2-last=Basu |editor2-first=Anjali |encyclopedia=Samsad Bangali Charitabhidhan (Bibliographical Dictionary) |title=হেমেন্দ্রমোহন বসু |trans-title=Hemendramohan Basu |language=Bengali |edition=4th |date=January 2002 |publisher=Shishu Sahitya Samsad |volume=Volume 1 |location=Kolkata |isbn=81-85626-65-0 |pages=642}} He was the first Indian to manufacture [[phonograph|gramophone]]s.{{cite book |last=Islam |first=Sirajul |year=2012 |chapter=Bose, Hemendra Mohan |chapter-url=http://en.banglapedia.org/index.php?title=Bose,_Hemendra_Mohan |editor1-last=Islam |editor1-first=Sirajul |editor1-link=Sirajul Islam |editor2-last=Jamal |editor2-first=Ahmed A. |title=Banglapedia: National Encyclopedia of Bangladesh |edition=Second |publisher=[[Asiatic Society of Bangladesh]]}} Many of his businesses spurred from [[amateur|amateur pursuit]]s.{{cite news | url=https://www.thehindu.com/thehindu/mp/2002/08/07/stories/2002080700200400.htm | title=Centenarian of the musical kind | newspaper=[[The Hindu]] | date=7 August 2002 | accessdate=22 July 2018 }} == Early life == Bose was born in 1866 in [[Mymensingh]], where his father Haramohan Bose used to stay, the ancestral home of the family was in the village of Jaysiddhi, in [[Mymensingh District]]. According to Michael Kinnear, Bose was born in 1864 at his ancestral village.{{cite book |title=The Gramaphone Company's First Indian recordings, 1899-1908 |last=Kinnear |first=Michael S. |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=1994 |publisher=Popular Prakashan |location= |isbn=81-7154-728-1 |pages=42–44 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=3DjL3WcQ2kEC |accessdate=31 August 2011}} After passing I.A. he took admission in the [[Medical College Kolkata]]. While a student at the college, he suffered an accident where his eyes were scarred in acid. After recovering, he quit his medical career. In 1890, Bose began experimenting with perfume, and started his move into business.Kinnear 42 == Career == In 1894, Bose started his own business in perfume manufacturing, the H-Bose Perfumers at 62 [[Bowbazar Street]] in [[Kolkata]], where he distilled the perfumes. After the initial success, he added hair oil and other toiletries like lavender water, [[Eau de Cologne]], milk of rose etc. to his range of products. He also set up a new manufacturing unit at 6 Shib Narayan Das Lane in Kolkata. His products included the famous Kuntalin hair oil and Delkhosh perfume. By 1900, he had created a [[printing press]] and publishing house titled ''Kuntaline Press'' at 5 Shib Narayan Das Lane in [[Kolkata]] which incidentally was next door to his perfume business. In 1903, he instituted the Kuntalin Puraskar and encouraged young writers to showcase their talent. A short story written by [[Jagadish Chandra Bose]] was the first recipient of the Kuntalin Puraskar. Later Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay's first printed publication ''Mandira'' won the Kuntalin Puraskar. Bose was a bicycle enthusiast. He himself could ride the bicycle and taught his friends how to ride it. In 1903, he along with his brother Jatindra Mohon Bose established the first Indian-owned cycle works the H. Bose and Co, - Cycles at 63-1, Harrison Road. The company was also the distributors of the [[Rover (motorcycles)|Rover]] bicycles. It was one of the first among his [[Swadeshi movement|Swadeshi]] ventures. He also learnt how to drive a motor car. In 1900, he bought a two sitter motor car and used to drive it himself. He established the Great Eastern Motor Company and set up a repairing unit, the Great Eastern Motor Works in Park Street. === Sound recording === In 1900, Bose began to make [[sound recordings]] privately,Vernon 53 after he had acquired an Edison [[phonograph]]. He began recording his friends in a leisurely fashion. Some of the first people recorded by H. Bose included his uncle, [[Jagadish Chandra Bose|Sir Jagadish Chandra Bose]], [[Prafulla Chandra Roy|P. C. Roy]], and his good friend [[Rabindranath Tagore]]. His company became known as "Bose Pathe Recordings" which later became "H. Bose Swadeshi Records". By 1907, the demand for Bose's recordings grew so great that he began producing his own [[Phonograph cylinder|cylinders]] for recording. H. Bose was a well known patron of the Swadeshi movement and many of his records covered this subject. == Achievements == Bose was the pioneer of [[color photography]] in India. He used [[Autochrome Lumière]] slides for his photographs. He was the founder president of Sporting Union. ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== *Kinnear, Michael S. ''Gramophone Company's First Indian Recordings''. Popular Prakashan, 1994. *Vernon, Paul. ''Ethnic and Vernacular Music, 1898-1960: A Resource and Guide to Recordings''. Greenwood Press, 1995. {{Ray family}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bose, Hemendra Mohan}} [[Category:1864 births]] [[Category:1916 deaths]] [[Category:Bengali people]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Kolkata]] [[Category:People from Mymensingh District]] [[Category:University of Calcutta alumni]]

[[Joe Alaskey]] (2003–2005) | species = [[Peromyscus maniculatus|Deer mouse]] | lbl21 = Annoyances
Enemies | data21 = [[Cat]]s }} '''Hubie and Bertie''' are [[animation|animated cartoon]] [[mouse]] [[fictional character|characters]] in the [[Warner Bros.]] ''[[Looney Tunes]]'' and ''[[Merrie Melodies]]'' series of cartoons. Hubie and Bertie represent some of [[animator]] [[Chuck Jones]]' earliest work that was intended to be funny rather than cute. All of their cartoons were given Blue Ribbon reissues. ==First film== Jones introduced Hubie and Bertie in the [[short film|short]] ''[[The Aristo-Cat]]'', first released on June 19, 1943.[http://www.toonopedia.com/hub-bert.htm Hubie and Bertie] at [[Don Markstein's Toonopedia]]. [https://www.webcitation.org/6f3zi5vEG?url=http://www.toonopedia.com/hub-bert.htm Archived] from the original on February 5, 2016. The plot of the cartoon would serve as the template for most future Hubie/Bertie outings: a character with some mental illness or degree of naïveté (here, a cat who doesn't know what a mouse looks like) is psychologically tormented by the pair. They tell the hungry cat that he is a lion and a bulldog his prey, leading to several painful encounters for the cat.{{cite web|url=http://www.craveonline.com/culture/194407-the-top-5-chuck-jones-mouse-cartoons |title=The Top 5 Chuck Jones Mouse Cartoons |date=August 21, 2012 |publisher=[[CraveOnline]] |accessdate=October 22, 2016 |archivedate=October 22, 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20161022155750/http://www.craveonline.com/culture/194407-the-top-5-chuck-jones-mouse-cartoons |deadurl=no |df=mdy-all }} Hubie and Bertie as designed by Jones are nearly identical mice with long snouts, large ears, and big, black noses. The two are [[anthropomorphic]], walking on their stubby hind legs and using their forelimbs as arms. They are primarily distinguished by their color: one is brown with a lighter-colored belly and face, while the other is gray. (Which mouse is which color changes from film to film.){{citation needed|date=February 2016}} Hubie has a [[Brooklyn]] accent. Bertie has large buck teeth, and a habit of responding to Hubie with "Yeah-yeah, sure-sure!" or snickering "Riot!" if Hubie has just proposed some scheme with comic potential. [[Mel Blanc]] voiced Hubie. While historians differ on who voiced Bertie in the initial cartoon, [[Stan Freberg]] voiced him subsequently. ==Later films== Bertie made a cameo in ''[[Odor-able Kitty]]''. ''[[Trap Happy Porky]]'' (February 24, 1945) was their second appearance. Nameless, indistinguishable except for color, they appear only in the first act, stealing food from a Porky in nightshirt & cap. They are silent except for a single "I'm only three and a half years old", and retreat when a cat shows up. Jones would repeat the theme of mind-games several more times in his Hubie and Bertie shorts, as in their third cartoon, ''Roughly Squeaking'' on November 23, 1946. This time, Jones has the mice exploit a cat's stupidity by convincing him he's a [[lion]] and a [[dog]] is a [[moose]] he wants to eat. By the short's end, the cat thinks he's a lion, the dog believes he's a [[pelican]], and a bystanding bird (driven mad from watching the two) has pulled his feathers out and imagines himself a [[Thanksgiving]] [[turkey meat|turkey]]. The mice are here voiced by [[Mel Blanc]] (Hubie) and [[Stan Freberg]] (Bertie). The short was followed by ''[[House Hunting Mice]]'' on September 6, 1947, where Hubie and Bertie run afoul of a housekeeping [[robot]]. In the next cartoon, ''[[Mouse Wreckers]]'', and for the remainder of the series, Blanc and Freberg would handle the voices of Hubie and Bertie, respectively. ==Cat and mouse== Jones introduced a permanent "antagonist" of sorts for the mice in ''[[Mouse Wreckers]]''. The short was released in 1949 and was the first in which they are officially called "Hubie" and "Bertie". In the cartoon, the duo moves into a new home, only to discover that it is protected by champion mouser [[Claude Cat]] (the character's debut), voiced by Mel Blanc. The mice torment the cat both physically and mentally. The short was nominated for an [[Academy Award for Animated Short Film|Academy Award]].{{bcdb title|407|Mouse Wreckers}} Retrieved on May 9, 2011. The mice would antagonize Claude in two more films: ''[[The Hypo-Chondri-Cat]]'', released in 1950, featured Hubie and Bertie making Claude think he's sick with various ailments and, ultimately, that he has died. In 1951's ''[[Cheese Chasers]]'', Hubie and Bertie inadvertently torment Claude when, after going overboard on a cheese raid and getting sick of their favorite food, they decide to commit suicide by trying to get Claude to eat them. After these seven cartoons, Jones retired Hubie and Bertie but continued to use the characters (or mice resembling them) in [[Cameo appearance|cameo]] roles in other shorts whenever he needed a generic mouse for a gag, such as the unnamed mouse in ''[[Chow Hound]]'', who resembles Bertie, or the "killer" mice in ''[[Scaredy Cat]]''. ==Home Video== All of the Hubie and Bertie cartoons are available, remastered, on ''[[Looney Tunes Mouse Chronicles: The Chuck Jones Collection]]'' on DVD and Blu-Ray. ==Later appearances== Hubie and Bertie have made several cameos in Warner Bros. productions: * They have also appeared in ''[[Tiny Toon Adventures]]''. * Hubie and Bertie appear in ''[[The Sylvester and Tweety Mysteries]]''. * In the 1996 movie ''[[Space Jam]]'', Hubie and Bertie play the [[public address]] [[announcer]]s during the basketball game where [[Michael Jordan]] and the Looney Tunes compete against the MonStars. Bertie's announcer voice was provided by [[Steve Kehela]]. * Hubie and Bertie make a cameo in ''[[Tweety's High-Flying Adventure]]''. * Hubie and Bertie appear in the ''[[Duck Dodgers (TV series)|Duck Dodgers]]'' episode "Too Close for Combat." They are hired by Queen Tyr'Ahnee and Martian Commander X-2 to break up Duck Dodgers and the Eager Young Space Cadet with their vocal impersonations of them. It nearly worked until Duck Dodgers and Cadet discovered them. They managed to persuade Hubie and Bertie into using their tricks on Queen Tyr'Ahnee and Martian Commander X-2. * Hubie and Bertie briefly appear in ''[[The Looney Tunes Show]]'' opening. * Hubie and Bertie appear in the ''[[New Looney Tunes]]'' segments "Appropriate Technology", "Daffy the Stowaway" and "Tweet Team". * Hubie and Bertie have also appeared in some video games. * Hubie is seen alone in the ''[[Bugs Bunny: Lost in Time]]'' level "The Carrot Factory". * Both can be seen in the ''[[Space Jam (video game)|Space Jam]]'' video game. ==Filmography== * ''[[The Aristo-Cat]]'' (1943) * ''[[Trap Happy Porky]]'' (1945) * ''[[Roughly Squeaking]]'' (1946) * ''[[House Hunting Mice]]'' (1947) * ''[[Mouse Wreckers]]'' (1949) * ''[[The Hypo-Chondri-Cat]]'' (1950) * ''[[Cheese Chasers]]'' (1951) ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Looney Tunes & Merrie Melodies}} {{Chuck Jones}} [[Category:Fictional mice and rats]] [[Category:Fictional tricksters]] [[Category:Looney Tunes characters]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 1943]] [[Category:Fictional anthropomorphic characters]] [[Category:Animated duos]]

{{Portuguese name|Goulart|Dourado}} {{Infobox model | name = Izabel Goulart | image = Cannes 2017 36.jpg | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = Maria Izabel Goulart Dourado | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1984|10|23|df=y}} | birth_place = [[São Carlos]], [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]], [[Brazil]] | occupation = Model | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = | height = {{height|m=1.79}}{{cite web|url=http://www.womenmanagement.com/Models/1-1942/IZABEL%20GOULART/|title=Portfolio at Women Management, New York|accessdate=2013-11-25|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131202233201/http://www.womenmanagement.com/Models/1-1942/IZABEL%20GOULART/|archivedate=2013-12-02|df=}} | hair_color = Brown | eye_color = Brown | agency = {{Plainlist| * Supreme Management (New York) * [[Women Management]] (Paris) * [[Elite Model Management]] (Milan, London) * Traffic Models (Barcelona) * MP Miami (Miami) * [[Louisa Models]] (Munich) * Mega Model Brazil (Sao Paulo)https://models.com/models/Izabel-Goulart }} }} '''Maria Izabel Goulart Dourado''' (born October 23, 1984), better known as '''Izabel Goulart''', is a [[Brazi]]lian model. She is best known as having been one of the [[Victoria's Secret#Victoria's Secret Angels|Victoria's Secret Angels]] from 2005 to 2016 and for her work with ''[[Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue]]'' and [[Armani Exchange]]. ==Early life and career== Goulart was born in [[São Carlos]], [[São Paulo (state)|São Paulo]]. She is of [[Portuguese people|Portuguese]] and [[Italian people|Italian]] descent, and has four brothers and one sister.[http://models.com/model_culture/model_of_week/izabel/index.html Profile] at Models.com; retrieved on 16 May 2007. Goulart once said, "the hardest part about being [a Victoria's Secret Angel] is I spend time away from my mom's food and away from my home with my five brothers and sister".{{cite web| title=Behind the Scenes with a Victoria's Secret Angel|url=http://www.eonline.com/gossip/planetgossip/detail/index.jsp?uuid=b339a24b-47ef-4e98-a4d4-e1ae551fc3a8&sid=fd-hot4-txt|accessdate=2007-12-16}} School was a particularly rough time for Goulart, as she was made fun of for her skinny build and was called names such as "giraffe".{{cite news| url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,314106,00.html|title=Victoria's Scarring Secrets: Teased for Being Too Skinny | work=Fox News |date=2007-11-30 |accessdate=2007-12-16}} While shopping for groceries with her mother at age 14, a hairstylist suggested that she should become a model. She moved to the state capital, [[São Paulo]], and started modeling, moving to France shortly afterwards to develop her career. Goulart returned to São Paulo in August 2001 (aged 17), where she joined former agency Success. Her career in the Brazilian fashion world was launched by Ney Alves, currently the director of Major Models Brazil.[http://modelomania.wordpress.com/tag/ney-alves/ Modelomania, All about the lives of models] Retrieved on 2013-12-3 ==Modeling career== During Goulart's first ever fashion show appearance, she experienced a [[wardrobe malfunction]] when her top fell open. The incident made many Brazilian newspapers. She eventually put this event behind her and returned to the runway to model collections for A-list designers such as [[Alberta Ferretti]], [[Bill Blass]], [[Balenciaga]], [[Bottega Veneta]], [[Isabel Marant]], [[Givenchy]], [[Altuzarra]], [[Oscar de la Renta]], [[Valentino Garavani|Valentino]], [[Balmain (fashion house)|Balmain]], [[Jil Sander]], [[Chanel]], [[Michael Kors]], [[Ralph Lauren]], [[Emilio Pucci]], [[Dolce and Gabbana]], [[Emanuel Ungaro]], [[Loewe, S.A.|Loewe]], [[Roberto Cavalli]] and [[Stella McCartney]], among others."[http://www.askmen.com/women/models_300/371c_izabel_goulart.html Izabel Goulart Biography] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070715051546/http://www.askmen.com/women/models_300/371c_izabel_goulart.html |date=2007-07-15 }}". askmen.com. Retrieved on 2007-05-16. Goulart has also modeled for [[H&M]], [[Express (clothing retailer)|Express]], [[Neiman Marcus]], [[Missoni]] and [[DSquared²]]. In 2005, Goulart appeared on the covers of the April edition of ''[[Marie Claire]]'' France and, in December, ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'' Brazil.{{cite web |url= http://www.fashionmodeldirectory.com/models/izabel_goulart/ |title= Izabel Goulart |publisher= [[Fashion Model Directory]]|accessdate= }} She first appeared in the [[Victoria's Secret|Victoria's Secret Fashion Show]] in 2005, the year she was contracted as an Angel. She received a star on the Hollywood "Walk of Fame" prior to the [[Victoria's Secret Fashion Show 2007]].{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/2007/11/15/pop-tarts-victoria-secret-angels-have-ugly-days-except-adriana-lima/ |title=Pop Tarts: Victoria's Secret Angels Have Ugly Days ... Except Adriana Lima |publisher=[[FoxNews.com]] |date=15 November 2007 |accessdate=10 January 2014}} Although she is no longer an Angel, Goulart walked in the 2005, 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016 Victoria's Secret Fashion Shows. In 2008, she replaced fellow Victoria's Secret Angel [[Alessandra Ambrosio]] as the face of A/X Armani Exchange and she was featured in three seasonal print campaigns for the label.[http://models.com/models/izabel-goulart/10 Armani Exchange 08]. Retrieved 16 January 2014. In 2010, Goulart appeared on the cover of the October issue for ''[[GQ]] Mexico'', ''Vogue'' Brasil and appeared in a campaign for [[Avon Products|Avon]]. In the same year, she was voted the best international top model by the magazine ''[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]]'' Mexico.[http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/estilos/67118.html Top Glamour Awards 2010] In 2011, Goulart appeared in the ''[[Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue]]''. She can be seen in the spring/summer 2011 campaign for Dolce and Gabbana, the Pre-Fall 2011 campaign for Givenchy, Yamamay's 10th Anniversary Collection and the Fall/Winter 2011 campaign for DKNY Jeans.[http://models.com/models/Izabel-Goulart Izabel Goulart | Models.com Database] The same year, she ranked number 100 in ''[[FHM]]'' magazine's list of the 100 Sexiest Women In The World.[http://www.fhm.com/girls/100-sexiest-women-in-the-world-2011--the-top-ten-20100127 100 Sexiest Women in the World 2011] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20120729215427/http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fhm.com%2Fgirls%2F100-sexiest-women-in-the-world-2011--the-top-ten-20100127 |date=2012-07-29 }}, FHM magazine. She also appeared on one of the four covers of Elle Brasil. In February 2012, she was photographed by Dusan Reljin for ''Vogue'' Spain, and later that year by [[Mario Testino]], again for ''Vogue'' Spain, in an editorial entitled "Las majas", which also featured [[Alessandra Ambrosio]], [[Doutzen Kroes]], [[Miranda Kerr]] and [[Isabeli Fontana]]. In November, she was recognised as "Fashion Personality of the Year" by the Brazilian magazine ''Isto é Gente'',[http://www.istoegente.com.br/noticias/especial/o-pulo-da-camaleoa/ The Leap of Chameleon, Isto é Gente magazine. Retrieved 15 January 2014] and she also appeared on the cover of ''[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]]'' Brazil in December 2012. In February 2013 she appeared on the cover of one of the four issues of ''Vogue'' Brasil, together with [[Bette Franke]], [[Magdalena Frackowiak]], and [[Mirte Maas]]. In mid-2013, she became the face of [[MAC Cosmetics]] Tropical Taboo range and she was photographed by Zee Nunes for the October edition of ''Vogue'' Brazil in an editorial entitled "Olympiada Fashion". Later that year she appeared in a campaign for Agua De Coco promoting its spring/summer 2014 beachwear collection. She also appeared on the cover of ''GQ'' Portugal in December 2013, after she was elected as the magazine's "International Woman of the Year" in May of that year.[http://gq.globo.com/Musa/noticia/2013/11/izabel-goulart-e-eleita-mulher-do-ano-pela-gq-de-portugal.html Izabel Goulart was elected Woman of the Year by GQ Portugal] ''GQ Brazil'' (27 November 2013). Retrieved 5 December 2013. ==Public image== [[File:Cannes 2015 25.jpg|thumb|Goulart at the [[2015 Cannes Film Festival]].]] In 2007, Goulart won the Cool Magazine's "Toshiba Cool Planet Award" in the category of "Best Model". As a Victoria's Secret Angel, she was chosen as one of ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazine's annual "100 Most Beautiful People in the World" in May 2007."[http://www.people.com/people/package/video/0,,20034523_20036555_20036614,00.html The Models of Victoria's Secret] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071030141244/http://www.people.com/people/package/video/0,,20034523_20036555_20036614,00.html |date=2007-10-30 }}", ''[[People (magazine)|People]]''. Retrieved 13 January 2014. ==Personal life== She can speak English and French.[https://www.gq.com/women/photos/201110/model-izabel-goulart-victorias-secret-interview#slide=7 Model Behaviour: Izabel Goulart - GQ.com] (11 October 2011). Retrieved 29 November 2013. Goulart, whose brother has [[type 1 diabetes]],{{cite web|url=http://www.diabetesresearch.org/Newsroom/NewsReleases/DRIFoundation/IzabelGoulartServesasInternationalAmbassador.htm|title=Supermodel Izabel Goulart Parts With Diabetes Research Institute Foundation as International Ambassador|work=Diabetes Research Institute|date=2009-04-24|accessdate=2009-12-18|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091217061425/http://www.diabetesresearch.org/Newsroom/NewsReleases/DRIFoundation/IzabelGoulartServesasInternationalAmbassador.htm|archivedate=2009-12-17|df=}} does charitable work, helping hospitals in her native Brazil to raise money to provide free insulin for diabetic children in need. She also has taken an active role with the Diabetes Research Institute (DRI) at the [[University of Miami]], a recognized leader in cure-focused research. In 2009, Goulart became the DRI's international ambassador and in that role helps to promote the work of the DRI throughout her travels. In 2009 she began engaged to Brazilian footballer [[Marcelo Costa]], but they are no longer a couple.[http://theboyfriend.net/izabel-goulart-boyfriend/ Izabel Goulart boyfriend]. In 2016 she began dating German goalkeeper of [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.]], [[Kevin Trapp]].[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-4065660/She-s-beach-bum-VS-Angel-Izabel-Goulart-flaunts-derriere-packs-PDA-St-Barts-getaway.html She's a beach bum! VS Angel Izabel Goulart flaunts derriere as she packs on the PDA during St Barts getaway] On July 5, 2018, they became engaged.[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-5921631/Izabel-Goulart-reveals-sh.html Izabel Goulart is engaged to Kevin Trapp... as model shows off huge diamond ring on Instagram][https://oglobo.globo.com/ela/gente/izabel-goulart-fica-noiva-de-kevin-trapp-goleiro-do-paris-saint-german-22853852 Izabel Goulart fica noiva de Kevin Trapp, goleiro do Paris Saint-German (in Portuguese)] ==Notable appearances== *Goulart appeared in an episode of ''[[Two and a Half Men]]'' ([[Two and a Half Men (season 4)|season 4]], episode 9: "Corey's Been Dead for an Hour")."[http://imdb.com/title/tt0898835/fullcredits Two and a Half Men]". imdb.com. Retrieved on 2007-11-25. *She made a guest appearance in the thirteenth episode of Season 3 of ''[[Entourage (U.S. TV series)|Entourage]]'' alongside fellow Angel [[Alessandra Ambrosio]]. * Goulart was featured at the end of the [[2016 Summer Olympics closing ceremony]] in Rio. The ceremony ended with a fireworks display and a tribute to Rio's signature event, [[Rio Carnival|the Carnival]], which showcased Brazil's musical dance culture. The 250-person strong parade was led by Izabel Goulart and street cleaner [[Renato Sorriso]], with the carnival anthem ''[[Cidade Maravilhosa]]'' playing in the background.{{cite news|title=Rio Olympics 2016: Spectacular closing ceremony as Olympic flag goes to Tokyo|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/olympics/37150572|accessdate=22 August 2016|work=BBC Sport}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commons}} {{wikiquote}} * {{Official website|http://modelizabelgoulart.com/}} * {{Fashionmodel}} * {{IMDb name|2141112}} * {{models.com}} * {{Style.com model|3588|archived=20140704045751}} * [http://models.com/model_culture/model_of_week/izabel/ Izabel Goulart featured as MODELS.com's Model of the Week] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080905122044/http://www.askmen.com/celebs/women/models_300/371_izabel_goulart.html Izabel Goulart] profile at Askmen.com * {{NYmag model|izabel|goulart}} * [http://www.lianxio.com/2016/05/izabel-goulart-2016-amfar-new-york-gala.html Izabel Goulart] – 2016 amfAR New York Gala in NYC {{Navboxes |title=Izabel Goulart navigational boxes |list1= {{Victoria's Secret Angels}} {{2000–2009 Victoria's Secret Fashion Show models}} {{2010–2019 Victoria's Secret Fashion Show models}} {{2010–2019 Sports Illustrated Swimsuit}} }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Goulart, Izabel}} [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from São Carlos]] [[Category:Brazilian people of Portuguese descent]] [[Category:Brazilian people of Italian descent]] [[Category:Brazilian female models]] [[Category:Footballers' wives and girlfriends]]

revision.text:
'''Job Jean Black Komol Ngolo Boue Kouch''' (born 1 December 1981 in [[Douala]])<ref>[http://www.veilingnotaris.nl/veilingen/9313/janslangstraat_14-6_arnhem?tab=voorwaarden]</ref> is a [[Cameroon]]ian [[Association football|football]] defender.
Komol played at Rail FC in Douala<ref>[http://www.vitesse-agovv.nl/Oud_spelers/Speler/Job-Komol.html]</ref> and was spotted at a youth tournament in France with the Cameroonian youth squad by [[Jan Streuer]] who brought him alongside [[Émile Mbamba]] and [[Soné Masué Kallé]] in the [[Vitesse Arnhem]] youth academy in the [[Netherlands]] in 1997. Komol was doing well in the youth and in the second team and he was training with the first team.<ref>[http://www.trouw.nl/tr/nl/4324/nieuws/article/detail/1203028/2008/11/22/Ook-toptalent-strandt-soms-onderweg.dhtml Ook toptalent strandt soms onderweg], Trouw, 22 November 2008</ref> On November 15, 2000, Vitesse chairman Jos Vaessen announced that Komol tested positive for [[HIV]].<ref>[http://archief.nrc.nl/?modus=l&text=Job+Komol&hit=3&set=1&check=Y Vitesse: speler met hiv besmet], NRC Handelsblad, 16 November 2000</ref> Komol was the first player in Dutch football with HIV and this caused a shock. Clubs started testing their players and questions arose over whether the disease could be transmitted during the game. Komol's playing license was suspended by the [[KNVB]]. Research showed that the risk of transmission during the game was less than 0.1% in Komol's case.<ref>[http://archief.nrc.nl/?modus=l&text=Job+Komol&hit=2&set=2&check=Y `Besmettingsgevaar sporters is nihil'], NRC Handelsblad, 21 November 2000</ref>
He was allowed to play again but the treatment of his disease prevented him from making the Vitesse team again. Because of his disease, Komol was granted [[permanent residency]] in The Netherlands. In 2005, he had an unsuccessful trial at [[Go Ahead Eagles]] and he played in the 2007/08 season at [[De Bataven]] in the [[Hoofdklasse]]. In 2008, he started playing at lower amateurside SMC<ref>[http://www.trouw.nl/tr/nl/4324/nieuws/article/detail/1203028/2008/11/22/Ook-toptalent-strandt-soms-onderweg.dhtml Ook toptalent strandt soms onderweg], Trouw, 22 November 2008</ref> and since 2010 he plays at vv Erica'76, which merged to VV Dieren in 2012.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Komol, Job}} [[Category:1981 births]] [[Category:Cameroonian footballers]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in the Netherlands]] [[Category:SBV Vitesse players]] [[Category:People with HIV/AIDS]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Association footballers not categorized by position]]

'''John Bolitho''' (1930–2005; Cornish Jowan Bolitho) was born in [[Bude]] in [[Cornwall]], and spent his working life in the [[Royal Navy]], the theatre and television (including performances in the [[Black and White Minstrel Show]], the [[Royal Variety Performance]] and the [[Billy Cotton Band Show]]),<ref name=CornishLives>{{cite book |last= Smelt |first= Maurice |title= 101 Cornish Lives |year= 2006 |publisher= Alison Hodge |location= [[Penzance]] |isbn= 0-906720-50-8}}</ref> and business.
He was the Grand Bard of the [[Gorseth Kernow]] between 2000 and 2003 with the [[bardic name]] of "Jowan an Cleth". During this time he visited many Cornish bards in [[Australia]] and was made patron of the Cornish Association of [[Victoria, Australia|Victoria]]. He also helped create the official website for Gorseth Kernow.<ref>[http://www.gorsethkernow.org.uk/english/gallery/grandbards/gallbard.htm List of Grand Bards] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090830010809/http://www.gorsethkernow.org.uk/english/gallery/grandbards/gallbard.htm |date=2009-08-30 }}</ref>
It is recorded that John Bolitho was the first man to speak [[Cornish language|Cornish]] at the [[European Parliament]] in [[Strasbourg]].<ref>[http://www.gorsethkernow.org.uk/english/news/jbobit.htm First man to speak Cornish at the European Parliament in Strasbourg] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081121212451/http://www.gorsethkernow.org.uk/english/news/jbobit.htm |date=2008-11-21 }}</ref>
He also served as a [[North Cornwall]] District [[councillor]], a [[Bude-Stratton]] town councillor, and was [[Mebyon Kernow]] parliamentary candidate for [[North Cornwall (UK Parliament constituency)|North Cornwall]].<ref name=obit>[http://www.greatatlanticway.com/JBGBeulogy08dec05.pdf Obituary]</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

{{cornwall-stub}}

'''Kaye Wellings''' is an active Sexual and Reproductive Health educator and has worked within this field of study for over 20 years. She has a strong interest in evaluation research, particularly in relation to preventive intervention and has assessed major national and international sexual health programmes, including AIDS preventive strategies in European countries and the English government’s Teenage Pregnancy Strategy.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://theconversation.com/profiles/kaye-wellings-110032|title=Kaye Wellings|website=The Conversation|language=en|access-date=2018-02-15}}</ref> Much of her working life has been spent researching sensitive topics, including not only sexual behaviour but also risk practices relating to drug use and in prison populations and the taboo of birth contraceptives in her early years.
== Early and current career == After graduation, Wellings moved to London as a public health and social scientist. For some time, Wellings worked in journalism with journal New Society until continuing on to work with the Family Planning Association in health policy research. The next few years brought on the continuing [[HIV]]/[[HIV/AIDS|AIDS]] epidemic in which Wellings monitored responses amongst the public as Senior Research Officer at the Health Education Authority (HEA). There was some conflict with methods used to handle and distribute research to the media, where Wellings and other researchers had one idea of presentation while politicians had another. “My experience there made me seek a safe haven in academia, where I could tell the story as it was, without having to suppress data or manipulate angles”, states Wellings.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Lane|first=Richard|date=2013-11-30|title=Kaye Wellings: pioneering figure in sexual health|url=http://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(13)62346-6/fulltext|journal=The Lancet|language=English|volume=382|issue=9907|doi=10.1016/S0140-6736(13)62346-6|issn=0140-6736}}</ref>
Currently, Wellings is a Professor of Sexual and Reproductive Health Research at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine (LSHTM)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lshtm.ac.uk/|title=The London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine|website=LSHTM|language=en|access-date=2018-02-15}}</ref> and co-leader of the third British [[National Survey of Sexual Attitudes and Lifestyles]].
Wellings co-writes several academic research papers with purpose to describe time trends and current patterns in sexual practices with opposite-sex partners among men and women aged 16–24 years in Britain, noting that more and younger folk are participating in sexual practices in more diverse ways.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/health-42051827|title=Millennials 'experimenting more in bed'|date=2017-11-20|work=BBC News|access-date=2018-02-15|language=en-GB}}</ref>
== Accomplishments == 1987-A founder of the first National Survey or Sexual Attitudes and Lifestyles. Wellings is a member of the WHO's Gender and Rights Advisory Panel and Human Reproduction Scientific Advisory Group.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ich/short-courses-events/about-otto-wolff-lectures/owl-archive/owl-february-2015|title=Changes in young people’s sexual behaviour – for better or worse?|website=www.ucl.ac.uk|language=en|access-date=2018-02-15}}</ref>
== Awards == Fellow ad eundem of the Royal College of Obstetricians & Gynaecologists (2003).<ref>{{cite web|title=Fellow ad eundem|url=https://www.rcog.org.uk/en/about-us/membership/membership-categories/fellows-ad-eundem/|website=Royal College of Obstetricians & Gynaecologists|accessdate=7 March 2018}}</ref> This is awarded to those who have contributed to the advancement of the science or practice of O&G, though not members of the College.
[[Fellow of the Academy of Social Sciences]] (2017).<ref>{{cite web|title=Sixty-nine leading social scientists conferred as Fellows of the Academy of Social Sciences|url=https://www.acss.org.uk/news/sixty-nine-leading-social-scientists-conferred-fellows-academy-social-sciences/|website=Academy of Social Sciences|accessdate=7 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.acss.org.uk/news/forty-seven-leading-social-scientists-conferred-fellows-academy-social-sciences/|title=Forty-seven leading social scientists conferred as Fellows of the Academy of Social Sciences {{!}}|website=www.acss.org.uk|language=en-GB|access-date=2018-10-16}}</ref>
== Published works == Sexual Function Problems And Help Seeking Behaviour In Britain: National Probability Sample Survey (co-written).<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Mercer|first=Catherine H.|last2=Fenton|first2=Kevin A.|last3=Johnson|first3=Anne M.|last4=Wellings|first4=Kaye|last5=MacDowall|first5=Wendy|last6=McManus|first6=Sally|last7=Nanchahal|first7=Kiran|last8=Erens|first8=Bob|date=2003|title=Sexual Function Problems And Help Seeking Behaviour In Britain: National Probability Sample Survey|jstor=25455330|journal=BMJ: British Medical Journal|volume=327|issue=7412|pages=426–427}}</ref>
Wellings, K., Mitchell, K., & Collumbien, M. (Eds.) (2012). ''Sexual Health: A Public Health Perspective.'' Maidenhead, Berkshire: Open University Press. {{ISBN|9780335244829}}
Link to National Survey of Sexual Attitudes and Lifestyles Wikipedia article:[[National Survey of Sexual Attitudes and Lifestyles|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Survey_of_Sexual_Attitudes_and_Lifestyles]]
== References == <!-- Inline citations added to your article will automatically display here. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WP:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --> {{reflist}}

{{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{More footnotes|date=January 2012}} [[File:Lucy, Lady Houston.jpg|thumb|Lucy, Lady Houston]] '''Lucy, Lady Houston, [[Order of British Empire|DBE]]''' (8 April 1857 – 29 December 1936), born '''Fanny Lucy Radmall''', was a British philanthropist, political activist, and suffragette.<ref name=Sentinel>{{cite news|title=Astonishing Exploits of England's "Lady Bountiful"|newspaper=[[Milwaukee Journal Sentinel|Milwaukee Sentinel]]|date=7 February 1937|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1368&dat=19370207&id=0RhQAAAAIBAJ&sjid=ywwEAAAAIBAJ&pg=6548,1096371&hl=en}}</ref> Beginning in 1933, she published Britain's ''[[Saturday Review (London)|Saturday Review]]'',<ref name=Sentinel/> which was best known for its attacks on what the paper labelled the "unpatriotic" [[National Government (United Kingdom)|National Government]] of [[Ramsay MacDonald]]. She has been acknowledged as an aviation pioneer, "the saviour of the [[Spitfire]]".<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/history/battle-of-britain/8002754/Saviour-of-the-Spitfire.html |title=Saviour of the Spitfire |publisher=Telegraph |date= |accessdate=2016-12-21}}</ref>
==Early life== Fanny Lucy Radmall was the daughter of Thomas Radmall, a woollen warehouseman and draper, and Maria Isabella Clark. She was born at 13 Lower Kennington Green, [[Lambeth]], the ninth child of ten children. As a young woman, she was a professional dancer, a [[chorus girl]] known as "Poppy". At the age of sixteen, she ran off to Paris with a wealthy man twice her age, Frederick Gretton, [[Baron Gretton|whose family]] owned the [[Bass Brewery]].<ref name=Telegraph>{{cite news|title=Saviour of the Spitfire|author=Peter Almond|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=15 September 2010|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/history/battle-of-britain/8002754/Saviour-of-the-Spitfire.html}}</ref> He was married at the time. Despite a tumultuous relationship, Gretton bequeathed Poppy £6,000 per year for life when he died in 1882.<ref name=Telegraph/>
==First two marriages== On 3 September 1883, she married [[Lieutenant-Colonel|Lt.-Col.]] Sir Theodore Francis Brinckman, [[Brinckman baronets|3rd Baronet]] (1862–1937), the couple divorcing in 1895 after a long separation. She remarried in 1901, to [[George Byron, 9th Baron Byron|George Frederick William Byron, 9th Baron Byron]]. During their marriage, she was an active [[suffragette]].<ref name=Telegraph/> He died in 1917, the same year Lucy, then Baroness Byron, was appointed [[Dame (title)|Dame Commander, Order of the British Empire]] (DBE) for her support of a home for nurses who had served in the [[World War I|First World War]].<ref name=Telegraph/>
==Marriage to Sir Robert Houston== Her third and final marriage was to [[Sir Robert Houston, 1st Baronet]], Member of Parliament for [[Liverpool West Toxteth (UK Parliament constituency)|West Toxteth]], and a shipping [[Business magnate|magnate]], on 12 December 1924. Houston is described in the ''[[Oxford Dictionary of National Biography]]'' as "a hard, ruthless, unpleasant bachelor". They lived as [[tax exile]]s on the island of [[Jersey]]. When Sir Robert showed her his will, Lady Houston reportedly tore it up, telling him that £1,000,000 was insufficient.<ref name=Telegraph/> Sir Robert then suffered a series of mental disorders and reportedly employed a [[food taster]] to ensure that he was not being poisoned. Sir Robert died on his yacht ''[[SY Liberty|Liberty]]'', on 14 April 1926, leaving his widow roughly £5.5 million.<ref name=Telegraph/>
Lady Houston left Jersey on the ''Liberty'', negotiating with the British Government during passage to England the payment of £1.6 million in death duties. According to the ''Oxford Dictionary of National Biography'', "she paid for nine by-election meetings by the [[National Government (United Kingdom)|British National Government]] to be disrupted".<ref name=ODNB>''Oxford Dictionary of National Biography'' (2004 edition), volume 28, p. 299</ref>
==The Schneider Trophy== {{main|Schneider Trophy}} Lady Houston gave generously to British aviation. In 1931, she donated £100,000 to [[Supermarine]], allowing them to win the [[Schneider Trophy]] in that year. The [[Royal Air Force]]'s entry for the 1931 race for the trophy was hindered by political opposition. On 15 January 1931, the [[Air Ministry]] refused a last-minute request by the [[Royal Aero Club]] for funds for an entry. The Ministry forbade the use of the aircraft that competed in the 1929 race; forbade RAF pilots of the [[High Speed Flight RAF|High Speed Flight]] who were trained to fly these seaplanes, to take part; and said that it would not police the race course in 1931 in the busy shipping lanes in the [[Solent]]. The Royal Aero Club sent a statement to the Cabinet on 22 January 1931, offering to raise £100,000, if the Government would rescind the Air Ministry's decrees on planes, pilots and policing.
Many newspapers backing the opposition [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]] wanted to put pressure on [[Ramsay MacDonald]]'s [[Second MacDonald ministry|Labour government]]. One newspaper sent a telegram to MacDonald stating that, "To prevent the socialist government from being spoilsports, Lady Houston will be responsible for all extra expenses beyond what Sir [[Philip Sassoon]] (President of the Royal Aero Club) says can be found, so that Great Britain can take part in the race for the Schneider trophy." The gift gave Lady Houston an opportunity to attack the Labour government, with the declaration "Every true Briton would rather sell his last shirt than admit that England could not afford to defend herself."<ref name=ODNB/>
There were only nine months to prepare, and so Supermarine's designer [[Reginald Mitchell]] could only update the existing airframes. [[Rolls-Royce Limited|Rolls-Royce]] increased the power of the [[Rolls-Royce R|R-Type engine]] by 400 hp to 2,300 hp. The improved [[Supermarine S.6B]] won the trophy, though the technical achievement is slightly tarnished{{Citation needed|date=April 2018}} by the fact two S6Bs and an S6 were the only participants. (One S6B later broke the air speed record.)
Lady Houston's gift provided a valuable impetus to the development of the engine technology that would ultimately be vital in the [[World War II|Second World War]], and in particular the [[Battle of Britain]]. The lessons learned in building racing seaplanes also helped Mitchell to develop the [[Supermarine Spitfire]]. As [[Arthur Sidgreaves]], the managing director of Rolls-Royce, commented at the time, "It is not too much to say that research for the Schneider Trophy contest over the past two years is what our aero-engine department would otherwise have taken six to ten years to learn."{{Citation needed|date=January 2012}}
==Later life== In 1932, she offered to give £200,000 to strengthen the British army and navy. The [[National Government 1931–1935|National Government]] refused. She hung a huge electric sign, "DOWN WITH MACDONALD THE TRAITOR", in the rigging of ''[[HMNS Liberty|Liberty]]'' and sailed round Great Britain.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,758839,00.html#ixzz1IRmvyLzH|title=Names make news|publisher=CNN/Time Magazine|date=10 January 1938|accessdate=3 April 2011}}</ref> In a telegram to the Prime Minister, she wrote:
{{quote|I alone have dared to point out the dire need for air defence of London. You have muzzled others who have deplored this shameful neglect. You have treated my patriotic gesture with a contempt such as no other government would have been guilty of toward a patriot.}}
In 1933, she financed the [[Houston-Mount Everest Flight Expedition]], in which aircraft flew over the summit of [[Everest]] for the first time. This was to show opposition to granting [[Indian independence movement|independence to India]]. In October 1934, Lady Houston sent a cable to the winners of the [[MacRobertson Air Race|MacRobertson England to Melbourne Air Race]], [[Tom Campbell Black]] and [[C. W. A. Scott]]: "Your achievement has thrilled me through, oh brave men of my heart... If this does not make the Government sit up, nothing will ... Sleep well and feel proud of yourselves, as we all are ... [[Rule Britannia]]. God bless you both."<ref>Transcript from ''The Daily Mirror'' newspaper, Wednesday, 24 October 1934, p. 3. "Brave Men Of My Heart" telegram by Lady Houston to Mr CWA Scott.</ref>
==Death== Lady Houston was so upset by the [[Abdication Crisis]] in 1936 that she stopped eating and died of a heart attack on 29 December 1936, aged 79, at her home, Byron Cottage, [[Hampstead Heath]]. She had no children and left no current will,<ref name=Sentinel/> so administration was granted to her sole surviving sibling, Mrs Florence Wrey, of more than 1.5 million pounds.{{Citation needed|date=January 2012}}
==In film== Lady Houston, her donation to Supermarine and the electric sign in the rigging were depicted in the 1942 film ''[[The First of the Few]]'', though the sign more diplomatically states: "Down with the government. Wake up, England!"{{citation needed|date=November 2016}}
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20061013075335/http://www.rjmitchell-spitfire.co.uk/schneidertrophy/1931.asp?sectionID=2 ''A life in aviation'' by RJ Mitchell] (includes a photo of Lady Houston) * [http://www.politicalcartoon.co.uk/html/history14.htm Cartoon history – "Colonel Blimps' England"] – includes several quotations * {{cite news|title=Lady & Lion|date=27 November 1933|work=[[Time Magazine]]|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,746350,00.html|accessdate=9 August 2008}}, Monday, 27 November 1933 * [http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,770557,00.html ''Time Magazine'' article], Monday, 25 January 1937 (subscription required) * [http://www.supermarine-spitfire.co.uk/1931_race.htm 1931 race] (includes another photo of Lady Houston) * [http://www.npg.org.uk/collections/search/person/mp98118/dame-fanny-lucy-houston-nee-radmall Photos] in the [[National Portrait Gallery, London|National Portrait Gallery]]

'''Sister Mary Elizabeth Clark''' (born 1938, in [[Pontiac, Michigan]]) is the main mover of the [[AIDS Education and Global Information System]] database, previously a pre-[[World Wide Web]] [[bulletin board system]].<ref>{{cite web|title=About: AEGiS History|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071022055127/http://www.aegis.org/about/about.htm |archive-date=October 22, 2007|url=http://www.aegis.org/about |publisher=AIDS Education Global information System. aegis.org |access-date=2017-01-28}}</ref>
Clark served as a [[United States Navy]] chief petty officer (E-7), serving as an instructor in [[anti-submarine warfare]]. She later underwent a [[sex change operation]] and became '''Joanna Clark'''; knowing of her past,<ref>Duke, "Transsexual Wars with the Army," Los Angeles Times (Sept 14, 1977)</ref> a [[United States Army Reserve|U.S. Army Reserve]]s recruiter signed her up for the Army, which she enlisted <!--not a mistake--> in 1976.<ref>[http://www.thecrystalclub.org/chron/9811.html The Crystal Chronicle, November 1998]. Thecrystalclub.org. Retrieved on 2015-06-02.</ref> A year-and-a-half later she was nominated for promotion to Warrant Officer. Her enlistment was voided when her history became known to higher-ups. She brought suit against the Army and won a settlement of $25,000 and an honorable discharge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ww1.aegis.org/news/lt/1997/lt971201.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130223061053/http://ww1.aegis.org/news/lt/1997/lt971201.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=February 23, 2013 |title=A Life of Service: Sister Mary, whose past has seen many painful twists and turns, now brings comfort to others with the world's most comprehensive Web site on AIDS and HIV |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=December 1, 1997 |accessdate=2013-05-09 |author=Pasco, Jean O. }}</ref><ref>[https://archive.is/20130223061657/http://ww1.aegis.org/news/misc/2005/UPD050301.html Article from transsexual community publication Update profiling Sr. Mary Elizabeth]</ref>
During the 1970s, she was an activist for the rights of [[transsexual]]s and was instrumental in winning the right of [[California]]ns to have their gender changed on their birth-certificates and driver's licenses. In 1980, she founded and led the ACLU Transsexual Rights Committee.
In the 1980s, she felt a religious calling and worked to become an [[Episcopal Church in the United States of America|Episcopal]] sister. Conflict with the church led to her leaving it shortly after she took her vows in 1988, and she has since become a sister of the [[American Catholic Church in the United States|American Catholic Church]], a small independent church using [[Catholic]] rites.
Also in the 1980s she continued the work of the [[Erickson Educational Foundation]], aiding transgender people.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Transsexualism and Sex Reassignment|last=Green|first=Richard|last2=Money|first2=John|publisher=The Johns Hopkins University Press|year=1969|isbn=978-0801810381|location=|pages=|via=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dallasdenny.com/Writing/2013/08/22/the-impact-of-emerging-technologies-on-one-transgender-organizationthe-impact-of-emerging-technologies-on-one-transgender-organizationthe-impact-of-emerging-technologies-on-one-transgender-organizatio/|title=The Impact of Emerging Technologies on One Transgender Organization|last=Denny|first=Dallas|authorlink=Dallas Denny|date=August 22, 2013|website=[[Dallas Denny]]: Body of Work|publisher=Dallas Denny|access-date=August 20, 2016}}</ref>
In 1990, inspired by meeting an isolated young man with [[AIDS]] in rural [[Missouri]], she returned to her family home in [[San Juan Capistrano]], taking on the [[bulletin board system]] AEGiS begun by [[Jamie Jemison]] and eventually building it into the largest AIDS information database in the world.
She is the recipient of the Award of Courage from the [[American Foundation for AIDS Research]],<ref>http://www.amfar.org/spotlight/article.aspx?id=4500</ref> the [[Jonathan Mann Award for Health and Human Rights]] from the International Association of Physicians in AIDS Care,<ref>[http://www.gaylifeuk.com/news/3097-elton-john-honoured-by-iapac.html Elton John honoured by IAPAC]. GayLifeUK (2003-05-20). Retrieved on 2015-06-02.</ref> the Crystal Heart award from the San Diego GLBT Center and the Joan of Arc award from the [[Orange County, California|Orange County]] Community Foundation. In 2005 she was nominated for the [[Nobel Peace Prize]].
